story:
*Please note that Canadian tax receipts will be issued following the close of our campaign



Heart to Heart

"I discovered that it’s okay to argue. Before I thought that it’s not okay to argue and everyone has to agree. I was afraid of disagreement but now I found out that it helps us to move forward, to understand and talk about things so we can improve them."

- Sivan Polonski, 2014 participant

The Heart to Heart program brings a group of twenty Israeli teenagers to Canada every summer. Half of our participants identify as Palestinian Israeli, and half as Jewish Israeli. Upon arriving in Canada, the group spends two and a half weeks living together at Camp Shomria, an overnight summer camp near Ottawa. Daily activities include team-building workshops, camping trips, and facilitated dialogue about the narratives, politics, and power dynamics that participants face in their daily lives at home. The group also visits Parliament Hill in Ottawa, and spends four days living with Canadian host families while touring Toronto. The time spent in Canada is a focal point for the group, but it is complemented by workshops for participants at the Givat Haviva campus and in their respective communities leading up to and after their trip.


Educational Goals
Our program is built on four central educational goals; 1) Critical thinking and reflection; 2) Group-building, communication, and teamwork; 3) Adaptability, autonomy, and resiliency; 4) Achieve a balance between hope and realistic expectations. Click HERE to learn more about our educational programming.

Why We Exist
Heart to Heart was founded in 2011 as a partnership between the Givat Haviva Education Foundation in Israel and Hashomer Hatzair/Camp Shomria in Canada. Givat Haviva is an Israeli non-profit organization dedicated to promoting mutual responsibility, civic equality, and cooperation among divided groups in Israel. Givat Haviva ensures parity between Palestinian and Jewish Israeli leadership at every administrative level, and was awarded the UNESCO Prize for Peace Education in 2001.

Heart to Heart was founded as a response to the structural inequity and racism in Israeli society. We do not believe that peer-education among Jewish and Palestinian Israeli youth is the entire solution to creating an equitable, shared society. However, we do believe that it is an important part of the solution. As we head into our fifth year, Heart to Heart has equipped 80 program alumni with newfound perspectives and skills and the motivation they need to determine for themselves what a solution may look like, as well as how they can continue contributing to it. 

At Heart to Heart, we are building a generation of leaders who will both recognize the importance of creating a truly shared society, and possess the skills they need to make it a reality. We hope you will join us in continuing to make this incredible journey a reality for the next generation of Palestinian and Jewish Israeli leaders.


What We Need and What Happens If We Exceed Our Goal?

After a successful four years of Heart to Heart we know that this program has a profound impact on our participants, their families and communities, as well as the community at Camp Shomria and in Toronto. To make this program a reality we need the support of people like you who understand the importance of this kind of work.

This year our target of $90,000 represents the cost of running the Heart to Heart program,  the cost of creating an amazing 30 minute documentary film (soon to be subtitled in Arabic and Hebrew so that the participants can use it to share their experiences with their schools and communities) and $28,000 to launch an alumni program in time for this year's participants return to Israel at the end of the summer.

We have set our fundraising goal at $5,000 which represents only a fraction of what it takes to bring our twenty Heart to Heart participants. We are hoping to far exceed our goal!

Alumni Program

We know that Heart to Heart is a program that creates real impact. We also know that in order for this impact to be sustained over the long term, participants must have an ongoing learning process and structure of support when they return to Israel. That is why we are excited to launch our Heart to Heart Alumni Program.

At the end of this summer, Heart to Heart will have 100 alumni - it is our hope to be able to launch the program in time for this summer's participants' return to Israel after the program so that they will be able to be the first ever group to transition directly into a continuation program. To launch our alumni program we need to raise an additional $28,000.

For further details regarding the alumni program please contact Jenny Isaacs at jennyaisaacs@gmail.com

Other Ways to Donate

Aside from our Indiegogo campaign home, you can also donate to Heart to Heart by cheque, credit card over the phone, or through Canadahelps. For details please go to our Heart to Heart website by clicking here. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support the program, aside from making a financial contribution. Attending the reception to learn more and meet this year’s youths, hosting a participant during their stay in Toronto, and helping to spread the word by talking to your friends and  family and sharing our campaign online are all greatly appreciated!

If you are interested in helping out in any way, please contact the Program Coordinator at heart2heart@campshomria.ca. 

Tax Receipts

We are able to issue tax receipts for donations made via Indiegogo! To receive a tax receipt please ensure that you collect a perk and leave us your home address so we can issue the receipt! Please note that all tax receipts will be issued by Hashomer Hatzair, the umbrella organization of Heart to Heart. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Future for the children of Kratie, Cambodia

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to live in a rural village in one of the poorest countries in the world? What it would be like to have no job opportunities in your home country, especially if you had no chance of going abroad? Have you ever thought about the importance of learning English, in order to evolve and improve your chances of having a better future in a country where even the weather has a huge impact on class attendance and development?

My name is Yuth and in 2016 I founded the Dolphin School of English (DSE) in Kratie, Cambodia. The aim of this project is to provide free English classes to underprivileged and vulnerable children from the surrounding villages. Job opportunities in Cambodia are quite limited, especially in rural areas, so having a good knowledge of English can make a huge difference to these children’s future lives. Through learning this invaluable skill they could opt to work in the tourism industry, to work for international companies or even to move abroad to discover other countries. The number of opportunities dramatically increases. Furthermore, this project aims to provide the children with IT skills, nowadays essential to have access to the professional world.

Many of our students (198) come from poor, single-parent families with social issues. Some of their parents work long hours in unskilled jobs, therefore they do not have much time to spend with the children. As a result, a lot of these children become disengaged in school. Due to poverty, the families are also illiterate and do not see the importance of good education, thus perpetuating the poverty cycle.

Currently, we have 160 to 190 (a survey data by Mr. Bill and Ms. Heidi from Australia) regular students who come to classes every Monday to Sunday in three different locations in Kratie province. Volunteers from all over the world come year round to keep this project alive, teaching in the Dolphin School of English and in other locations in the Kratie area, both urban and rural. Although some volunteers do provide school materials or make donations, Dolphin School of English and the students rely on funds to renew the school materials and also to extend and improve the premises and to protect the children from the rain and wind. Our classes are held under shelter,but without walls and in rural Cambodia the weather is often a reason to interrupt a lesson. Apart from these needs, we also would like to raise more funds to buy two small blocks of land, on a local island and in the countryside area, that would become part of the Dolphin School of English and enable us to reach even more children and young adults on a daily basis,and teach them the skills they need to improve their future prospects.

Our students are very motivated to learn but we want to provide them a more comfortable learning environment so they can concentrate and learn better, with no distractions.

Apart from taking lessons, Dolphin School of English is a meeting point for many children in the village after their school classes, where they can learn and play in a safe environment. Being surrounded by volunteers from all over the world benefits them as they can learn from many different cultures and ways of life. At the same time, they have a space to play instead of being at home alone or assuming some adults’ roles.

In order to offer children a safe and fulfilling environment, the school still has to do some work like enlarging the roof and the terrace, building walls to separate the classes, but also purchasing the school materials. Approximately $5000 would be required for the project. We appeal to your generosity to help us in this fundraiser, so children can benefit from a place to learn and develop in the best conditions. Every donation, whether large or small, will be greatly appreciated: if everyone helps according to their means, together we will reach our goal.

Please help us by making a donation or sharing with your friends and family about our work! You can visit our website here to learn more about this project. 

A small contribution can also go a long way! We greatly appreciate any help! 

Thank you for helping these children who want to have a better opportunity to realize their potential!

story:
Summary

We are a Consortium of 5 Universities and 4 Research Institutions based in Europe and we are running the excellence international Master program in Astronomy and Astrophysics "AstroMundus". Co-funding by the Erasmus+: Erasmus Mundus program of the European Union and by our Consortium allows us to offer yearly a number of scholarships to carefully selected, enthusiastic, top-ranked students from around the world. Applicants admitted to this unique program study in up to 4 of our Universities across Europe during the 2 years of the Master course. Most of our graduates successfully obtain PhD positions in Europe and elsewhere.

With this campaign we want to achieve something more.

We aim at financing further scholarships especially dedicated to excellent students from those world regions, where higher education in Astronomy and Astrophysics is not yet sufficiently developed or is still missing.

Within the AstroMundus program, these students will receive high-level education and training in this fast growing scientific field and acquire a number of skills that will enable them to embark in doctoral studies and become real experts. Eventually, they will bring back their knowledge to help develop Astrophysics in their home countries both at educational and research level and to foster the involvement of their home countries in large current and future programs of the international astronomical community.  This would in turn encourage technological advances in less developed world regions.

Update

Our campaign made it to the October 26th issue of the Italian astronomy and science outreach magazine Coelum Astronomia. Many thanks to the editorial board for giving space to our project!

Testimonials

In the videos here below, two AstroMundus graduates, Kristhell López López from Guatemala and Cosmos Dumba from Uganda, talk about their experience in AstroMundus. They explain how their career benefited from their participation in the program and why this will help the community in their home countries.


Endorsements

We are deeply grateful to the following renowned scientists, who are endorsing our program and this campaign in particular.

  • Craig L. Sarazin, W. H. Vanderbilt Professor of Astronomy, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA, USA:

  • Peter B. Stetson, Principal Research Officer at the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory, NRC Herzberg Institute of Astronomy and Astrophysics, and Adjunct Professor at the University of Victoria, Victoria, Canada  - June 14, 2016:
"I had the privilege of being an invited guest professor in Astrophysics with the AstroMundus programme at the Second University of Rome at Tor Vergata on three occasions: the spring semesters of 2011, 2014 and 2015. The students that I met in the Master course there came from highly varied backgrounds, but all were extremely bright, motivated, and enthusiastic. They were presented with quite challenging material, and seemed to absorb it with ease. They were able to acquire the fundamental knowledge and technical expertise necessary for placing them on a path toward sophisticated scientific insight and, in some cases, toward a promising career in astrophysics research. Financing the participation of very promising students who have little or no chance to study astrophysics in their home countries is not only an excellent way to nurture future generations of professional researchers and other scientifically literate citizens. It also makes a significant contribution toward erasing the remaining barriers to international understanding and cooperation in our world, especially in the areas of scientific and technological challenges."
 
  • Jan Palouš, Professor, Astronomical Institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague, Czech Republic, and member of the external Scientific Advisory Board for the evaluation of the AstroMundus program:

 

Our Campaign Goal

Astrophysics is a fast growing science field. While astrophysical research answers our need of understanding the Universe we live in, it also prompts the continuous development of new instruments and techniques that make an impact in many other fields and in our society. Scientific and instrumental projects are developed within large international collaborations that put together their resources to realize increasingly larger, powerful and technologically advanced telescopes, instruments, and space missions and to exploit the enormous flow of data coming from these facilities, as well as develop sophisticated computational models.
Yet, in many countries around the world high-level education in Astrophysics is still insufficiently developed or even missing.

What if we could offer scholarships to bright students from these countries to allow them to travel abroad and participate in an excellence international study program in Astrophysics? What if their dream of studying Astrophysics could come true and they could bring back their knowledge to their home Universities, contribute to start local study programs and take part in the scientific and technological initiatives of the international astronomical community? They would act as the seeds from which new opportunities of development would grow in their society, well beyond the specific field of Astrophysics.
This is the goal we want to achieve with our international Master program AstroMundus. This is what prompted us to start this campaign.

By supporting our campaign you can help us to make a difference and contribute to create new opportunities in developing countries.

Each year we invite and collect student applications from all over the world and select the best students for taking part in our international Master course.
From these applications it emerges that in many countries students receive an education in Physics and Mathematics, but those willing to pursue a career in Astrophysics need to move abroad, if they have a chance to do so, or have to abandon their dream.

Many applicants are motivated to participate in our program not only by the wish to pursue a field of study they are passionate about, but also by the desire to acquire professional knowledge that they could bring back to their home universities.
They want to make a difference in their home country by starting or helping to develop an educational path in Astrophysics at university level. This will open to many other students the possibility to exploit their potential and pursue a career in Astronomy and Astrophysics. At the same time, these future professionals will enable their institutions and countries to join the international community in ambitious and challenging projects.

The synergy between the five Universities and four associated partner research institutions that compose the AstroMundus Consortium, as well as their complementary fields of expertise allow our program to provide admitted students with an excellent background in Astrophysics and to introduce them to topics at the forefront of the astrophysical research. The partly flexible study path across the Consortium Universities exposes the students to a variety of teaching methods and research environments, helps them weaving their professional network in view of their future career, and gives them the opportunity to experience enriching cultural exchanges. The vast majority of AstroMundus graduates are now pursuing their career within doctoral programs at various prestigious institutions around the world. Hence, our program is optimally suited to train future professionals, who will be able to foster development in the world.

Primary Countries Targeted for Support

With the precious advice of the Office of Astronomy for Development (OAD) of the International Astronomical Union and its Regional Offices and based on our experience with past and current AstroMundus students, we defined the following countries and regions as primary targets for support through our campaign: 

  • Within the Andean Region of South America: Venzuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru - that have good undergraduate programs and are making efforts to further develop or start astronomical research - while considering Bolivia, as well (based on information from Jaime E. Forero-Romero, Associate Professor, Physics Department, Universidad de Los Andes, Bogota, Colombia - OAD Andean Regional Office) ;
  • Within Central America: Guatemala (based on our experience with former/current AstroMundus students);
  • Within East and Central Asia: Mongolia - where efforts are currently ongoing to set up a professional Astronomy program; Vietnam, that is currently expanding its astronomical community; Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan (based on information from Richard de Grijs, Full Professor, Kavli Institute for Astronomy and Astrophysics, Peking University, Beijing, China - East Asian Regional Node);
  • Among Portuguese speaking countries: Cape Verde, East Timor, Sao Tome, and Principe, where steps are being made to spread Astronomy at all levels (based on information from Sara Anjos, Project Coordinator NUCLIO, Núcleo Interativo de Astronomia, University of Porto, Portugal - Portuguese Language Expertise Centre for the OAD);
  • Within Southeastern Europe: Bosnia and Herzegovina and Macedonia (based on experience with former AstroMundus students);
  • East African region: the countries in the region are making efforts to enhance development in the Astronomy and Space Science field across the region. Young students from the region are inspired by applications of Astronomy and Space Sciences and are determined to pursue a career in the field, despite limited resources and opportunities (based on information from Kelali Tekle, Addis Ababa University, Ethiopia - OAD East African Regional Node and on experience with former AstroMundus students);
  • Within South Asia: Bangladesh and Nepal (based on our experience with former/current AstroMundus students and information from colleagues);
  • Within the Southern African region: Zambia, Zimbabwe and Mozambique as priority targets, while considering Namibia and Mauritius, too. All these countries are interested in starting or further developing Astronomy programs. Most of them are partner countries in the Square Kilometer Array project and hence are in strong need to enhance capacity to carry out research in Astronomy (based on information from Prospery C. Simpemba, The Copperbelt University, Department of Physics, Zambia - OAD Southern African Regional node).
  • West African countries, with particular attention to Ghana and Burkina Faso that are currently active in introducing Astronomy programs at undergraduate level (based on information from Bonaventure Okere, Assistant Director, Centre for Basic Space Science, Nsukka, Nigeria - OAD West African Regional Office);

The above list is not exhaustive. There are many more countries, where  higher education in Astrophysics needs to be developed. Therefore, depending on the nationality of the students who will submit an application before November 30th, 2016 and on the strength of their applications, we may consider financing through this campaign scholarships for nationals of additional such countries that are not yet explicitly mentioned in our primary target list.

All applications for participation in the AstroMundus program undergo a rigorous selection process aimed at promoting excellence. Scholarships are assigned on a competitive basis.

Use of Funds

The funds we will raise from this campaign (minus the 5% fee retained by the Indiegogo platform and the 3% to 5% fee applied by PayPal on transactions) will be entirely used to finance scholarships to enable selected, top-ranked students from our target world regions to participate in the AstroMundus international Master Course in Astronomy & Astrophysics.

We are currently collecting applications from international students who aim at participating in the 8th edition of our Masters Course, with deadline November 30th, 2016. With the funds made available by the Erasmus+ program and by the AstroMundus Consortium, we expect to be able to finance 12 scholarships for non-EU students and 5 scholarships for EU students. Based on our experience with the past 7 editions of the course, the number of promising international students that are selected based on their academic excellence and strong motivation largely exceeds the number of available scholarships.

We defined the initial goal amount of this campaign so that it would cover 2 additional scholarships, specifically intended for nationals of countries where the possibility of specializing in Astrophysics are scarce or missing. The amount is calculated as follows: each scholarship includes a contribution to the student's travel and installation expenses of 2,000 euro and a monthly allowance of 800 € for living expenses for the whole duration of the course (24 months).  The AstroMundus Consortium will contribute to these two scholarships by waiving the participation fees (18,000 Euro per student, for non-EU students) and covering with its own resources the student participation costs that include a full insurance package as well as registration and tuition costs. The above mentioned fees applied by Indiegogo and PayPal on the funds raised through the campaign have been included in the calculation.

Since this is a fixed-goal campaign, we will receive the funds only if our initial goal amount is reached. Each contribution will be essential to reach the goal!

In the ideal case that the amount raised with this campaign exceeds our initial goal, with the additional funds raised we will increment the two scholarships up to a maximum amount equivalent to an Erasmus+:Erasmus Mundus scholarship funded by the European Union, which is up to 7,000 euro as a contribution for the student's travel and installation expenses and a monthly allowance of 1,000 euro for the 24-month duration of the course.

If the generosity of our backers will make this campaign even more successful, we will use the additional funds to finance further scholarships. This would enable a larger number of promising students among the selected applicants to enroll in the Masters course, thus further increasing the impact of AstroMundus in training future astrophysics professionals and fostering development through them.

Rewards

This campaign aims at financing high-level instruction and training of future professionals as a mean to foster future scientific and technological development in less developed countries and world regions. Therefore, we cannot offer products as rewards, but we will demonstrate our gratitude by listing our supporters in our official website, mentioning them in the social networks, and in the acknowledgments section of Master theses and of any scientific publication resulting from Master student projects that benefited from this financial support. Our backers will have the opportunity to get in touch with the students and receive reports of their study progress. Depending on the chosen perk, we will provide our supporters with certificates that acknowledge their contribution,  exclusive astronomical images produced within our Consortium, or electronic copies of Master theses that were financed through this campaign.

Particularly generous supporters who choose to finance a quarter or a half of a scholarship or even an entire scholarship, in addition to all of the above, will have the partial or full scholarship officially entitled to them, will receive a printed copy of the student's thesis and will be invited to join the annual retreat of the program in summer 2018 and/or 2019.

Please note that because of PayPal restrictions on single payments, donations corresponding to a half or full scholarship need to be split into 2 or 4 payments, respectively.

Risk Assessment

The AstroMundus program is already running its 6th Edition (2nd year of course) and 7th Edition (1st year of course) and concluded successfully all previous editions. Our Consortium has already secured funds for running the 8th Edition of the course, for which additional scholarships are sought through this campaign.

Each year we received between  100 and 140 applications from all over the world, including from several of the countries and regions that are primary targets of this campaign. Some students from such regions actually participated in our Master course, while many others were selected but could not join because of limited financial resources. Hence we are very confident that this year, too, we will receive a number of applications by suitably qualified candidates, who would qualify for scholarships raised through this campaign.

In parallel to this campaign, we published a call for applications and we will select eligible participants among the applicants during the coming months. We are making additional efforts to advertise our call for applications in the target countries/regions of this campaign, to attract an even higher number of qualified applicants from such regions.

Participating students are supported through an intensive program of tutoring in order to maximize their chances of success in the program. However, should a funded student interrupt the studies at mid-course, the remaining part of the scholarship would be transferred to other participating students who only have a partial scholarship or are self-funding their studies.

 

The AstroMundus Program

 

Who we are

AstroMundus is coordinated by the University of Innsbruck (Austria) in partnership with the University of Göttingen (Germany), the University of Padova and the University of Rome 'Tor Vergata' (Italy), and the University of Belgrade (Serbia). The expertise in Astronomy and Astrophysics present in our universities is complemented by that of our Associated Partners, the Gran Sasso Science Institute in L'Aquila that is part of the Italian Institute for Nuclear Physics (INFN), the Italian National Institute of Astrophysics (INAF) in particular with the Astronomical Observatories of Padova (INAF-OAPd) and Rome (INAF-OAR), the Astronomical Observatory of Belgrade and the Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research (MPS) in Göttingen.

Our program

We started our adventure in 2009, when our proposed international study program was selected for funding by the European Commission (EC) as an Erasmus Mundus program for 5 course editions. In 2014 AstroMundus underwent a quality review by the EC. The very positive outcome of this evaluation led to the renewal of the program in 2015 for further 3 editions of the course with co-funding from the new Erasmus+: Erasmus Mundus program of the European Union.

AstroMundus offers an excellent educational level in all branches of Astrophysics, as ensured by the wide variety of expertise in the field covered by its international partnership.  Its main objective is to initiate and train students to scientific research with emphasis on the application of modern techniques in Astronomy and Astrophysics in the observational, theoretical, and computational domains. 

The program is entirely taught in English and is open to top-ranked students from all over the world. A committee including representatives of all AstroMundus Universities selects applicants on the basis of academic excellence and motivation. Participants study in at least 2 and up to 4 of the AstroMundus Universities during the 2 year-course, the last six months of which are dedicated to the Master thesis research project. After successful completion, they obtain an MSc Joint Degree from all Universities they studied at, which gives them access to doctoral programs. In addition, the variety of skills they acquire during their studies, make them well suited to a number of alternative careers outside of academia.

Our students and alumni

In autumn 2010 we welcomed our first batch of international students. Most of those students and those from subsequent editions have successfully completed the Master course and continued with PhD studies at various institutions around the world. Currently, the 6th edition of the program is at mid-course and the 7th edition has just started (here are the lists of our current students and alumni). Until now a total of 102 students from 43 different countries were enrolled in our program, including current students. We are now collecting applications for the course starting in October 2017. Close to 90% of the students who successfully completed the program obtained PhD positions, as visible in our alumni list. This is a very high rate, given the high competitiveness in the field and it highlights the success of our Master course.

Several of these students came from some of the world regions that we wish to support with this campaign. Your contribution will be invaluable for sustaining enough students to make an impact in these regions.

 

Disclaimer: The AstroMundus programme is co-funded by the Erasmus+ programme of the European Union.The European Commission support for the production of this page does not constitute an endorsement of the contents, which reflect the views only of the authors, and the Commission cannot be held responsi­ble for any use which may be made of the information contained therein.
story_txt:
Summary
We are a Consortium of 5 Universities and 4 Research Institutions based in Europe and we are running the excellence international Master program in Astronomy and Astrophysics "AstroMundus". Co-funding by the Erasmus+: Erasmus Mundus program of the European Union and by our Consortium allows us to offer yearly a number of scholarships to carefully selected, enthusiastic, top-ranked students from around the world. Applicants admitted to this unique program study in up to 4 of our Universities across Europe during the 2 years of the Master course. Most of our graduates successfully obtain PhD positions in Europe and elsewhere.
With this campaign we want to achieve something more.
We aim at financing further scholarships especially dedicated to excellent students from those world regions, where higher education in Astronomy and Astrophysics is not yet sufficiently developed or is still missing.
Within the AstroMundus program, these students will receive high-level education and training in this fast growing scientific field and acquire a number of skills that will enable them to embark in doctoral studies and become real experts. Eventually, they will bring back their knowledge to help develop Astrophysics in their home countries both at educational and research level and to foster the involvement of their home countries in large current and future programs of the international astronomical community.  This would in turn encourage technological advances in less developed world regions.
Update
Our campaign made it to the October 26th issue of the Italian astronomy and science outreach magazine Coelum Astronomia. Many thanks to the editorial board for giving space to our project!
Testimonials
In the videos here below, two AstroMundus graduates, Kristhell López López from Guatemala and Cosmos Dumba from Uganda, talk about their experience in AstroMundus. They explain how their career benefited from their participation in the program and why this will help the community in their home countries.


Endorsements
We are deeply grateful to the following renowned scientists, who are endorsing our program and this campaign in particular.
Craig L. Sarazin, W. H. Vanderbilt Professor of Astronomy, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA, USA:

Peter B. Stetson, Principal Research Officer at the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory, NRC Herzberg Institute of Astronomy and Astrophysics, and Adjunct Professor at the University of Victoria, Victoria, Canada  - June 14, 2016:
"I had the privilege of being an invited guest professor in Astrophysics with the AstroMundus programme at the Second University of Rome at Tor Vergata on three occasions: the spring semesters of 2011, 2014 and 2015. The students that I met in the Master course there came from highly varied backgrounds, but all were extremely bright, motivated, and enthusiastic. They were presented with quite challenging material, and seemed to absorb it with ease. They were able to acquire the fundamental knowledge and technical expertise necessary for placing them on a path toward sophisticated scientific insight and, in some cases, toward a promising career in astrophysics research. Financing the participation of very promising students who have little or no chance to study astrophysics in their home countries is not only an excellent way to nurture future generations of professional researchers and other scientifically literate citizens. It also makes a significant contribution toward erasing the remaining barriers to international understanding and cooperation in our world, especially in the areas of scientific and technological challenges." 
Jan Palouš, Professor, Astronomical Institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague, Czech Republic, and member of the external Scientific Advisory Board for the evaluation of the AstroMundus program:
 Our Campaign Goal
Astrophysics is a fast growing science field. While astrophysical research answers our need of understanding the Universe we live in, it also prompts the continuous development of new instruments and techniques that make an impact in many other fields and in our society. Scientific and instrumental projects are developed within large international collaborations that put together their resources to realize increasingly larger, powerful and technologically advanced telescopes, instruments, and space missions and to exploit the enormous flow of data coming from these facilities, as well as develop sophisticated computational models.Yet, in many countries around the world high-level education in Astrophysics is still insufficiently developed or even missing.
What if we could offer scholarships to bright students from these countries to allow them to travel abroad and participate in an excellence international study program in Astrophysics? What if their dream of studying Astrophysics could come true and they could bring back their knowledge to their home Universities, contribute to start local study programs and take part in the scientific and technological initiatives of the international astronomical community? They would act as the seeds from which new opportunities of development would grow in their society, well beyond the specific field of Astrophysics.This is the goal we want to achieve with our international Master program AstroMundus. This is what prompted us to start this campaign.
By supporting our campaign you can help us to make a difference and contribute to create new opportunities in developing countries.Each year we invite and collect student applications from all over the world and select the best students for taking part in our international Master course.From these applications it emerges that in many countries students receive an education in Physics and Mathematics, but those willing to pursue a career in Astrophysics need to move abroad, if they have a chance to do so, or have to abandon their dream.
Many applicants are motivated to participate in our program not only by the wish to pursue a field of study they are passionate about, but also by the desire to acquire professional knowledge that they could bring back to their home universities.They want to make a difference in their home country by starting or helping to develop an educational path in Astrophysics at university level. This will open to many other students the possibility to exploit their potential and pursue a career in Astronomy and Astrophysics. At the same time, these future professionals will enable their institutions and countries to join the international community in ambitious and challenging projects.
The synergy between the five Universities and four associated partner research institutions that compose the AstroMundus Consortium, as well as their complementary fields of expertise allow our program to provide admitted students with an excellent background in Astrophysics and to introduce them to topics at the forefront of the astrophysical research. The partly flexible study path across the Consortium Universities exposes the students to a variety of teaching methods and research environments, helps them weaving their professional network in view of their future career, and gives them the opportunity to experience enriching cultural exchanges. The vast majority of AstroMundus graduates are now pursuing their career within doctoral programs at various prestigious institutions around the world. Hence, our program is optimally suited to train future professionals, who will be able to foster development in the world.
Primary Countries Targeted for Support
With the precious advice of the Office of Astronomy for Development (OAD) of the International Astronomical Union and its Regional Offices and based on our experience with past and current AstroMundus students, we defined the following countries and regions as primary targets for support through our campaign: 

Within the Andean Region of South America: Venzuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru - that have good undergraduate programs and are making efforts to further develop or start astronomical research - while considering Bolivia, as well (based on information from Jaime E. Forero-Romero, Associate Professor, Physics Department, Universidad de Los Andes, Bogota, Colombia - OAD Andean Regional Office) ;
Within Central America: Guatemala (based on our experience with former/current AstroMundus students);
Within East and Central Asia: Mongolia - where efforts are currently ongoing to set up a professional Astronomy program; Vietnam, that is currently expanding its astronomical community; Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan (based on information from Richard de Grijs, Full Professor, Kavli Institute for Astronomy and Astrophysics, Peking University, Beijing, China - East Asian Regional Node);
Among Portuguese speaking countries: Cape Verde, East Timor, Sao Tome, and Principe, where steps are being made to spread Astronomy at all levels (based on information from Sara Anjos, Project Coordinator NUCLIO, Núcleo Interativo de Astronomia, University of Porto, Portugal - Portuguese Language Expertise Centre for the OAD);
Within Southeastern Europe: Bosnia and Herzegovina and Macedonia (based on experience with former AstroMundus students);
East African region: the countries in the region are making efforts to enhance development in the Astronomy and Space Science field across the region. Young students from the region are inspired by applications of Astronomy and Space Sciences and are determined to pursue a career in the field, despite limited resources and opportunities (based on information from Kelali Tekle, Addis Ababa University, Ethiopia - OAD East African Regional Node and on experience with former AstroMundus students);
Within South Asia: Bangladesh and Nepal (based on our experience with former/current AstroMundus students and information from colleagues);
Within the Southern African region: Zambia, Zimbabwe and Mozambique as priority targets, while considering Namibia and Mauritius, too. All these countries are interested in starting or further developing Astronomy programs. Most of them are partner countries in the Square Kilometer Array project and hence are in strong need to enhance capacity to carry out research in Astronomy (based on information from Prospery C. Simpemba, The Copperbelt University, Department of Physics, Zambia - OAD Southern African Regional node).
West African countries, with particular attention to Ghana and Burkina Faso that are currently active in introducing Astronomy programs at undergraduate level (based on information from Bonaventure Okere, Assistant Director, Centre for Basic Space Science, Nsukka, Nigeria - OAD West African Regional Office);

The above list is not exhaustive. There are many more countries, where  higher education in Astrophysics needs to be developed. Therefore, depending on the nationality of the students who will submit an application before November 30th, 2016 and on the strength of their applications, we may consider financing through this campaign scholarships for nationals of additional such countries that are not yet explicitly mentioned in our primary target list.
All applications for participation in the AstroMundus program undergo a rigorous selection process aimed at promoting excellence. Scholarships are assigned on a competitive basis.
Use of Funds
The funds we will raise from this campaign (minus the 5% fee retained by the Indiegogo platform and the 3% to 5% fee applied by PayPal on transactions) will be entirely used to finance scholarships to enable selected, top-ranked students from our target world regions to participate in the AstroMundus international Master Course in Astronomy & Astrophysics.
We are currently collecting applications from international students who aim at participating in the 8th edition of our Masters Course, with deadline November 30th, 2016. With the funds made available by the Erasmus+ program and by the AstroMundus Consortium, we expect to be able to finance 12 scholarships for non-EU students and 5 scholarships for EU students. Based on our experience with the past 7 editions of the course, the number of promising international students that are selected based on their academic excellence and strong motivation largely exceeds the number of available scholarships.
We defined the initial goal amount of this campaign so that it would cover 2 additional scholarships, specifically intended for nationals of countries where the possibility of specializing in Astrophysics are scarce or missing. The amount is calculated as follows: each scholarship includes a contribution to the student's travel and installation expenses of 2,000 euro and a monthly allowance of 800 € for living expenses for the whole duration of the course (24 months).  The AstroMundus Consortium will contribute to these two scholarships by waiving the participation fees (18,000 Euro per student, for non-EU students) and covering with its own resources the student participation costs that include a full insurance package as well as registration and tuition costs. The above mentioned fees applied by Indiegogo and PayPal on the funds raised through the campaign have been included in the calculation.
Since this is a fixed-goal campaign, we will receive the funds only if our initial goal amount is reached. Each contribution will be essential to reach the goal!
In the ideal case that the amount raised with this campaign exceeds our initial goal, with the additional funds raised we will increment the two scholarships up to a maximum amount equivalent to an Erasmus+:Erasmus Mundus scholarship funded by the European Union, which is up to 7,000 euro as a contribution for the student's travel and installation expenses and a monthly allowance of 1,000 euro for the 24-month duration of the course.
If the generosity of our backers will make this campaign even more successful, we will use the additional funds to finance further scholarships. This would enable a larger number of promising students among the selected applicants to enroll in the Masters course, thus further increasing the impact of AstroMundus in training future astrophysics professionals and fostering development through them.
Rewards
This campaign aims at financing high-level instruction and training of future professionals as a mean to foster future scientific and technological development in less developed countries and world regions. Therefore, we cannot offer products as rewards, but we will demonstrate our gratitude by listing our supporters in our official website, mentioning them in the social networks, and in the acknowledgments section of Master theses and of any scientific publication resulting from Master student projects that benefited from this financial support. Our backers will have the opportunity to get in touch with the students and receive reports of their study progress. Depending on the chosen perk, we will provide our supporters with certificates that acknowledge their contribution,  exclusive astronomical images produced within our Consortium, or electronic copies of Master theses that were financed through this campaign.
Particularly generous supporters who choose to finance a quarter or a half of a scholarship or even an entire scholarship, in addition to all of the above, will have the partial or full scholarship officially entitled to them, will receive a printed copy of the student's thesis and will be invited to join the annual retreat of the program in summer 2018 and/or 2019.
Please note that because of PayPal restrictions on single payments, donations corresponding to a half or full scholarship need to be split into 2 or 4 payments, respectively.
Risk Assessment
The AstroMundus program is already running its 6th Edition (2nd year of course) and 7th Edition (1st year of course) and concluded successfully all previous editions. Our Consortium has already secured funds for running the 8th Edition of the course, for which additional scholarships are sought through this campaign.
Each year we received between  100 and 140 applications from all over the world, including from several of the countries and regions that are primary targets of this campaign. Some students from such regions actually participated in our Master course, while many others were selected but could not join because of limited financial resources. Hence we are very confident that this year, too, we will receive a number of applications by suitably qualified candidates, who would qualify for scholarships raised through this campaign.
In parallel to this campaign, we published a call for applications and we will select eligible participants among the applicants during the coming months. We are making additional efforts to advertise our call for applications in the target countries/regions of this campaign, to attract an even higher number of qualified applicants from such regions.
Participating students are supported through an intensive program of tutoring in order to maximize their chances of success in the program. However, should a funded student interrupt the studies at mid-course, the remaining part of the scholarship would be transferred to other participating students who only have a partial scholarship or are self-funding their studies.
 
The AstroMundus Program
 
Who we are
AstroMundus is coordinated by the University of Innsbruck (Austria) in partnership with the University of Göttingen (Germany), the University of Padova and the University of Rome 'Tor Vergata' (Italy), and the University of Belgrade (Serbia). The expertise in Astronomy and Astrophysics present in our universities is complemented by that of our Associated Partners, the Gran Sasso Science Institute in L'Aquila that is part of the Italian Institute for Nuclear Physics (INFN), the Italian National Institute of Astrophysics (INAF) in particular with the Astronomical Observatories of Padova (INAF-OAPd) and Rome (INAF-OAR), the Astronomical Observatory of Belgrade and the Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research (MPS) in Göttingen.
Our program
We started our adventure in 2009, when our proposed international study program was selected for funding by the European Commission (EC) as an Erasmus Mundus program for 5 course editions. In 2014 AstroMundus underwent a quality review by the EC. The very positive outcome of this evaluation led to the renewal of the program in 2015 for further 3 editions of the course with co-funding from the new Erasmus+: Erasmus Mundus program of the European Union.

After successful completion, they obtain an MSc Joint Degree from all Universities they studied at, which gives them access to doctoral programs. In addition, the variety of skills they acquire during their studies, make them well suited to a number of alternative careers outside of academia.
Our students and alumni
In autumn 2010 we welcomed our first batch of international students. Most of those students and those from subsequent editions have successfully completed the Master course and continued with PhD studies at various institutions around the world. Currently, the 6th edition of the program is at mid-course and the 7th edition has just started (here are the lists of our current students and alumni). Until now a total of 102 students from 43 different countries were enrolled in our program, including current students. We are now collecting applications for the course starting in October 2017. Close to 90% of the students who successfully completed the program obtained PhD positions, as visible in our alumni list. This is a very high rate, given the high competitiveness in the field and it highlights the success of our Master course.
Several of these students came from some of the world regions that we wish to support with this campaign. Your contribution will be invaluable for sustaining enough students to make an impact in these regions.

story:
Pakistan has the second highest number of out-of-school children in the world, according to UNESCO, and 60 percent of the population in Pakistan lives under $2 a day, according to World Banks' economic survey 2013-2014.


Helping poor Trust is an initiative that was founded in 2015 with the vision to provide education to children in developing countries, who would not otherwise go to school due to financial or societal reasons. In many cases, the recruitment of students has been done after convincing their parents or guardians. The school located in Pakistan,  As the school is expanding, the needs for the school have also became larger. The school charges negligible tuition fee (50 cents per month) and meets its operating cost through a for-profit tuition center in the evening and donations. With the limited finances, the expansion of school to add facilities like library and computer lab becomes a challenge. 


This campaign is to support helping poor Trust build a computer lab-cum-library so that student at the school could get a quality educational experience. And over years more students learn from the resources we help put in place today. Lets avail this opportunity to invest in future.


Supporting this cause today will bring you more than just one of our perks. You will be attached to our stories, lives and success. You will impact us. You will become a real piece of our growth. Your support will encourage us to keep going to achieve greater reach. And of course, whenever you decide to visit our beautiful country, you will always be able to count on us to show you our cities, recommend places to go, and help you in any way we can. With your investment in us, you will truly become part of story.





The Impact


Your support today brings us closer to achieving the goal of establishing a computer lab-cum-library facility for students who would not have access to such resources otherwise. Education for them does not only mean changing their life but also that of their families, it is in fact an investment into the future of so many young girls and boys.


Play your role so that these students can use education to make smarter and better choices. So that they DO NOT fall through the cracks of the society. So they are problem solvers, global shapers, policy makers and NOT another child labor. Your donation is not a one time sum, but rather an investment into the sustainable growth of our school. 


.



What We Need & What You Get



The goal is to be able to construct a computer lab-cum-library at the end of the campaign. However, at the very least we need $6,925 to construct a computer lab in one school. A lot of cost is observed by the support from friends of school who volunteer their time to design, consult and help with the project. 


For the running operations of the school, it relies on donations from a few donors and profits from an after-school-tuition center for high schoolers for college admission tests in Pakistan. The for-profit tuition center generates just enough revenue to meet its own running costs and that of the school. The running cost of the computer lab would also be covered via the existing revenue system.   





Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond donating you can have an impact by: Spreading the Word using the indiegogo share tools and joining our networks! 


Tell friends and family about our campaign – every word matters!

Find out more about.

Goal

  • The funding goal covers the subjects doppler effect and car stability.
  • If more funds are raised, we will improve existing and add more content.

Risks & Challenges

  • To publish this as a "free App", we need the fundraiser to reach the goal.
  • If the fixed goal is not reached, all donors will automatically get a refund.

story:
Our Passions and Visions

Perhaps you also would like to see innovative approaches that promote new college student success and scholarship programs that track outcomes and impacts.  

  • The workshop creator and facilitator studied and managed higher education since 1988.
  • This campaign is important because it generates higher returns on investments in college.
  • Contributors will become part of a project that improves four year college performance.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We, as a nonprofit organization, need enough resources to design, implement, and evaluate online workshop and to purchase a management system for workshop delivery.
  • Contributors play an exciting role providing workshops that empower college students.
  • Contributions can fund a unique scholarship should we fall short of goal attainment.

The Impacts

  • Your contributions add value encouraging student and institutional successes.
  • Track record includes projects that elevated institutional performance and quality.
  • Progress reports on workshop outcomes and impacts will be available upon request.

Risks & Challenges

  • Credentials and activities generate awareness of 13% risk factor facing college entrants.
  • Our focus on students and their sponsors help them diminish risks to their investments.
  • Solutions surround the alignments between student assets and institution performance.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pass the word about our 56 Scholarship Drive program that begins with 10 states.
  • Watch for announcements and updates to be shared via tools from Indiegogo.

story:
Hello, I AM Karen R. August,

Owner of this Request;

For most of my Adult Life I have been a student and Teacher of the Cultural Traditions of the Secwepemc Nation of Central B.C. I am one of the Traditional Teachers of the Secwepemc Language groups [Shuswap] for the Kamloops School District, former Council Member of the Neskonlith Band of the Shuswap Nation and found the Council and Chiefs have interest only in themselves and their greed, so chose not to be part of that. The Elders are dying off at an alarming rate, and we need to pass along the cultural heritage stuck in their brain before they are all gone. Our youth are dying of Substance Abuse, Addictions and Depression, as they do not have a cultural identity or the understanding of who they are and where they are; teaching in a box cannot prepare them to understand who and what they are. The Language and ceremonials, arts and crafts cannot be taught, or learned in a classroom like math, as the language and culture is based on where they are , whom they are, in the context of their environment; how they can become knowledgeable in the ways to preserve the earth, water, air, animals, medicine plants and reclaim their spirit and heritage. The Language is conceptual, not subjective or objective, and involves the spirit, the environment of the region and their part in it. With that established, there would be little to no deaths by suicide, very little depression, the animals and people would be safer, the plants and water would be clear, healthy and free, the air would begin to clear, the soil would become cleaner and more healthy with proper management and care.  This Cultural Camp is greatly needed, but the elected politicians, both Secwepemc Nation/[Shuswap Tribal] and Commonwealth have no interest in doing anything that would actually help the situation; throwing money at a broken wheel will not fix the wheel, but make the cost of doing so much higher; so doing it right, is faster and costs little in a culture camp with training from the Knowledge keepers and the elders shall restore what was stolen from us by the Europeans and Churches: and this must be done, or there will be no one left to do it; opening them to gangs and drug lords, systemic incarceration where they are set up to fail, that will become more and more present; as will all of the ills of a sick society. We can prevent this, but need a little help. We have been given the land off reserve to avoid Secwepemc Nation/[tribal]politics, now we need to clean it up and place structures thereon, traditional ones: Tipi's, Tree-houses, long-houses, pit-houses, and non-traditional ones "Earth-ships" and Geo-domes.  All with the environment and Mountain Ecology and Biodiversity as a major part; as well as the cultural aspects of Ethnobotany and traditional herbal medicines.

Modern and ancient ways may be integrated, medicines that are 100% natural and non-toxic, as well as fully sustainable technologies that do not harm or otherwise injure the animals, birds, people, plants or soil bacteria. Health and well being may return if these principals of "Do no harm to any other" are kept, and shall be in this Culture Camp; as the knowledge keepers pass it to the succeeding generations of children. Since economics seem to be a larger part than we would like at this time, we seek your help, as the Politicians only look out for their own interests, not ours. There are many helpers that have donated their time and efforts, as well as goods and services to get to this point, now we need the funding to build a future for those that have nearly lost all hope. Let us give them that hope, and the skills to survive, the identity that they lack and the return to their interior spirit as a unified whole. Caring for animals is an integral part of bringing back their balance and self-esteem, and there will be animals for both staff and students to care for.

What we need is clear, what you get will be something made by either an Elder, a student, or an entire class of students and elders on traditional items such as clothing, jewelry, baskets, musical instruments, paintings and carvings. Some are ready now, most will be ready soon, many will be made by the first classes in Birch Bark Basket Classes. Some in Pine Needle Basket Classes. What is made in classes may not always be the Manufactured quality, but it will be made with love and great care by hand and by a person of the Secwepemc Nation.


If we do reach our goal in the time allotted, we will continue to ask on the InDemand, and use all the funds received [except for the 5% to the Indiagogo team to keep them on-line ] shall go to making this a reality, to the students, elders transportation to the site, and living arrangements for the staff, students, and elders. If goal is reached, we should have enough to start several classes, house many students through the summer months, and be ready for next winter without any more major projects required. We have lived with so little so long, that what you call challenges, we call daily life, but we trudge on. For those that cannot afford economically to help, we accept your efforts to contact others in your network of friends that may be able to, and we accept non-monetary gifts like food, blankets, equipment, tools, labor at the site, transportation, or other things of value to such an endeavor. And we will share what we have, which has always been our way.
story_txt:
Hello, I AM Karen R. August,
Owner of this Request; 
 For most of my Adult Life I have been a student and Teacher of the Cultural Traditions of the Secwepemc Nation of Central B.C. I am one of the Traditional Teachers of the Secwepemc Language groups [Shuswap] for the Kamloops School District, former Council Member of the Neskonlith Band of the Shuswap Nation and found the Council and Chiefs have interest only in themselves and their greed, so chose not to be part of that. The Elders are dying off at an alarming rate, and we need to pass along the cultural heritage stuck in their brain before they are all gone. Our youth are dying of Substance Abuse, Addictions and Depression, as they do not have a cultural identity or the understanding of who they are and where they are; teaching in a box cannot prepare them to understand who and what they are. The Language and ceremonials, arts and crafts cannot be taught, or learned in a classroom like math, as the language and culture is based on where they are , whom they are, in the context of their environment; how they can become knowledgeable in the ways to preserve the earth, water, air, animals, medicine plants and reclaim their spirit and heritage. The Language is conceptual, not subjective or objective, and involves the spirit, the environment of the region and their part in it. With that established, there would be little to no deaths by suicide, very little depression, the animals and people would be safer, the plants and water would be clear, healthy and free, the air would begin to clear, the soil would become cleaner and more healthy with proper management and care.  This Cultural Camp is greatly needed, but the elected politicians, both Secwepemc Nation/[Shuswap Tribal] and Commonwealth have no interest in doing anything that would actually help the situation; throwing money at a broken wheel will not fix the wheel, but make the cost of doing so much higher; so doing it right, is faster and costs little in a culture camp with training from the Knowledge keepers and the elders shall restore what was stolen from us by the Europeans and Churches: and this must be done, or there will be no one left to do it; opening them to gangs and drug lords, systemic incarceration where they are set up to fail, that will become more and more present; as will all of the ills of a sick society. We can prevent this, but need a little help. We have been given the land off reserve to avoid Secwepemc Nation/[tribal]politics, now we need to clean it up and place structures thereon, traditional ones: Tipi's, Tree-houses, long-houses, pit-houses, and non-traditional ones "Earth-ships" and Geo-domes.  All with the environment and Mountain Ecology and Biodiversity as a major part; as well as the cultural aspects of Ethnobotany and traditional herbal medicines.
Modern and ancient ways may be integrated, medicines that are 100% natural and non-toxic, as well as fully sustainable technologies that do not harm or otherwise injure the animals, birds, people, plants or soil bacteria. Health and well being may return if these principals of "Do no harm to any other" are kept, and shall be in this Culture Camp; as the knowledge keepers pass it to the succeeding generations of children. Since economics seem to be a larger part than we would like at this time, we seek your help, as the Politicians only look out for their own interests, not ours. There are many helpers that have donated their time and efforts, as well as goods and services to get to this point, now we need the funding to build a future for those that have nearly lost all hope. Let us give them that hope, and the skills to survive, the identity that they lack and the return to their interior spirit as a unified whole. Caring for animals is an integral part of bringing back their balance and self-esteem, and there will be animals for both staff and students to care for.
What we need is clear, what you get will be something made by either an Elder, a student, or an entire class of students and elders on traditional items such as clothing, jewelry, baskets, musical instruments, paintings and carvings. Some are ready now, most will be ready soon, many will be made by the first classes in Birch Bark Basket Classes. Some in Pine Needle Basket Classes. What is made in classes may not always be the Manufactured quality, but it will be made with love and great care by hand and by a person of the Secwepemc Nation.

If we do reach our goal in the time allotted, we will continue to ask on the InDemand, and use all the funds received [except for the 5% to the Indiagogo team to keep them on-line ] shall go to making this a reality, to the students, elders transportation to the site, and living arrangements for the staff, students, and elders. If goal is reached, we should have enough to start several classes, house many students through the summer months, and be ready for next winter without any more major projects required. We have lived with so little so long, that what you call challenges, we call daily life, but we trudge on. For those that cannot afford economically to help, we accept your efforts to contact others in your network of friends that may be able to, and we accept non-monetary gifts like food, blankets, equipment, tools, labor at the site, transportation, or other things of value to such an endeavor. And we will share what we have, which has always been our way.

story:
Help us build a sustainable and anti-seismic school in Haiti!

#ahadepaproject

Our mission at UHUK (United Haitians in the UK, uhuk.org) is to promote the Haitian culture in the UK as well as support educational projects in Haiti.

Since 2009, UHUK have been supporting the AHADEPA school, a community initiative providing education to children from families in extreme financial distress. Following the 2010 Earthquake, the school not only lost the church hosting their classrooms but some of the students suffered injuries and one life was lost. Despite such devastation the children returned to school within four months and continued to study under a tent which was donated on a plot of land rented by UHUK. That tent is still in use today.

After four years of struggle due to difficult administrative procedures related to land ownership, UHUK successfully purchased of a piece of land in 2015.

Now we've started the AHADEPA PROJECT to raise funds to finance the construction of a new sustainable and anti-seismic school in 2016.

Please consider making a donation today to help make this possible!

The AHADEPA PROJECT is based on a photography documentary made at the school this year in February to show the teaching and living conditions of various community members. Various initiatives are coming out from this such as this crowdfunding campaign, a London exhibition with limited photography prints and a photo book.

More info about the project here: ahadepa-project.com

 

Who we are

UHUK is a small grass-root organisation ran by Haitians, Haitian descendants, partners of Haitians and friends of Haiti, living in United Kingdom. UHUK members are all volunteers. We use all funds received from various events, sponsors and donations responsibly, meeting regularly in order to find innovative ways to finance our projects.

We launch the AHADEPA PROJECT to underwrite the cost of a safe anti-seismic and sustainable school. Our wish is to allow the AHADEPA community to take off on solid ground with a fair amount of autonomy so that they can focus on giving possibilities to those children full of potential.

"Each Haitian child receiving a good education benefits their community and ultimately the whole Nation."

-- Co-Director Rene Innocent

 

The Situation

The AHADEPA school current situation is quite alarming.

Four classrooms are located in a big tent provided by ADRA (Agence du Development Rural Adventiste) while two others are located in a shed. Both structures are quite frail and time-worn. For instance, classes are canceled when it is raining due to leaks or if the weather brings strong winds such as during the cyclone season.

 

Hygiene status is enough to get the Education Ministry attestation although there is room for improvement. There are a couple of “pit latrines” for both genders as well as a urinal area.
There is no electricity or running water so students have to buy pockets of drinkable water when they are thirsty which is a problem when they cannot afford it.

Because the pupils are coming from impoverished families, this is also affecting the school life in various ways. School might finish earlier when kids are too hungry and it is quite common to see children asking teachers to buy them food.

The current situation at the school and also a day in the personal lives of the Director, a teacher and a couple of pupils is documented in the AHADEPA PROJECT photo book if you want to know more.

 

The Dream

The AHADEPA school was created in 2006 for kids who were not going to school because their parents could not afford it (most schools are private in Haiti and many unregulated). After giving classes in a church prior 2010 and under tents ever since, our wish is for the ten years of existence of the school to be able to settle in a safe environment that would foster the dissemination of knowledge.

The ultimate goal of the AHADEPA PROJECT is to create a sustainable environment where the school could be totally autonomous. The plan is to provide the following:

  • In the morning, classes to kids from families in financial distress for very low fees (or no fees).
  • In the afternoon, professional courses and workshops for adults at reasonable prices that will be used to run the school and pay the teachers wages. Co-directors Ricot Osias and Maitre Innocent are currently preparing a plan regarding those professional workshops with craftsmen within the community.
  • One energy packed snack a day per kids until the school can afford to provide a meal
  • Annual visits of professionals from the UK to train people from the community (long term)

 

The piece of land bought by UHUK last year has been protected with a wall to avoid theft and later keep the students on the premises.

 

Why we need your help

When children and teachers of the AHADEPA are willing to endure extreme challenges to ensure this generation has the necessary skills to have a brighter future, we personally feel it is our responsibility to assist them as they become empowered.

This is where your support is so essential. We need you to assist UHUK in building the AHADEPA school that will provide a safe, nurturing learning environment for the children.

These children are Haiti’s future and with the correct guidance, support and education they can become the leaders of tomorrow and take Haiti forward into its promising future. Please join us in this mission.

 

Ansam Ansam (Together we can).

Help Us Help Them.

 

Questions?

If you would like to learn more about the AHADEPA PROJECT, please visit the project's website (ahadepa-project.com) or UHUK's (uhuk.org). You can email us at info@uhuk.org.

Informations

http://uhuk.org

http://ahadepa-project.com

story:
The Story:

 

Ruth. E. Wilson is a Guyanese medical student, author, and poet. She is an impassioned advocate for lifelong learning and has a huge interest in people and helping them achieve success and perform at their very best. She is a hard worker,optimistic and a firm believer of living in your purpose and fulfilling your destiny and finding what is one’s true happiness.                                                                     

“There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up.” 
― John Holmes

Her Struggle and Action Plan

Ruth Wilson is currently a (third year) 5th semester Medicine Basic science student. However, she in a serious financial situation. Her parents currently are unable to help her financially and she does not have a job to pay her school fees and other personal expenses.  Her dream is to become an ophthalmologist. she is motivated and optimistic about her future and cannot afford to quit now. she has invested her time, efforts and spirit into realizing her dream. Since from a tender age she knew what she wanted to become and at 22 years old refuses to give up now. 

Action Plan.

Ruth Wilson is a full-time medical student and having a '9 to 5' job to finance her education will not workout. Hence, her game-plan to be an online publisher of youtube videos, ebooks among other passive income avenues. She has already published her first ebook and wants to start her Youtube channel. She needs to raise $25000 within two years to complete her degree.

“No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.” 
― Charles Dickens

What is Needed & What You Get:

My campaign goal is to reach $1000. With your contribution you will receive  some really cool perks; cash contributions of all sums are accepted. Expenses include  Camera + accessories, video setup equipment, editing software, shipping, etc. To see everything visit my Amazon wish List: Wish List 
Link: https://amzn.com/w/2AFMN70AUWWYB

'Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth'. Muhammad Ali

Featured Perks

$5USD

The Gift of Affirmation    You will receive ‘The Top 100 Affirmations of Successful Lifelong Learners’ eBook by the Author Ruth. E. Wilson emailed to you with a thank you note. 


 $50USD

Proud Supporters

You will receive Author's eBook ‘The Top 100 Affirmations of Successful Lifelong Learners’+ an awesome T-shirt and a Special Thank You Email. 


$100USD

Your Name in Lights

Your name, listed as a Sponsor in my Unboxing+ Review Youtube video of the purchased products . You will receive the Author's eBook and your photo on the channel's Facebook page wallpaper. + Two awesome T-shirts. A Special Thank You.


“Every sunrise is an invitation for us to arise and brighten someone's day.” 

― Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year


This is just the beginning of an awesome journey, and you are welcome to come on board.

Other Ways to Help

If you can't donate at this time, there are still many ways to help me fund my  project. Please share my story via social media, email and word of mouth to tell your friends about my campaign! Thank you in advance! 

“It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.” 
― Mother Teresa
