story:
STORY

 

 

The Chocó to Dance Project is an initiative of the Juan Pablo Gutiérrez Cáceres Foundation, which provides postgraduate scholarships to young Colombians who have limited resources.

The Foundation has agreements and alliances with 12 universities in Colombia to offer important educational opportunities. So far, 338 scholarships have been awarded and 151 students have graduated, positively transforming their personal, academic and working lives and supporting the development of their communities.

 The Foundation wants to help young people from Chocó who dream of studying for a postgraduate degree.  With this goal in mind, it launched the Chocó to Dance Project as a way to swap education for education. The developed world has easy access to education.  Unfortunately, young people in the Chocó region, which is a small corner of Colombia, do not.  But there is something the people in this part of the country do very well and can teach the developed world: they know to dance.

Choco to Dance was created to do just that. It is a platform where young dancers from Chocó show their talent to the world and share the joy of dancing, embodied in four genres: champeta, salsa, reggeaton and choke salsa. People anywhere can go to the website (www.chocotodance.com), take classes, learn to dance with all the flare and flavor characteristic of Colombia, and help to change the future of the country through education.

The project is already up and running. Now, we want to show it to the world, publicize it, position it, and reach a much larger audience. This requires resources to invest in advertising and to create campaigns that will encourage a substantial number of people to access the site and buy the classes or donate to the Foundation.

Chocó to Dance is a creative, innovative, worthwhile and powerful idea that needs to be publicized in order to raise funds for scholarships for young people in Chocó.  It is envisioned as a way to provide an opportunity for education to those who are unable to continue their studies for financial reasons.

 

The resources will be used to create a communication and publicity campaign for Chocó to

Dance. The Foundation made a sizeable investment to develop, implement and launch the project, but now requires support to make it widely known and to achieve its goal, which is to have scores of people access the site and register as users of the platform, take classes and, thus, provide the funds needed to offer scholarships to graduate students from Chocó.

 

HISTORIA

El Proyecto Chocó to Dance es una iniciativa de la Fundación Juan Pablo Gutiérrez Cáceres, quien entrega becas de posgrado a jóvenes de limitados recursos en Colombia.

La Fundación tiene convenios y alianzas con 12 universidades del país para brindar oportunidades de estudio. A la fecha, se han entregado 338 becas y  151 estudiantes se han graduado, transformando de manera positiva sus vidas personales, académica y laboral y apoyando el desarrollo de sus comunidades.

La Fundación quiere ayudar a jóvenes del Chocó a cumplir su sueño de estudiar un posgrado. Por ello, desarrolló el Proyecto Chocó to Dance con el objetivo de intercambiar educación por educación. El primer mundo tiene fácil acceso a la educación, desafortunadamente una pequeña esquina de Colombia no cuenta con esta gran oportunidad; pero hay algo que esta pequeña esquina de Colombia, Chocó, sabe hacer muy bien y que en el primer mundo no domina muy bien: bailar.

Por eso se creó CHOCÓ TO DANCE, una plataforma donde jóvenes bailarines innatos le enseñan al mundo su talento y alegría para bailar, plasmado en 4 géneros: champeta, salsa, reggeaton y salsa choke. Así, las personas de todo el planeta pueden ingresar al site www.chocotodance.com, tomar las clases, aprender a bailar con todo el sabor de nuestra tierra y aportar a este sueño que permite cambiar el futuro de Colombia a través de la educación.

El proyecto ya está creado pero ahora queremos mostrarlo al mundo, difundirlo, posicionarlo, lograr que más gente lo conozca. Esto requiere recursos para invertir en publicidad y crear campañas para que cada vez más personas entrene al site y compren las clases o donen.

Chocó to Dance es una idea creativa, innovadora, valiosa y potente que necesita ser comunicada para recaudar los fondos que permitan entregar becas a jóvenes del Chocó y darle oportunidades de estudio a quienes por razones económicas no pueden continuar estudiando.

Los fondos recibidos estarán dirigidos a crear una campaña de comunicación y divulgación del proyecto Chocó to Dance. La Fundación realizó una gran inversión en el desarrollo, implementación y lanzamiento del proyecto pero ahora se requieren recursos para comunicarlo y lograr el objetivo que muchas personas entren al site y se inscriban como  usuarios de la plataforma, tomen las clases y se pueda recoger los recursos esperados para entregar becas en Chocó.

HISTORIA
El Proyecto Chocó to Dance es una iniciativa de la Fundación Juan Pablo Gutiérrez Cáceres, quien entrega becas de posgrado a jóvenes de limitados recursos en Colombia.
La Fundación tiene convenios y alianzas con 12 universidades del país para brindar oportunidades de estudio. A la fecha, se han entregado 338 becas y  151 estudiantes se han graduado, transformando de manera positiva sus vidas personales, académica y laboral y apoyando el desarrollo de sus comunidades.
La Fundación quiere ayudar a jóvenes del Chocó a cumplir su sueño de estudiar un posgrado. Por ello, desarrolló el Proyecto Chocó to Dance con el objetivo de intercambiar educación por educación. El primer mundo tiene fácil acceso a la educación, desafortunadamente una pequeña esquina de Colombia no cuenta con esta gran oportunidad; pero hay algo que esta pequeña esquina de Colombia, Chocó, sabe hacer muy bien y que en el primer mundo no domina muy bien: bailar.
Por eso se creó CHOCÓ TO DANCE, una plataforma donde jóvenes bailarines innatos le enseñan al mundo su talento y alegría para bailar, plasmado en 4 géneros: champeta, salsa, reggeaton y salsa choke. Así, las personas de todo el planeta pueden ingresar al site www.chocotodance.com, tomar las clases, aprender a bailar con todo el sabor de nuestra tierra y aportar a este sueño que permite cambiar el futuro de Colombia a través de la educación.
El proyecto ya está creado pero ahora queremos mostrarlo al mundo, difundirlo, posicionarlo, lograr que más gente lo conozca. Esto requiere recursos para invertir en publicidad y crear campañas para que cada vez más personas entrene al site y compren las clases o donen.
Chocó to Dance es una idea creativa, innovadora, valiosa y potente que necesita ser comunicada para recaudar los fondos que permitan entregar becas a jóvenes del Chocó y darle oportunidades de estudio a quienes por razones económicas no pueden continuar estudiando.
Los fondos recibidos estarán dirigidos a crear una campaña de comunicación y divulgación del proyecto Chocó to Dance. La Fundación realizó una gran inversión en el desarrollo, implementación y lanzamiento del proyecto pero ahora se requieren recursos para comunicarlo y lograr el objetivo que muchas personas entren al site y se inscriban como  usuarios de la plataforma, tomen las clases y se pueda recoger los recursos esperados para entregar becas en Chocó.

story:
In the moment when we received it in 2015 the building was looking like this:

With the help of some local donors (materials and office furniture) and only with the hard work of our local and international volunteers in just 3 years we managed to make it look like this:

But only this is not enough ... we still don't have a heating system and during the winter we can't do activities inside because the temperature is around 0, the windows are old and some not closing at all, the sealing is in a really bad condition and really high so we need urgently to change them till the next winter, we have a lot of problems with the humidity so the carpets are already starting to mold and the smell is really bad inside, the electric system is really old and any time a fire can start, the water pipes are also old and they need to be replaces to avoid the periodically floods, and from another point of view, we don't have professional equipment and IT technology so the quality of our work is quite diminished.

We know how important is a healthy working environment for our volunteers and youngsters so during this summer we really need to renovate this entire space and bring it to a better condition.

The Youth Center of Sighisoara is located right in the heart of the city and the number of locals (kids, youngsters and adults) crossing our doors daily is really high, so with our daily activities we want to train their minds trough non-formal educational methods and creative workshops, to help in their personal development and to make them acquire special skills for the working field.

The youth workers providing all the activities mentioned above are international volunteers who are joining us annually, from 2013 till present moment we hosted in Sighisoara more than 120 persons from all over Europe, China, Egypt, Georgia and Kazakhstan, we had more than 15 projects and we had more than 3000 local beneficiaries.  

For the future we want to plan better and modern activities, we want to raise the number of our international hosted volunteers and we want to have a bigger impact on our local community development so for this WE NEED YOUR HELP AND SUPPORT !!!

Exactly What Would Your Dollars Provide? The renovation plan for 2019:

- replace the windows with modern ones

- fix the sealing

- replace the carpet with parquet

- replace the electric and water system 

- install a heating system

- buy computers for each department and at least a multi-functional printer, a projector and a sound system

With all these improvements our list of volunteers could grow and grow and the number of our local young beneficiaries increase continuously.

When you back this project, you'll be paying for renovating the building and creating a modern educational center for the young people in Sighisoara.

You will be funding a solid development frame for the new generation and you'll have an impact for a better and educated world. 

Spread the Word!

Share the campaign after you've contributed. Let people know how you are making a difference today!

Thank you !!!

story:
The Virtuality Show team has been organizing regular visits to educational institutions for about 4 years!

During this time, we have noticed that our services are treated in a superficial manner in schools or, at least, that presentations are not carried out in an interactive or attractive for children way.

 

Our services include:

-5D CINEMA

-VR (VirtualReality)

- Educational Planetarium 

- Entertaining Planetarium 

-Virtuality tunnel

 

We are holding a campaign to present our services to Moldova because there are about 80 percent of children who have never seen something like that.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
At present the amount is estimated to 295 000 USD. 

Out of this amount, more than 34 district events are planned to be organized and about 600,000 children will be able to participate in them free of charge.

A total of 50% of school children and preschoolers have the possibility to watch educational films by purchasing tickets, while the other half of children come from families that cannot afford to buy such a ticket or from socially vulnerable, disabled families.

The project is intended to offer the free entry to all persons and to provide our services to as many children as possible.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You can follow the events and process in detail on our FACEBOOK page at the link below:

https://www.facebook.com/virtualityshow.md/

If the full amount is not collected, the amount will be estimated from charity and social assistance funds!

We have organized similar projects for 3 times already and they have enjoyed great success!

We have organized charity events for socially vulnerable families for free.

 

Through such new projects we offer children the opportunity to interact with information and a new educational style that draws huge interest.

 

We want all children to enjoy this pleasure of trying advanced technology!

story:
Our Story in Brief

  • I have a dream. A dream of children around the world connecting via a 100% secure global network based on blockchain technology with approval and oversight of parents.  On this service, they learn  how children in other parts of the world live; they make lifelong friends, learn another language or languages and save for a higher education with a crypto coin for kids called GreanCoin.
  • The internet is here to stay as are mobile platforms. GreanPal makes use of both for a 21st century learning and financial education experience for parents and children.
  • Imagine a million children in 195 countries connecting and learning from each other.  Imagine children in well off countries learning the plight of and helping children in not so well off countries.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $25,000 to build a working model of the GreanPal interactive website displaying how the friendship, language learning and GreanCoin modules work. This "landing site" will then be used to secure total financing of $300,000 to build the complete network.
  • For every dollar contributed, donors will receive a GreanCoin that has a nominal value of $1.00. By May 2020, the company will be opening an online store selling 100% green products for children and parents where the GreanCoins can be spent. Once the GreanPal system goes online in October 2020, there will be additional options for using GreanCoins including an educational fund and the purchase and charitable use by purchasing carabon credits.
  • If the company does not reach its financial target in this campaign, it will offer equity to contributing production partners to make up the difference between the cost and the money raised.

The Impact

  • There are 2.2 billion children in the world including 300 million in China 10 and 170 million in India ages 6 and under. Many of these children live in poverty with little or no access to bricks and mortar educational facilities. Most of these areas have access to the internet and moble devices however. This is where GreanPal steps in.
  • The principals and founders of GreanPal are entrepreneurs and business owners. If background informationis required, please email for more. We are happy to share.
  • The company is backing up the value of the GreanCoin by contributing $1.00 from every monthly membership paid as well as up to 5% of company annual net revenues to an investment fund.  The fund will be invested in green companies and green technology and be managed by a financial company.

Risks & Challenges

  • Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful people with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. We are persistent!
  • Every new project has risks and challenges. We recognize GreanPal has challenges and will meet them head on and at the same time, mitigate the risks as much as possible. We have a great team of advisors in the USA, Canada, China and India.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you like the concept of GreanPal but don't have the means to contribute at this point, please forward to your contact list and friends. 
  • Please use Indiegogo share tools. Every little bit helps.

The internet is here to stay as are mobile platforms. GreanPal makes use of both for a 21st century learning and financial education experience for parents and children.
Imagine a million children in 195 countries connecting and learning from each other.  Imagine children in well off countries learning the plight of and helping children in not so well off countries.

We are raising $25,000 to build a working model of the GreanPal interactive website displaying how the friendship, language learning and GreanCoin modules work. This "landing site" will then be used to secure total financing of $300,000 to build the complete network.
For every dollar contributed, donors will receive a GreanCoin that has a nominal value of $1.00. Once the GreanPal system goes online in October 2020, there will be additional options for using GreanCoins including an educational fund and the purchase and charitable use by purchasing carabon credits.
If the company does not reach its financial target in this campaign, it will offer equity to contributing production partners to make up the difference between the cost and the money raised.

There are 2.2 billion children in the world including 300 million in China 10 and 170 million in India ages 6 and under. Many of these children live in poverty with little or no access to bricks and mortar educational facilities. Most of these areas have access to the internet and moble devices however. This is where GreanPal steps in.
The principals and founders of GreanPal are entrepreneurs and business owners. If background informationis required, please email for more. We are happy to share.

The company is backing up the value of the GreanCoin by contributing $1.00 from every monthly membership paid as well as up to 5% of company annual net revenues to an investment fund.  The fund will be invested in green companies and green technology and be managed by a financial company.

Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful people with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. We are persistent!
Every new project has risks and challenges. We recognize GreanPal has challenges and will meet them head on and at the same time, mitigate the risks as much as possible. We have a great team of advisors in the USA, Canada, China and India.

If you like the concept of GreanPal but don't have the means to contribute at this point, please forward to your contact list and friends. 
Please use Indiegogo share tools. Every little bit helps.

story:
College Money Pros empowers parents with the knowledge they need

to help fund and secure their child’s college education. Dan is a down to

earth and energetic speaker with a straight ahead style. His workshops are

full of practical advice, future changing strategies and real life successes

that will allow parents to create a clear path to funding college in a

comfortable manner for their family.  He offers practical methods that are

easy to grasp and step by step plan that can be used immediately.

Dan Evertsz is the CEO of  College Money Pros.  For the last 10 years,

Dan has helped hundreds of working families substantially lower their out of

pocket expense for college.  Dan is active in his church and is an

ambassador for Water & Education Intl, a non-profit organization that helps

fund two schools & missions in Haiti.  Dan also volunteers for the Willie

Atkins Project, a 503c non-profit organization that helps low income

students go to college.

Dan is married to his lovely wife Deborah of 25 years with two children. 

As a parent of a recent college graduate, Dan understands the frustration

and lack of information parents will encounter when trying to figure out how

they will pay for college.  Parents now have a resource that can walk their

students, step by step, month by month through the college funding

process with live Q & A and live monthly coaching.

Parents that attend Dan’s workshops will learn the following:

• Insider strategies to access free money for college.

• How to put together a sound funding plan to pay for college.

• Uncover practical and useful tools that allow parents to implement simple

strategies that produce results. 

 

• A proven road map to get all your children through college without

depleting your nest egg.

• Discover what every parent needs to know to relieve the stress of paying

for college.

By implementing Dan’s sound and proven strategies shared in this program

parents with college bound students can rest easy at night.

If you are a high school student and would like to be part of our next project please contact Dan Evertsz at http://www.collegemoneypros.com

story:
The Goal

We aim to provide teachers with an animated video about soil science. We already have an inspiring song. Now we want to create an animation that will bring the message to life. 

Please listen to our song. https://soundcloud.com/thesoilisalive

Imagine the impact an animation will have with these lyrics. 

Legendary soil chemist, Dr. Bruce James, breaks down the lyrics in the video below:


Why an animated song?

Powerpoints can be boring - especially for kids. For this reason, we wrote a catchy, educational tune called "the Soil Is Alive".  

Photo by Morgan. H West - morganhungerfordwest.com. 

Why an animation?

A catchy song is one thing. But a vivid animation to go along with it will drive the message home. It will inspire curious young minds to explore the world beneath their feet. 

There are ZERO "hip" animated songs about soils. We are here to change that! Kids today love watching music videos, so why not provide teachers with a music video that helps kids explore the hidden life in soils?

Here is an popular example of how a catchy song and animation can yield a powerful learning tool:



Why is soil science education important?

“The reason why the Earth is wet is because of its ever-evolving life on its surface.” -Dr. Lynn Margulis

The Earth is wet today, but prolonged droughts, deforestation, and unmitigated industrial and agricultural pollution continue to anchor an irreversible future. This is one of the central reasons why the United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization declared 2015 the International Year of Soils. Here are a few things they had to say: 

  • Healthy soils are the basis for healthy food production. 
  • Soils support our planet's biodiversity and they host a quarter of the total. 
  • Soils help to combat and adapt to climate change
  • Soils improve our resilience to floods and droughts.
  • Soil preservation is essential for food security and our sustainable future. 



The Team

Music and Melody

Tony Dimeglio - Environmental Science - University of MD 2013  & Virginia Tech Entomology Graduate Students (M.S. Candidate 2016)

The soil enthusiast who had the idea to use music in the classroom to excite youth about soils

Animation

Our animators Tynesha Foreman and Joe Paquette can't wait to work together to animate our song. 

Tynesha has a knack for character development, stop-motion and mixed media. She'll bring life into the animation. Joe is talented with digital media, overlaying natural textures and adding lighting effects. He is key for creating the setting for Tynesha's characters. 

Check out some of their work below:

Tynesha Foreman  - Maryland Institute College of Art


Joe Paquette - George Mason University


Our two incredible animators are already at work. Here are some of their artistic contributions:

Joe Paquette (An idea for animation)

Tynesha Foreman (Logos for outreach material and Indiegogo prizes)


Where Your Funding Goes

We are a group of artists and scientists.
Your contributions are allocated to covering the minimal amount needed to compensate our artists and allow us to distribute the final product.
We really appreciate your support!
Two animators: Animating a 3 minute video demands an enormous amount of time and effort. Because our animators believe in this project they agreed to reduce their fee significantly for us; just enough to cover their time.


Promoting animation: We are traveling to Minneapolis, MN in November 2015 to present the project to entomologist, horticulturalists, agronomists and soil scientists at a National conference joined by American Society of Agronomy, Entomological Society of America, Soil Science Society of America, and Crop Science Society of America.  


Additionally, we will show the animation at Hokie BugFest at Virginia Tech (an event that reaches a diverse group of teachers, students, adults and families of South Western Virginia). More screening and presentations are dependent on funding. Travel is expensive, so we thank you for contributing. 


All photography by Morgan. H West - morganhungerfordwest.com.

story:
My name is Jamie Jackson and I am contacting you on behalf of Living Dreams, which is a  non – profit organization supporting children’s homes  in Japan.  The organisation was founded in 2006 by Patrick Newell, who is also the co-founder of the Tokyo Internal School.  

Can you imagine a world without the internet?  Only 5% of the estimated 30,000 children in institutionalised homes have access to internet. The lack of 21st century resources can partly explain why 35% of children in these homes are 2 grade levels below that of their peers. Since 2006, Living Dreams have made it their mission to bridge the gap for the children and help build their futures.

Currently the organisation is associated with 27 children's homes in and around the Tokyo area and 15 homes in the tsunami affected Tohoku area.

Digital Natives is one of the organization’s core initiatives, which focuses on empowering and enriching residents of children's homes through providing digital devices and I.T skill training. Digital Natives is built on the philosophy that access to the internet can be a viable tool for children to communicate,explore and learn.

Digital Natives has successfully been implemented in 10 children’s homes so far, with the aim of expanding to 98 homes in Kanto and Kansai areas within a 5-year time scale. 

However, in order to build on our recent success and achieve our goal of one for one PC's for Tohoku and Kanto, we are looking to raise $100,000 globally.

story:
Nota: Puedes ver un adelanto sobre "Reírse por no llorar" en     www.reirsepornollorar.com.

¿Quieres participar en una idea diferente? Pues bien: esta seguro que lo es


¿Y si empezamos por un  "¿Por qué no?"?

Me llamo Alex Mesa (oficialmente: Alejandro). Desde el año 2013 soy Doctorando del Departamento de Filosofía de la UAB. A diferencia de muchos de mis compañeros y compañeras, yo solo fui un buen estudiante durante la carrera y el máster: quiero decir que no fui especialmente brillante. Por ello no soy becario (supongo). Pero desde que en el año 2011 comencé a indagar acerca del papel que el humor había representado y representa en la tradición cultural de Occidente, tuve claro que quería llegar hasta el fondo: por eso soy un Doctorando de los de la variante masoquista: los de por amor al arte, stricto sensu. Pues si hay muchas personas que perjudican sus vidas de múltiples maneras... ¿Por qué no podía ser esta, una de ellas?

Reírse por no llorar...

En la actualidad, el trabajo de investigación avanza, no muy raudamente, pero avanza. Y la imaginación también.

De ahí nace la idea de "Reírse por no llorar", un pequeño libro (de unas 60 a unas 100 páginas, como máximo) en el que, puede, que se cuenten muchas cosas.

Este proyecto surge de la necesidad de comunicar mi visión personal sobre mi trabajo, sobre la vida, sobre lo importante y no tan importante de todo ello... De porque, creo, es preferible reírse y no llorar. Viniendo de un licenciado en filosofía y dicho lo dicho, puede sonar a "rollazo profundo", pero creed que no va por esa línea, no.

Más bien, es todo una conjunción sobre algunos detalles de mi investigación, mi propia experiencia personal y mi relación con el mundo del humor.

Como en este proyecto se entremezclan tantas cosas (tantas serias y tantas que no), quizá es mejor dejar que el proyecto vea la luz, y entonces ya luego se critica lo que se tenga que criticar.

Podríais decir ahora: "¿Y no te podrías haber quedado todo eso dentro de ti?"

Y aquí es cuando cualquier toque trascendental (por cierto: esta palabra está muy pervertida) se disipa. ¿Por qué no guardarlo para mi interior?

Podría decir que necesitaba comunicarme con el mundo... pero estaría mintiendo. Ya lo hago. Y bastante a menudo. Y, sí, me gusta que mis inquietudes, mis relatos, mis opiniones... suelan ver la luz, pero es más que probable que no lo hubiera deseado tan claramente con este proyecto.

Pero, en fin, si os remontáis unas líneas arriba, podréis cercioraros de que he dicho que soy Doctorando de la variante masoquista: sin beca. Pero eso no quiere decir que no tenga gastos. Que son muchos. Y aunque, realmente, el dinero que se consigue recaudar aquí no va más allá de cubrir los gastos editoriales... ¿Quién sabe? Quizás acabe vendiendo tantos ejemplares de mi posterior obra que pueda dejar de ser una tachuela telefónica por la tarde (y, por cierto, muy mal remunerada, por si es necesario matizarlo...).

¿En que invertiré lo conseguido por esta campaña?

Podría irme a Miami, pero estaría feo. Y no creo que mis directores de Tesis lo vieran con buenos ojos.

Desglose de gastos (Nota: las cifras están redondeadas, en ningún caso el importe es superior o inferior a 50€ de lo mencionado):

1.500€................ Gastos Editoriales (que cubren la edición, el ISBN, la maquetación, etc. + los compromisos adquiridos con los micromecenas en forma de recompensas)

500€.................... Gastos y comisiones derivados de la campaña (comisión de la plataforma de Crowfunding + gastos de envío de las recompensas)

Cabe reseñar que el objetivo económico fijado en esta campaña es el mínimo para cubrir gastos, pero que sería necesario obtener más para poder desarrollar el proyecto en mejores condiciones. Para ser exactos, se necesitarían unos 400€ adicionales para mejorar la calidad de edición de la obra (gastos editoriales). A partir de ahí, todo lo "extra", serviría para cubrir gastos derivados de mi investigación que, por supuesto, comenzarían con los costos gastos de matrícula de Doctorado (unos 600€), pero que  van mucho más allá de los mismos (quizá eso explique  que seamos pocos los Doctorandos de la "variante masoquista", y bastantes más los de la "variante profesional", es decir, de los que cobran). Entre otros (gastos): libros, ebooks, transporte, material digital, exposiciones, participación en conferencias...

Lo que obtienes:

En primer lugar, aunque parezca obvio, mi infinita gratitud (o cuasi-infinita, en todo caso). Y si, además, tu buen samaritanismo es limitado y además de creer en mi proyecto y, por tanto, en mi, quieres adherirte al programa de recompensas... pues seguro que lo disfrutarás (espero).

Ahora quizás te digas: "¿Y para cuándo?"

Sé que la emoción puede llevar a la impaciencia, pero hay que creer en la paz zen.
"Reírse por no llorar" es un proyecto que aún no pasa de ser un zigoto, y debido a mi disponibilidad temporal, esto se asemeja más a el embarazo de un elefante (mirar en google: "Ranking de los mamíferos con mayor período de gestación").
A decir verdad será un poco menos... "Reírse por no llorar" será un proyecto totalmente finalizado entre el 1 de octubre y el 30 de noviembre de 2015. Una vez finalizado, ávidamente repartiré todas las recompensas ( a excepción del "certificado de participación", que se entregará una vez finalice esta campaña).
Mi compromiso: cada mes se informará a todos los micromecenas que hayan participado en el proyecto del estado del proyecto con todo lujo de detalles. Además, en www.reirsepornollorar.com habrá información pública sobre el mismo proyecto que se irá actualizando regularmente.

"Y si me caes bien pero aún soy más pobre que tú?"

En ese improbable pero posible caso (no especifico si por la primera, o por la segunda parte de la pregunta) , te rogaría que, al menos, puedas publicitar esta campaña durante su vigencia para que otras personas, quizás ligeramente menos pobres, puedan conocer este proyecto.
story_txt:
Nota: Puedes ver un adelanto sobre "Reírse por no llorar" en     www.reirsepornollorar.com.
¿Quieres participar en una idea diferente? Pues bien: esta seguro que lo es

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Math-on-the-Go

  • Do you have problems with math? 
  • Do you want to ask a math question from anywhere, at anytime at your convenience? 
  • Do you want to have a qualified math tutor? 

If your answer is yes to all then contribute NOW to get your solution.


I am Romzee, founder of Singapore Enovation Enterprises (SEE). Singapore is third worldwide in the PISA rankings for mathematics education. I was an educationist with 15 years experience in teaching math and science.

We offer an innovative math tuition using the WhatsApp application. You just need an internet enabled smartphone with camera function and you are good to go.

Other than getting help in math, you would also help us in our research on the use of smartphone technology in math education. 

The Sums

  • We offer you mathematics consultation at 1 hour blocks at US$99 using WhatsApp.  
  • You can get it for yourself, your children or "donate" it to others. Only an internet enabled smartphone with camera function is needed.
  • The good thing is that the 1 hour block is not continuous. Divide it into smaller blocks. In between, you can spend on your own sweet time working on a math problem. 
  • All your consultations is recorded in the WhatsApp for future references.
  • Wait, there is more! Other than yourself and the tutor, you get to invite another person into the chat group. Buy 1 and get 1 free!
  • Have a go with our service by choosing any of the perks available. If you are satisfied with it, we can extend it and renegotiate on the terms and conditions. 
  • One last thing if you have chosen our 1 , 2 or 3 hours block perks and not satisfied with the service, we will return 45% of the amount you have paid.

The Additions

Sign up for our 3-hour blocks and you will get 2 copies of our 10 page maths booklet for free! The booklet list out math formulas and common mathematical solving techniques.

          

  • The topics covered includes basic set theory (notations, Venn Diagrams, set operations) , 
  • algebra (simplification, factorization, linear equations, quadratic equations, subject formula),  
  • trigonometry (sine rule, cosine rule, obtuse angles), 
  • mensuration (perimeter and area of special quadrilaterals, surface area and volume of cuboids, prisms, cylinders, pyramids), 
  • matrices, vectors, statistics, practical mathematics and much more.


Math, Health & the Environment

Actually we are not just doing math. Math is integral in business and science. Math education is our core activity at the moment but we also care about people and the environment.
We need capital to do research and make prototypes for a fat reduction belt, human powered generator and roof top urban farming. Our focus will be on preventive healthcare and sustainable solutions for city living. If we can combine the two together that will be great.

Maybe you are not in need of a math tutor now. You can still help us by ordering the booklets for yourself or giving to others as a gift. Alternatively you can still contribute a small sum to our working capital and we will keep you updated on the progress of our other projects through e-mail.

We are looking forward to seeing your support.

Singapore Enovation Enterprises

story:
How the idea came to us:


Four years ago, we decided to support children with limited resources so that they had access to quality education and thus a greater opportunity to compete in this world. During a visit to a community of extreme poverty in Guatemala we met Jenny, an adorable little girl born with spina bifida, a degenerative disease that makes it impossible for her to go to school and learn, Jenny was our inspiration to develop a platform that could bring Education to all those girls and boys who can not access it through various situations.

We are a group of friends from different cultures who love Spanish. For this reason we are looking for an element that was important and unifying in all Spanish-speaking cultures and was born Frijoleo = Frijol (Bean) + Leer (Read)

This is how our dream began, wanting to help children who have difficulty going to school. However, now we realize that this dream can go much further. We see the possibility that no child, with or without resources, has access to an entertaining platform to learn to read and write. There is no platform like this for the Spanish speaking community that is accessible, easy, intuitive, fun and functional that provides a high quality education and that guarantees its learning.


We need your support and we will take care of it to reach those who need it.

To this day we have done a lot of research trying to learn what the best teaching and learning techniques are for kids. We have spent a year designing and developing the first phase of our game which consists of the complete alphabet and the construction of the first syllables. However, the way is still long, our desire is that our platform help children learn letters, syllables, words, phrases, sentences, sentences and then types of writing. Of course we want to launch an app for mobile and mobile devices and this is part of our next phases. According to our financial projections to achieve the next phases of the project we need to raise $ 175,000.00.

With this money we will give life to the new worlds and new adventures of Frijoleo where children will enjoy learning and playing at the same time. Our desire is to facilitate access to our platform at all so money will always be available to achieve this goal. Frijoleo will be a self-sustaining project that will be financed from the sale of worlds and new levels, prizes, promotions, products, books and other articles that will be developed as part of the natural growth of the project and our goal will be that for each child who pays for The use of Frijoleo will have a child benefited who will have access to the tool for free.


What do we dream? What do we want to achieve?

Our desire is to eliminate illiteracy, we know that it is an ambitious goal and we know that to achieve it requires much more than an application, but we are not afraid to achieve it, we believe that all deserve the same opportunity and it is our task, our responsibility to bring This opportunity to all those who today are in more complicated situations, so we ask ourselves where do we start? We started by doing our part. We want to build the largest community of Spanish-speaking education that exists to bring this right to all.


But it's not just about creating an application ...

For a project like the one we are developing it is necessary to have a lot of involved and many resources, in countries like Guatemala, not only to create the application for everyone to have access, we need equipment, internet, energy and often none of these components Available in communities of extreme poverty.

 

Would you like to support us?

There are many ways you can support us in pushing this process. We need volunteer teachers to go to schools and help children practice reading and writing skills. We can take advantage of equipment: Tablets, computers, laptops, smartphones. We can take advantage of materials such as paper, crayons, pencils or if you have a printer it would be fantastic to bring printed materials to the chic. Help us bring these options closer to the children who need it, there are thousands of ways you can activate money is always useful and of course it is welcome but we are going after an improvement in culture and create opportunities for all.

Thanks for your help!!

story:
Con los pies en la tierra y la cabeza en las nubes

Esa soy yo. La que busca nuevos horizontes. La que aún con incertidumbre se atreve. Simple pero compleja. Dulce pero fuerte. Con ambiciones y sueños por cumplir. Con una meta que hoy se abre ante mis ojos y que despierta mi esperanza, encendiendo una nueva luz que me señala el camino donde mis pies quieren andar.

Hoy te invito a ser parte de mi sueño, a viajar conmigo a través de mis ojos y descubrir la magia que vive en los que creen en ella. Así, con tu ayuda, siempre serás parte de mi historia.

 

Lo concreto...

Mi sueño en números

INTERNATIONAL EXCHANGE PROGRAM  NEW ZEALAND

Semester (24 weeks)  July/December 2018    
Tuition Fee (NCEA or short term students):     5.570 US$
Administration Fee:    571 US$
Homestay Fees: (200 PW)    4.800 US$
Insurance:    285 US$
Agency fee    857 US$
    
Total:    12.083 US$
    
 

Este viaje significa mucho para mi. Siento que tendré la oportunidad de crecer como persona en Nueva Zelanda. Hace cuatro años que no tengo la experiencia de ir a un colegio. Ahora lo viviré y me emociona saber que hay una familia que me acogerá y que se transformará por un tiempo en mi familia.

Me apasiona lo que me espera por aprender, hay tanto que conocer, que descubrir ... no puedo resistir las ganas de saltar directo al avión ahora mismo..

   

Te daría el cielo

Lograr mi sueño … qué podría darte … sólo puedo decirte gracias, regalarte mi sonrisa, mis ganas de crecer y simplemente vivir esta etapa gracias a ti.
story_txt:
Con los pies en la tierra y la cabeza en las nubes
Esa soy yo. La que busca nuevos horizontes. La que aún con incertidumbre se atreve. Simple pero compleja. Dulce pero fuerte. Con ambiciones y sueños por cumplir. Con una meta que hoy se abre ante mis ojos y que despierta mi esperanza, encendiendo una nueva luz que me señala el camino donde mis pies quieren andar.
Hoy te invito a ser parte de mi sueño, a viajar conmigo a través de mis ojos y descubrir la magia que vive en los que creen en ella. Así, con tu ayuda, siempre serás parte de mi historia.
 
Lo concreto...
Mi sueño en números
INTERNATIONAL EXCHANGE PROGRAM  NEW ZEALAND
Semester (24 weeks)  July/December 2018    Tuition Fee (NCEA or short term students):     5.570 US$Administration Fee:    571 US$Homestay Fees: (200 PW)    4.800 US$Insurance:    285 US$Agency fee    857 US$    Total:    12.083 US$     
Este viaje significa mucho para mi. Siento que tendré la oportunidad de crecer como persona en Nueva Zelanda. Hace cuatro años que no tengo la experiencia de ir a un colegio. Ahora lo viviré y me emociona saber que hay una familia que me acogerá y que se transformará por un tiempo en mi familia.
Me apasiona lo que me espera por aprender, hay tanto que conocer, que descubrir ... no puedo resistir las ganas de saltar directo al avión ahora mismo..
   
Te daría el cielo
Lograr mi sueño … qué podría darte … sólo puedo decirte gracias, regalarte mi sonrisa, mis ganas de crecer y simplemente vivir esta etapa gracias a ti.

story:
Lets face it, imagining ‘Future You’ is always an optimistic exercise. Future You goes to the gym more, tidies the house, learns a language, finishes those projects - but life gets in the way.

So, at Guruumee we get experts to sort you out - because what do experts do?

Firstly, they help in obvious ways like providing knowledge and guidance. But then, they can also help in lots of ways you’re not even aware of. It’s like they sprinkle a little magic dust over your life, and you just happen to find yourself raising your game.

Guruumee is a like vast, splendiferous library of human brains. It’s wisdom on tap - thousands upon thousands of experts willing to engage and sprinkle a little ‘magic’ for you.

Anything you're bad at, anything you're stuck with your journey can start here:

Not convinced you'll really change? Guruumee also leverages the power of group dynamics to help get you where you want to be. This is one of our favourite clips - beautifully demonstrating 'group power' and how it can be used for good.

By interacting with people who share similar goals and interests, you'll be able to push each other further towards success.

Become a Guruu and Share Your Knowledge

It's not just life coaching. Do you genuinely have something to offer in terms expertise, experience or inspiration? On Guruumee, you can reach a world-wide audience of those who will benefit the most from picking your brain. We're recruiting experts in just about everything…
 

As a Guruu, you'll experience the satisfaction of helping others achieve their goals. Not to mention - you'll be making cold hard cash, as well as raising money for charity. 

How Does It Work?:

The Interaction Cycle: The Guruu-Mentee relationship is based on the following model:

Questions, answers and tasks are in any format, including video, text, picture and audio uploads.  This gives Guruus a chance to impart their knowledge and show a little charisma, while providing a more personal connection and a better flow of inspiration for their followers.

Forums: Each Guruu’s forum is a social space exclusively for their mentees. You’ll be able to interact in a smaller, more topical and more engaging environment than online message boards.

Funding: Guruus get income (this is important, so we can trust their advice) and charities receive donations. In this way Guruumee will grow and improve while we also all give back to good causes. A minimum of 5% (after VAT) of the transaction fee goes to the Guruu’s chosen charity, although they can choose to donate any amount – even their whole fee!

Our Team

Nicola, Chris, Beth, Paul, Laura, Simon, we don't always look this good :)

Your Backing Achieves:

We will design, test and build Guruumee for both Android and iOS platforms. We're aiming to release a Beta within 5 months and the working prototype a month later. A few of us have already started on a little preparatory work - because that’s just how excited we are!

Get Involved:

Your support will help us bring our vision of GuruuMee to life:

  • Choose one of our awesome rewards to help fund the project
  • Visit Guruumee.com where you can nominate a charity to us, suggest someone who would be a great Guruu, or even vote for a celebrity who you would like to see become a Guruu.
  • Give us a like on Facebook or follow us on Twitter, or leave us a comment below. Be a key part of Guruumee just by discussing it with a few of your family and friends. Help us get the word out - help us help you (and us).

Thank you!

story:
Making Oxford a Better Place for Theatre

Help offset the cost to schools for bringing in theatre companies in order to help students with their GCSE and A-Level studies:

We intend to ensure that our actors are fairly rewarded for the work they do for us. Whenever possible this is done through giving 60-70% of our profits from productions to the cast.

Making theatre more accessible to the public. This covers everything from taking our shows to people that don't normally have the chance to go to the theatre, to making difficult texts, like Shakespeare, easier for people to follow and understand.

We always promise to provide our audiences with the highest quality or production that our means will allow.

We cast our actors based on talent alone. We don't care about experience or degrees. If we feel that you're right for the part then it's yours.

Students are being expected to write coursework and sit exams about plays that they have never seen. Your contribution will help end that.

We will also be offering workshops on the play from an actor’s perspective. Something that gives new insight into the works of Shakespeare that students don’t often get.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for just £2000 to offset the cost of performing in a number of schools around Oxfordshire. These students deserve to see the play they’re studying and shouldn’t be held liable for cuts to their budget.

By pledging you will be helping the arts in Oxford. If companies like our can continue to opperate and pay our actors then the quality of theatre in the county will increase.

If we don't reach our goal we will take the funds that we do have and make them work as best as possible.

If we excede our goal then it means we can do even more with the production than we originally thought possible and take it to more schools than originally planned.

The Impact

The combination of the free performance and workshops will mean that students in the county will have much more insight into the play and offer them a better chance at scoring well on their exams.

We've had actors move on to attend RADA, LAMDA, Bristol Old Vic and Central School of Speech and Drama. A production and tour like this will help even more of them.

This is a company run by actors. As such, we have more interest in producing quality theatre than in making loads of money.

Risks & Challenges

Every show comes with risks and challenges here are some that we face 

Putting on a show is not cheap. To do a show in Oxford it will cost at least £2000 in marketing alone. To do a tour would cost even more. We’re not even asking for the grand total here. Just enough to help us break even.

It's difficult to get investors because there's no assurance of a return. If there's no audience then there's no money. It doesn't matter how good the production is.

Doing a show that everyone knows can be tough, as you'll need to bring something new to it, but keep it familiar.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about us and our campaign.

Our website is www.donthatetheplayers.co.uk and you can find all of our social media tabs there.

If you saw our last show then why not write a review. Or share the ones we already have http://www.dailyinfo.co.uk/event/168177/The_Tam...

Thanks for taking the time to read this.
