Of those that exist, some have been photocopied and distributed digitally, replicated hundreds, if not thousands of times, but the content in places, diagrams, charts, photographs etc, can be very hard to read and of poor quality.This is where the idea came to recreate and remaster the flying manuals, all 1,500+ pages of them. Using original documents for reference, creating each page from scratch, word for word and page by page. Making brand-new vectored graphics for the diagrams and charts, taking brand new photos where applicable, replacing original photos contained and referenced within the manuals, ending up with a painstakingly accurate, remastered, replica of the original flying manuals. No photocopied images, no photocopied charts and graphs, and no photocopied graphics. Everything recreated with immense attention to detail and precision.When these documents have been completed, they would be so accurate that if Concorde were ever to fly again, you could use these manuals for flight - something normally forbidden. They will look like they were the 'Master Copies' of the document in fact.
(Above is a sample of how the manual will be remastered. On the left is the centre instrument stack image from the original 1976 flying manual. On the right, the new remastered graphics version of the same centre instrument stack. Clearer, crisper, more detailed than ever before. Better than the original!)
To recreate these manuals to this level of accuracy and detail is going to take time and money, and this is where you can help too. You can even own your own set of these manuals once we've finished!!

What We Need & What You Get
This is what we need and how we will deliver this project:

We intend on employing a full-time graphic designer/engineering team to recreate the technical graphics, diagrams, and charts.
Commission a technical writer to recreate each page, word for word in the exact font originally used in the manuals.
Commission a photographer to visit one of the Concordes on display and take the technical pictures originally noted in the manuals.

What's in it for you:

For a small donation of £10, you'll receive a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project, with our sincerest thanks.
For £37, you'll receive an exclusive Concorde Cockpit Poster, a training aid used by most pilots today. This isn't a photograph, this is a training aid poster, using high-quality graphics, showing all labels, switches, and levers, clearly marked and identifiable, and an excellent companion to the manuals themselves. You'll also receive a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project, with our sincerest thanks.
For £97, you'll receive a set of remastered Concorde Checklists. Recreated in the exact same way, with the exact same level and attention to detail, you'll receive both the main checklist used for flight on Concorde, plus the Emergency/Abnormal Drills Checklist too. Complete with a certificate of authenticity, plus a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project.
For £197, you can have your very own numbered copy of the manuals, complete with a certificate of authenticity, plus a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project.
For £297, you can have your very own numbered copy of the manuals, in leather, special edition binders, complete with a certificate of authenticity, plus a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project.
For £247, you'll receive a copy of the exclusive Concorde Cockpit Poster, a set of remastered checklists, and your very own numbered copy of the manuals - Standard Binders, complete with a certificate of authenticity, plus a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project. The Complete set!
For £397, you'll receive a copy of the exclusive Concorde Cockpit Poster, a set of remastered checklists, and your very own numbered copy of the manuals, in leather, special edition binders,complete with a certificate of authenticity, plus a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project. The Complete Leather set!
For £497, you'll receive one of a limited number of only 100 copies, in limited edition metal binders, crafted specifically for the Concorde Flying Manuals, etched with the number set you own, numbered, complete with a certificate of authenticity, plus a certificate acknowledging your contribution to the project. You'll also receive a copy of the exclusive Concorde Cockpit Poster, a set of remastered checklists. The ultimate collectors set!

(Image Credit: Marco Kunz - MarcoKunzPhotography - Thank you)

The Impact
It is unlikely that there'll be another aircraft like this for many years to come and what we're planning to create will be around long after the originals fall apart or are added to private collections or perhaps even lost forever.So, if you're a Concorde enthusiast like me or a collector, a Concorde Flight Sim fanatic, or someone who just so happens to find one of these rare machines in an old British Aerospace Hangar somewhere in deepest darkest Filton ;-), these Concorde Flying Manuals will make an amazing addition to your collection and help preserve the information they contain for generations to come!
Social Media
Please feel free to share your stories, and images and your love for the aircraft and/or our project, by showing support on the following social networks;Please use the following hashtags if possible too:#projectconcorde #concordefmrTwitter: @projectconcordeFacebook: @projectconcordeInstagram: @projectconcordeFlickr: projectconcordeTumblr: projectconcordeCredit: Main Header Image: Darren Pollard - Thank youCredit: Flight Deck Image: Marco Kunz - MarcoKunzPhotography - Thank you

story:
Overview

Hello, friends!

We are the third-year students and professor who teaches us programming. During our education at the university, we have noticed the problem that some people in our society have the barriers in the communication – they can’t speak and hear.

Recently we have taken part in the hackathon “AI for Good” by Microsoft. We have created the prototype of the platform, which may break down these barriers. This interactive platform is aimed to teach you sign language while playing. It uses computer vision, i.e. the user’s camera identify his or her gestures. The jury and the audience were really impressed by our prototype, so we have decided to go beyond our prototype and develop it to help the society.

Our solution

We plan to create a platform (website and mobile application) for easy and quick learning of sign language. Today we have a fully functional prototype of our website (you can see on the video how it works and on screenshots below). We decided to call our project a gestucation = gesture + education. It will be located at gestucation.com

Our prototype works as follows:  1. The system shows you gestures first.

2. After that you need to repeat the gesture, and the system controls the accuracy.

3. You get stars, depending on how correctly and accurately you take the lesson. It's easier to learn in a playful way.

4. In your personal account, you can see the overall progress of the study and the history and grades for the lessons. You can repeat the lesson if in doubt or forgot.

You are probably wondering why we have chosen the gorilla as our logo? We will talk about this a little later.

And also, we plan to develop a translator integrated into AR glasses, which will translate from sign language into synthesized speech (for people without hearing impairment) and speech into text in real time (reverse translation for hearing impaired people).

The mobile application will work as follows:

  1. The person shows the phrase with a gesture.
  2. Augmented reality glasses read it and recognize.
  3. The person with glasses and the rest of the participants in the conversation (if they exists) get text and synthetic speech to their mobile application .
  4. Every participant of the convercation can respond with speech to a gesture phrase, then the speech is recognized and translated into text so that a person with hearing impairments can understand the answer.

With our platform, we want to tell the world that sign language is not that complicated. Also, this is not a reason to raise barriers in the communication.

Cost structure

Which will be spent on:

  • maintaining servers,

  • paying for the work of professional methodologists and designers,
  • purchasing the necessary equipment for testing and development, for example, AR glasses.

We will write the program code ourselves. Regardless of the amount of money collected, we will bring this idea to life, at least at the website level. To implement our idea on a full scale (a mobile app with AR support and website), we need at least $ 250,000.

By supporting us, you will help people from different countries learn sign language and break down barriers in communication between them.

Why will we succeed?

Our professor has Ph.D. in technical sciences and over has 9 years of experience in software development and the launch and implementation of various projects, which gives us confidence that the project will start. We do not see any serious risks of launching this platform – all information and technologies are available. In addition, as we noted above at the hackathon, the jury noted that the project has high chances of implementation.

We would like to point out that the entire platform will be absolutely free for end users.

We plan to launch the website in the first three months and gradually develop it, adding different sign languages of the world. In five months after that, we plan to release a mobile application for Apple and Android devices.

Why a gorilla after all?

Now about the gorilla. Our logo is a stylized image of Koko the gorilla (check out this Wikipedia article). She learned over 1000 gestures and communicated successfully with people. You must admit that, if a gorilla was able to learn 1000 gestures – anyone of us can do it also.

In conclusion

According to the WHO, more than 5% of the world's population - 466 million people (432 million adults and 34 million children) - suffer from disabling hearing loss. Most of these people live in low- and middle-income countries.

Let's break down communication barriers together!

Also tell your friends and acquaintances about our idea.

story:
After 15 years working with children in Montessori environments I am interested in building a tool for Guides to improve the effectiveness of Sandpaper Letter Presentations.

As a Guide it is helpful to know which sandpaper letters a child already knows, which letters have been presented but not mastered, and which have never been presented: 26 pieces of data for each child.  30 children in an environment is (26 x 30 = ) 780 discrete pieces of data to remember or record and access.

Over the years I have tried a variety of systems including note cards for each child, a letter size paper with a table containing data for all children in the environment and even a laissez-faire approach in which no records were kept and each presentation began with reviewing all letters until we found three for that day.  I think there is a better system.

I think that a good tool makes the work more effective - a shovel digs a hole better than my hands,  a stove is more convenient than cooking on a fire everyday, and gps directions are better than the directions from the gas station attendant.

I want a tool, an android app, for Guides that enhances the effectiveness of Sandpaper Letter presentations.  This app will only be useful to Guides and will be not be appropriate for children.

An app can harness technologies that will enhance effectiveness in the following ways:

 

Improves reviews of previously presented letters

An app can harness the computing power of databases and algorithms to support Spaced Learning.  

In 1932 in the book Psychology of Study, Prof. C. A. Mace argued that  "Perhaps the most important discoveries are those which relate to the appropriate distribution of the periods of study...Acts of revision should be spaced in gradually increasing intervals, roughly intervals of one day, two days, four days, eight days, and so on."  Subsequent research supports his argument that review is more effective with this technique.

It makes sense that a child needs less review for sounds they remember well and that challenging the child to recall after increasing intervals is a better measure of learning.  I cannot imagine trying to remember not only whether a child knows the letter but also how well they recall the sound and when it was last reviewed. I shudder at the thought of the complications and confusion inherent in a paper based record keeping with this level of specificity.

However, an app using an algorithm can adjust the review intervals such that more challenging letters appear for review more often and letters that are easily recalled are presented less often.  The difficulty is defined by the Guide based on observation of how easily the child recalls the correct sound for the letter.

The Guide tells the app if it was difficult for the child to remember and the app does the hard part of scheduling and remembering review intervals.

 

Improved selection of letter groups for Three Period Lessons

In my training it was advised that in any three period lesson we should begin with greatest differences first and gradually work towards smaller differences.  This is why the geometry cabinet begins with a presentation of circle, square, and triangle as opposed to three circles of different diameters.

Of course a vowel is always included in each grouping until all vowels are learned - but what about all the consonants?  I try to intentionally select the letters to maintain maximal difference, but I invariably end up presenting similar letters at some point (such as G, C, D).

The University of Iowa published a fantastic site called Sounds of Speech that groups letters according to the manner of articulation which “refers to how the sound is produced and the way in which the airstream is modified as it passes through the vocal tract.”  Sounds are labeled as a STOP, FRICATIVE, AFFRICATE, NASAL, LIQUID, or GLIDE. Sounds that have the same manner of articulation have the most similar sounds.

An app can utilize an algorithm to suggest letters from different manners of articulation to maximize differences in every presentation.  I can imaginea paper-based system to accomplish this goal, but I think a database and algorithm will do the work better and faster.

 

A WORD ABOUT TECHNOLOGY AND DEVICES

Although I do not advocate the use of digital technologies and devices by children in a Primary environment, I do recognize that these are powerful tools and ubiquitous in our modern lives.  I believe that an important aspect of the Guide’s duty is to model appropriate use of technology with Grace and Courtesy. I believe that removing a minor concern (not safety related) from the environment also removes the opportunity to educate children about how to appropriately approach the concern.

 

What We Need to Make it Happen

All funds will pay for the Indiegogo fees and the labor/expertise of Aaron Dunigan AtLee who will write and test the code for the Sandpaper Letter App.   Aaron based his labor estimates on experience with previous coding projects and confirmed these estimates with the calculators at https://estimatemyapp.com/ and http://howmuchtomakeanapp.com/.

What You Get

If the project is fully funded you will receive perks or rewards based on your funding level.  See PERKS.

The Android app will be sold online when it is completed and most of the perks involve receiving complimentary a download of the app.  The donation is less than it will cost in the store, so you are essentially pre-ordering the app at a discount!

If the project does not reach its goal your donation will be refunded by Indiegogo in 5-7 business days after the project deadline.  There is no risk for you - either you get an app or your money back.

If we raise funds beyond our goal amount we will use the additional funds for any unexpected expenses and to explore options for an iOS (Apple) App, cloud storage, and integration with existing online record keeping systems such as Transparent Classroom.

 

Spread the Word

Our project has Montessori expertise (Ed Stanford) and Coding expertise (Aaron Dunigan AtLee) and a vision for a tool to enhance the effectiveness of Sandpaper Letter Presentations.

Here are your next steps

Imagine how the children would benefit from learning the Sandpaper Letters easier and faster!

Pledge funds to the project!

Tell your colleagues, co-workers, friends, and community about this project. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank you

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you

story:
WHAT IS THE EDUPLUS?

Eduplus is a project aimed at students in countries with entrance examinations for the university. It is a web and mobile based project that aims to help students with low income to prepare for the exam.

 

WHAT IS THE PURPOSE?

There are millions of students in our world who cannot reach quality education and necessary facilities. Even though these students are very intelligent, their education is lacking due to the economic conditions they are in. We need educated individuals to make our world more livable in the future.

Our aim is to produce content and environments that help students with low income to prepare for university exams.We set out to create a platform where students can test themselves and get their own analysis.In addition, our project aims to help students communicate with each other and to help each other.

 

WHAT ARE THE PROJECT STAGES?

We chose Turkey as a pilot country for our project.The reason we chose this country is that the country is at the center of the Asian and European continents.We aim to reach the students in other countries more easily by using the geographical advantage of the country.

 

PROJECT TARGET BY YEARS

 

 

 

 

WHY DO YOU NEED DONATE?

Our application is training test and analysis application.That's why we need quality and instructional content and materials for students in need.In the first phase of the project, we need your donations to provide content.

 

WILL THIS SERVICE BE FREE TO USE ?

We will implement this project with the donations from you. So we have added this section to be transparent to you.

We have to take minimum wages to provide students with continuous and educational content.In this way, we can ensure the continuity of the project.We offer a price chart to enlighten you, please review.

 

(The data are based on the pilot country.It is a required monthly amount for a student to prepare for university exams.)

 

Thank you for reading and evaluating our project.

story:
Expelling Misconceptions

Shifting the perception of school exclusion


**Important note: the event and campaign has been postponed due to unforeseen circumstances . Please note that we will be back in the Spring to give you a show of epic proportions. If you want to speak to us in the meantime - please get in touch: events@cenlive.org
Thanks for all of your support,
The CEN team!



Our campaign

On the 21st October 2015,  the Communities Empowerment Network (CEN) and Island Records are taking over London's Camden Roundhouse. Our aim is to bring together artists, speakers and supporters to expel misconceptions around school exclusion. You'll get to see Jermain Jackman, Ayanna Witter-Johnson, The British Collective and exclusive performances from Island Records artists, all giving their time to help our cause (please see line up below). The money we raise will be used to grow our charity and support our vision that families and children will always have somewhere to turn when faced with issues at school, and that every child has the opportunity to fulfil their potential.

The story

We all want our kids to grow up to be a success. If your child could be the next Eric Clapton, Lewis Hamilton, or even Albert Einstein you'd be happy. Right? 

But all three were excluded from school:

  • Eric Clapton - not handing in enough work due to spending his time playing guitar and listening to the blues.

  • Lewis Hamilton - wrongly accused of involvement in a fight.

  • Albert Einstein - disruptive in class because he only wanted to study Maths and didn't see the point in other subjects.

Think about your own time at school. Does it sound like you? Or a friend?

Some are lucky. Some bounce back better than others. Some have the support of family and strong networks. Some are geniuses.

But what if your child was excluded from school tomorrow? Would you know what to do? Who to contact? Would you have the confidence to take on a system heavily stacked against you?

This is the world that CEN, its advocates and its volunteers face on a daily basis. We work with over 1,000 parents each year who are fighting for the best outcomes for their children. They need help and in the current climate,  there is a decreasing number of places to find it. We are currently dealing with the tip of the iceberg but we're growing and we need your support. 

What happens to families who can't get help?

Martin Narey, former Director General of the Prison Service:

“The 13,000 children being excluded from school each year might as well be given a ticket to join the prison system some time later on down the line.”

Dr Mary Bousted, General Secretary of the Association of Teachers and Lecturers:

“Permanent exclusions are a tragedy for those children and their families and we must find a way to prevent so many from facing exclusion from school.”

As adults, we love reading about mavericks – those who test boundaries, who do things differently, whose talents we aspire to.

We promote them at work, we cheer them at sporting events, we applaud them at concerts and festivals. Yet at school, increasingly we tell them to keep quiet, tuck in their shirts and conform. But they're young people. Young people who need to learn to explore boundaries and fulfil their potential. To go on to be the people who we so love. Yes there will be problems, but as adults it's surely our responsibility to support them and help them grow. Should we not support their free spirit in the same way we do the mavericks we so admire?

Expelling Misconceptions

We all know the media narrative. These are "bad kids" who just want to "disrupt" everyone else in the class. To "stop them learning". They're "unruly teenagers who don't care". Kick them out. Let them pay for their mistakes.

But what about:

  • Our youngest client J who at the age of 4 is being excluded because the school struggle with his disability?

  • M who has short term memory problems and may well be excluded because he shouts answers before he forgets them but often does not raise his hand first?

  • Or K whose parents split up and he's struggling to deal with the situation, causing him to misbehave in class because he's so upset?

What if we told you that 7 out of every 10 children excluded have special educational needs? (see article)

Do these examples expel some of your own misconceptions?

Young people who face issues at school can go on to be successful. Even Sir Richard Branson dropped out of school. His headmaster at the exclusive Stowe school told him he’d either end up in prison or become a millionaire. He was wrong on both counts; Branson is a billionaire. 

CEN passionately believes that these square pegs in round holes deserve a closer look, a re-evaluation and a second chance. 


Our charity

Perhaps you have not heard of us? Since 1999, CEN has been fighting for the educational rights of children and providing support to their families. Success for us is often simply having been there for a family at a time of crisis. It's a tough system to crack and one in which "winning" has very different parameters, but we continue to do our best with limited resources. 80% of our parents feel more confident about their child's future education after working with us and we're incredibly proud of that, given the challenges of the system.  

We have received fantastic support from our funders and supporters who include; Big Lottery, Esme Fairbairn, Children in Need, Santander, The Henry Smith charity, John Lyon's charity and Salesforce. Without their belief and backing, thousands of parents would have been left without support. But we want to grow our funds and have the ability to scale our work and support more families around the UK without relying on grants. It's a long term vision but it's our passion and it starts with this campaign and your help.


Charity founders 

If you've watched our video, you'll have seen Gus John and Deuan German talk about the issues of exclusion. 

Professor John, a founder of the charity,  is an award-winning writer, education campaigner, consultant, lecturer and researcher. He has completed notable work in the fields of education policy, management and international development. He is an expert in his field, dedicated to fighting for equality and is an inspiration to all who meet him. 

Deuan is the Strategic Director of CEN. He first spent 15 years playing in and managing, a 10 piece ska/reggae/funk band whose aim was to explore the globe off the beaten track, whilst bringing joy, unity and exuberance to wherever they played (from prisons to festivals). Since 1999, after receiving a request from his father the late Gerry German (founder of CEN), Deuan has played an integral part in running and developing the charity.

Your event

Expelling Misconceptions will raise the profile of CEN within the UK, highlighting the issues behind school exclusions and the vulnerability of many unfairly excluded children. We are holding an event that celebrates creative artistry and will enable us to grow our charity, scale up and raise our profile across the UK, in order to support many more families.

You'll spend the evening at the incredible Camden Roundhouse, learn about our work, have a drink or two and meet some fantastic people. In return for your support, you will receive exclusive performances from:  

Jermain Jackman, NCS ambassador and winner of BBC's The Voice 2014

Ayanna Witter-Johnson, cellist, vocalist and pioneer of Black folk music

The British Collective, a supergroup of some of Britain's biggest male R&B icons

Plus EXCLUSIVE performance from Island records artists to be confirmed...

We've worked incredibly hard to secure artists and speakers that share our passion to give you a night that you'll remember - the type of event you'd go to even if it wasn't for a charity. But it is. 

Our team will be there and we'd love to meet you and share our stories. Your support will not only buy you a great night out but also the fantastic feeling that you've made a difference to the life of a young person and their family. It is a contribution that might just see a new Clapton, Hamilton or Einstein supported rather than abandoned. You could be part of that. 

Event details

When: Wednesday October 21st 2015

Where: The Camden Roundhouse 

Getting to the venue: Click here for details.
Times: Doors open at 7pm and the fun begins around 8pm. We will be all done and dusted by 11pm.

Perks

Obviously you’re mainly thinking of contributing to help the charity, but as a thank you we’re going to give you some great rewards in return (because we are really grateful for your support).

Firstly there are a number of ticket packages. If you’re just after a ticket then buy the early birds before they fly! These are a steal at £17 a ticket (booking fee included), so it is a cheap gig, and the bonus is that you are donating money to charity. If you miss out on the early tickets don’t worry, you’re still getting an amazing deal to see all of these artists, but with added feel-good factor.

Thinking of buying VIP tickets? Do it. Splash out. You won’t get many opportunities to grab a goodie bag (worth a minimum of £50), three drinks (£30 alone in a private Soho members’ club), comfy seated tickets, with a chance to mingle with the organisers and possibly even some of the artists.

If you’d like to be more proactive in helping the charity, opt for the package that comes with membership benefits. You can also buy a goodie bag, to get some really exciting “stuff”, worth a minimum of £50, including an emergency smartphone charging gadget (kindly donated by our partners ECHO). We’ll also give you some items with our logo on it, so you can start telling the world about Expelling Misconceptions!

On top of all of these amazing personal packages, there are also two corporate packages; show sponsor, and show partner. So you can get your company involved too! The difference between these packages (besides cost) is the coverage we’re going to provide you. A sponsor will appear on all marketing material and will get 8 VIP tickets to bring along some people you’re trying to impress. The show partner gets all this, plus 2 extra tickets, with their name publicised alongside Island Records and ECHO. We’ll also give you lots more PR opportunities, including a dedicated interview for our event video and luxury networking thank you lunch with the key event stakeholders.

If you have any specific queries regarding the perks please visit our FAQ page or email us at events@cenlive.org

Your details will be shared with the Roundhouse Trust in order to provide a full ticketing service. Your contact information will not be used by the Roundhouse for marketing purposes. Read the Roundhouse's terms and conditions.

Sponsors 

We have several of amazing companies that have partnered with us to ensure that Expelling Misconceptions is a total success! So we want to give a special thanks to show partners:


and sponsors:


To see all details on sponsors click here. If your company wants to get involved, we would love to hear from you - check out our perks packages for details, or email us at events@cenlive.org. 

Risks

With a sponsor like Island Records, there is no doubt that the event is going to happen. The main risk we have is that it appeals to concert goers more than people who are genuinely interested in the subjects of school exclusion and education reform.

This isn’t about holding a concert so we can all have a rave in the Roundhouse. This is about using a high profile event at a prestigious venue to make the national media and general public aware of what we are doing. We need to raise enough money to enable CEN to meet the increasing demand for our services in London and to help build satellites of CEN to deal with the growing number of cases that are referred to us from outside London. 

The Team

For full bios of the people behind our campaign visit our team page.

If you have any specific queries regarding the campaign please visit our FAQ page or email us at events@cenlive.org

CEN would love your support today! Together we can Expel Misconceptions, shift perceptions of exclusions and ensure quality education for all young people.

Thank you!
story_txt:
Expelling
Misconceptions

Shifting
the perception of school exclusion


**Important note: the event and campaign has been postponed due to unforeseen circumstances . Please note that we will be back in the Spring to give you a show of epic proportions. If you want to speak to us in the meantime - please get in touch: events@cenlive.org
Thanks for all of your support,The CEN team!Our campaign

On
the 21st October 2015,  the Communities Empowerment
Network (CEN) and Island Records are taking over London's Camden Roundhouse. Our aim is to bring together artists, speakers and supporters to expel misconceptions around school exclusion. You'll get to see Jermain Jackman, Ayanna Witter-Johnson, The British Collective and exclusive performances from Island Records artists, all giving their time to help our cause (please see line up below). The money we
raise will be used to grow our charity and support our vision that
families and children will always have somewhere to turn when faced
with issues at school, and that every child has the opportunity to fulfil their potential.
The story

We
all want our kids to grow up to be a success. If your child could be
the next Eric Clapton, Lewis Hamilton, or even Albert Einstein you'd
be happy. Right? 

But
all three were excluded from school:



Eric
	Clapton - not handing in enough work due to spending his time playing guitar and listening to the blues.



Lewis
	Hamilton - wrongly accused of involvement in a fight.



Albert
	Einstein - disruptive
	in class because he only wanted to study Maths and didn't see the
	point in other subjects.



Think
about your own time at school. Does it sound like you? Or a friend?

Some are lucky. Some bounce back better than others. Some have the support
of family and strong networks. Some are geniuses.

But
what if your child was excluded from school tomorrow? Would you know
what to do? Who to contact? Would you have the confidence to take on
a system heavily stacked against you?

This
is the world that CEN, its advocates and its volunteers face on a
daily basis. We work with over 1,000 parents each year who are
fighting for the best outcomes for their children. They need help and
in the current climate,  there is a decreasing number of places to find it. We are currently dealing with the tip of the iceberg but we're growing and we need your support. 
What
happens to families who can't get help?

Martin
Narey, former Director General of the Prison Service:“The 13,000 children being excluded from school each year might as well be given a ticket to join the prison system some time later on down the line.”

Dr
Mary Bousted, General Secretary of the Association of Teachers and
Lecturers:

“Permanent
exclusions are a tragedy for those children and their families and we
must find a way to prevent so many from facing exclusion from
school.”

As
adults, we love reading about mavericks – those who test
boundaries, who do things differently, whose talents we aspire to.

We
promote them at work, we cheer them at sporting events, we applaud
them at concerts and festivals. Yet at school, increasingly we tell them
to keep quiet, tuck in their shirts and conform. But they're young
people. Young people who need to learn to explore boundaries and
fulfil their potential. To go on to be the people who we so love.
Yes there will be problems, but as adults it's surely our responsibility to
support them and help them grow. Should we not support their free spirit
in the same way we do the mavericks we so admire?
Expelling
Misconceptions

We
all know the media narrative. These are "bad kids" who just
want to "disrupt" everyone else in the class. To "stop
them learning". They're "unruly teenagers who don't care".
Kick them out. Let them pay for their mistakes.

But
what about:



	Our
	youngest client J who at the age of 4 is being excluded because the
	school struggle with his disability?



	M
	who has short term memory problems and may well be excluded because
	he shouts answers before he forgets them but often does not raise his
	hand first?



	Or
	K whose parents split up and he's struggling to deal with the
	situation, causing him to misbehave in class because he's so upset?



What
if we told you that 7 out of every 10 children excluded have special
educational needs? (see article)

Do
these examples expel some of your own misconceptions?

Young
people who face issues at school can go on to be successful. Even Sir Richard Branson dropped out of school. His headmaster at the exclusive Stowe school told him he’d either end up in prison or become a millionaire. He was wrong on both counts; Branson is a billionaire. CEN passionately believes that these square pegs in round holes deserve a closer look, a re-evaluation and a second chance. 
Our charity

Perhaps you have not heard of us? Since 1999, CEN has been fighting for the educational rights of children and providing support to their families. Success for us is often simply having been there for a family at a time of crisis. It's a tough system to crack and one in which "winning" has very different parameters, but we continue to do our best with limited resources. 80% of our parents feel more confident about their child's future education after working with us and we're incredibly proud of that, given the challenges of the system.  We have received fantastic support from our funders and supporters who include; Big Lottery, Esme Fairbairn, Children in Need, Santander, The Henry Smith charity, John Lyon's charity and Salesforce. Without their belief and backing, thousands of parents would have been left without support. But we want to grow our funds and have the ability to scale our work and support more families around the UK without relying on grants. It's a long term vision but it's our passion and it starts with this campaign and your help.Charity founders If you've watched our video, you'll have seen Gus John and Deuan German talk about the issues of exclusion. 
Professor John, a founder of the charity,  is an award-winning writer, education campaigner, consultant, lecturer and researcher. He has completed notable work in the fields of education policy, management and international development. He is an expert in his field, dedicated to fighting for equality and is an inspiration to all who meet him. 
Deuan is the Strategic Director of CEN. He first spent 15 years playing in and managing, a 10 piece ska/reggae/funk band whose aim was to explore the globe off the beaten track, whilst bringing joy, unity and exuberance to wherever they played (from prisons to festivals). Since 1999, after receiving a request from his father the late Gerry German (founder of CEN), Deuan has played an integral part in running and developing the charity.Your event

Misconceptions will raise the profile of CEN within the UK,
highlighting the issues behind school exclusions and the
vulnerability of many unfairly excluded children. We are holding an
event that celebrates creative artistry and will enable us to grow
our charity, scale up and raise our profile across the UK, in order to support many more families.

You'll
spend the evening at the incredible Camden Roundhouse, learn about
our work, have a drink or two and meet some fantastic people. In return for your support, you will receive exclusive performances from:  Jermain Jackman, NCS ambassador and winner of BBC's The Voice 2014

Ayanna Witter-Johnson, cellist, vocalist and pioneer of Black folk musicThe British Collective, a supergroup of some of Britain's biggest male R&B iconsPlus EXCLUSIVE performance from Island records artists to be confirmed...

and sponsors:



To see all details on sponsors click here. If your company wants to get involved, we would love to hear from you - check out our perks packages for details, or email us at events@cenlive.org.

story:
What is Factor Hunter?

Factor Hunter is an exciting mathematics card game for age 8 to adults to learn factor and multiple.


What We Need & What You Get

What Do We Need?

We have to make this game in a factory for at least 1000 sets. We hope to share these game sets to people all over the world. To achieve this goal, we need your support. You may:

  • get a perk, so you can have our game set too.
  • donate for us, and schools can be benefited with a free game set by you.
  • share this project to your friends, especially those who are students, parents and teachers.

What Can You Get?

You can get our game sets or Factor Rulers as a souvenir.

How the fund be used?

The game include 56 “number cards”, 22 “character cards”, 108 “toy treasure”(see notes below), an A5 size instruction manual, a 9cm x 12cm bag for holding those “toy treasure” and a box to keep all material tidy.


Notes for “toy treasure”: we add this because a hunter game can motivate boys more than girls, so we add these element in order to attract girls to play. You know, children are attracted to concrete objects than abstract concept.

      

“Factor hunter” is a great game because:

  • it can engage students with different ability,
  • it provide visualize the relationship of factor and multiple between number,
  • the cards in this game are good teaching aids for teacher,
  • it provide emotional experience (the game is very exciting, even for adult) of learning mathematics concepts to students,
  • it is a relatively cheap and very effective method to drill mathematics exercises in related topics compare to hiring a tutor.

What can “Factor hunter” achieve?

“Factor hunter” engage players in using the concept of multiplication, division, factor, multiple, logic and number theory.  We want to mass produce this broad game so that students over the world can enjoy it.

There are still more teaching goals that “Factor hunter” can achieve:

  1. Build up the number sense related to factors and multiples.
  2. Familiar with the fact that 1 is the common factor of all numbers.
  3. Practice the concept of multiple and factor.
  4. Familiar with multiplication from 1 to 11.
  5. Familiar with concept of intersection and union of two sets.
  6. May use “proof by contradiction” (When prove when some player play wrongly).
  7. Use theorem in number theory "given that m and n relatively prime, if m and n are factor of k, then mn is also a factor of k" (When they guess the character card).
  8. Use theorem in number theory "given that m is a factor of n and n is a factor of p, then m is also a factor of p" (When issuing number cards that will not disclose more about his character card)
  9. Use of logical thinking to get advantage in the game (When finding the character card).

Who can benefit from”Factor hunter”

What we want to achieve is not just producing a card game, but also foster an environment of pleasurable learning. With proper promotion, We hope this game can help:

  • About 700,000,000 Primary school Students: showing them learning can be enjoyable,
  • Their Parents: building relationship by playing,
  • Low income families: help them to educating their children,
  • About 20,000,000 Homeschooling parents: provide a good options for,
  • School management of 300,000 primary school: help schools to maintain a pleasurable learning atmosphere.


How can you help bringing this great game to children?

The most direct way to help is to take a perk. Also, you can share this project with any parents, friends with children, students, teachers and anyone who are enthusiastic about education by Facebook, Twitter or email.

Stretch Goals:


US$10,000:
We deliver 10 sets of premium packages to public schools free of charge.

US$20,000:

We deliver 25 MORE sets of premium packages to public schools free of charge.

US$50,000:

We deliver 65 MORE sets of premium packages to public schools free of charge.

US$100,000:

We put the card game into the public domain, that means anyone can make it without violating the copyright issue!

How to play:

A Figure showing game flow from steps A to D

This video demonstrate how to play Factor Hunter
A. Setting Up
  1. Deal five cards to each player.
  2. Stack any remaining number cards face-up in the middle of the table as drawing stack.
  3. Deal a character card to each player.
  4. Stack any remaining character cards face-up in the middle of the table as another stack.
B. Start Round - Attack
  1. Choose arbitrary player be the first attacker or the next player be attacker.
  2. The attacker player pulls one card that is a factor of his base or he can pulls pass card which can be reused (because he has no card to pull or he don't want to pull any card).
C. Continue Round - Guess
  1. After attacker pulled a card, player on his left can guess the number of attacker base.
  2. If a player guess wrongly, two treasure will be destroyed immediately.
  3. If correct, that player can award number of treasure shown on the cards pulled by the attacker and get the character card from the attacker and can use the special ability shown in the character cards once.
  4. After that, this round finished and the next player starts another round by repeating step B1.
D. Continue Round - Pass
  1. If a player cannot guess the number of attacker, he can pass.
  2. If all player pass, all player except attacker should give 1 treasure to attacker.
  3. After that, this round finished and the next player starts another round by repeating step B1.
E. Special Situation - Attacker Pass, Wrong Cards
  1. If the attacker choose to pass, all defender can guess
  2. If an attack pull out wrong card (say, his base is 5, but he give out 3 to attack), and if any other player correctly Point out that, he can award 5 * numbers of attacker's card.
F. End Game
  1. When any player get 3 character cards, the game end. The player with most gems will be the winner.

story:
WHAT?

Kenya needs a critical mass of job creators through sustainable scalable innovations and people who think and act different to change the status quo. The Nairobi Team will change the unfavorable mindset and legacies, and write a new script of smart innovations for sustainable entrepreneurship and development.

IN KENYA!

The Nairobi Team would like to involve you in bringing Impact to Nairobi. Evidence shows that the youth, who make up two thirds of unemployed Kenyans, bear the brunt of a lack of mentorship, co-working space and capital to transform ideas into thriving businesses. 

We believe that the problems of the 21st century demand more of transformed and motivated mindsets that notice opportunities to solve real-world problems innovatively, with technology and collaboration being the inexhaustible fuel in actualizing the extraordinary imaginations of these talented citizens.


WHY WE NEED YOU NOW :)

To make it to Candidate stage we have to fulfill Pre-Candidates requirements as part of Feasibility Study; one is to visit an already operating space and in our case Impact Hub Amsterdam is a good case study. The other is to do a market analysis through a community event which we will involve founding members and partners. 


The funds you contribute will go towards financing the air ticket, Visa application and Food costs on our visit to Impact Hub Amsterdam. 


You must be wondering if 800 dollars will be enough for two people to travel and stay for 4 days in Amsterdam. Luckily, our primary contacts (such as family and closest friends) helped us with half of the tickets for both team members, Renatha and Michael (thank you folks!). But the other half is still missing. Also, we won´t spend much with accommodation, luckily (n° 2) couchsurfing exists. But the Visa application and the Food costs we couldn´t escape from. That´s why we need your help.

We are not only just looking for you to contribute to this cause but we are requesting you to be part of a foundation of the culture of change. Let´s create an ecosystem of change makers through innovation, collaboration and human centered technology. Let´s create it together?


*You can also help us sharing this crowdfunding link on facebook, twitter or email.*
story_txt:
WHAT?
Kenya needs a critical mass of job creators through sustainable scalable innovations and people who think and act different to change the status quo. The Nairobi Team will
 change the unfavorable mindset and legacies, and write a new script of 
smart innovations for sustainable entrepreneurship and development.
IN KENYA!
The Nairobi Team would like to involve you in bringing Impact to Nairobi. Evidence shows that the youth, who make up two thirds of unemployed Kenyans, bear the brunt of a lack of mentorship, co-working space and capital to transform ideas into thriving businesses. 
We believe that the problems of the 21st century demand more of transformed and motivated mindsets that notice opportunities to solve real-world problems innovatively, with technology and collaboration being the inexhaustible fuel in actualizing the extraordinary imaginations of these talented citizens.

WHY WE NEED YOU NOW :)


To make it to Candidate stage we have to fulfill Pre-Candidates requirements as part of Feasibility Study; one is to visit an already operating space and in our case Impact Hub Amsterdam is a good case study. The other is to do a market analysis through a community event which we will involve founding members and partners. 


The funds you contribute will go towards financing the air ticket, Visa application and Food costs on our visit to Impact Hub Amsterdam. 

You must be wondering if 800 dollars will be enough for two people to travel and stay for 4 days in Amsterdam. Luckily, our primary contacts (such as family and closest friends) helped us with half of the tickets for both team members, Renatha and Michael (thank you folks!). But the other half is still missing. Also, we won´t spend much with accommodation, luckily (n° 2) couchsurfing exists. But the Visa application and the Food costs we couldn´t escape from. That´s why we need your help.
We are not only just looking for you to contribute to this cause but we are requesting you to be part of a foundation of the culture of change. Let´s create an ecosystem of change makers through innovation, collaboration and human centered technology. Let´s create it together?

*You can also help us sharing this crowdfunding link on facebook, twitter or email.*

story:
We, the SWAYAM BANDHU organization have been contributing to provide basic healthcare to the sufferers of nepal earthquake, especially, children. 

In all, the earthquake destroyed 446 public health facilities—including hospitals, primary health care centres (PHCC) and health posts (HP)— and 16 private establishments. In addition, 701 public health facilities are partially damaged, along with 64 private health establishments. The country had a total of 4,468 public and private health care facilities.

The total value of damages and losses to the healthcare system is estimated at 5.96 billion Nepalese rupees ($58 million), and rebuilding will likely cost 11.27 billion Nepalese rupees ($110 million) over the next five years, according to the report.

The earthquake has already killed 18 health workers and volunteers and injured 74, according to the latest report, compounding the difficulty of providing the required health services in its immediate aftermath.

Till the the time, the establishments are up and running, we need to provide basic health and psych care to the nepalese citizens, specially children who have been the major sufferers so that they are able to stand up on their feet. They at least deserve a chance to live healthy. Already, there is huge shortage of food and sheds, healthcare is a must in the situation today.

Any amount of donation, small and big will help them get the least that they deserve and would be a big boost to our efforts in stationing health care workers in the country.

story:
A starting point

Have you ever thought about the idea of becoming a programmer, a full stack web developer*?

Why would you?

There are many, many reasons. You can have your own. But let’s look at the first two:

  • you could change cereer to earn more money
  • you could create anything you need or like to, become a creator

The first one is obvious: IT companies need more and more developers, as the IT market still grows, even faster than before. They are waiting for you.

The second one could even be more interesting.

Let’s look at Mark Zuckerberg. He had the skills to create the first version of Facebook. Without them he wouldn’t be where he is today. You could create your own "baby" either for fun or for money. Or for both. 

Currently a good friend of mine has a good idea: a mobile application that would make one's life easier. However he is not a programmer, and he has neither a knowledge of programming nor creating complex applications. Fortunately I can help him out as I have the appropriate skills. But do you have a good friend that would do the same for you without cheating or stealing your idea?

Rough start

If I asked you where to begin, what would you answer?

You could say for example: I will learn Java.

Is it a good idea? Yes, it is a great idea. Java is very popular and it is a great programming language. That’s why java courses are so popular today. You can find a lot of them. But .... unfortunately that won’t be enough.

Look at some job offers for java junior programmers. Junior is usually the first step towards programming career, thus the requirements are the lowest.

You will find that Java is only a foundation, but you need more to build fully functional web pages and systems.

So you will have to learn more than just Java. You cacould buy a lot of books and learn from them. But you will eventually get frustrated. Sooner or later. I know this because I've been frustrated many times in the past. 

Who am I?

My name is Hubert Lyczek. I’m a full-stack web developer. If you are really curious I have over 11 years of experience. Moreover 11 years of experience doing dfferent things and learning. Not doing the same, one thing for many years, standing in the same place. During this years I’ve written almost 2000 pages of notes and tutorials for myself.

Now it's time to share the knowledge.

The solution

I have a proposition for you.

I will create a video course for you. It will be available on Udemy. During this course you will learn how to build a single, but technically advanced web application from scratch, using different technology.

You will learn how to setup and deploy your application to "production" environment. Step by step.

You could ask: only one application? Yes. Only one. You could find promises that you can create 2, 5, 10 and even more, but this is like losing 60 pounds in one week. Sounds better that losing 5 pounds a week, but is it possible? It’s up to you to decide.

The more important thing is what you will create and what you will learn. You will create a full stack application. It will be accesible from any web browser. It will store and retrieve data from a database. So:

  • you will create Graphic User Interface using (HTML, CSS 3, Javacript + JQuery)
  • you will create Backend using (Java, Spring, JAX-RS, JPA 2 and PostgresQL database).
  • you will learn how to combine GUI and Backend using HTTP
  • you will learn how to use Git which is a very popular distributed version control system.
  • you will learn how to build your application using maven, deploy it using Tomcat and Apache, and how to configure your production environment.

At the end of the course you will have a working web page. You will be able to show it to your friends, anytime, anywhere.

Important notes

Some people think that creating web pages is easy. Especially those who created blogs or other pages using tools like WordPress. WordPress is a great tool, but you can only use it for limited purposes.

You cannot create anything you wish.

Some time ago I knew a person like that. He was a tennis coach. He wanted to create a sophisticated system to use during a tennis tournament and he wasn't able to do so. I created it for him. And that is the difference between a CMS* user and a software developer.

During this course you will gain developer skills. You will not be using any CMS. You will create every piece of application by yourself.

What is really priceless is the explanation on how to combine different technologies to achieve your goals.

Becouse I found  that the most time consuming thing is to understand the relations beetwen different technologies, how to combine them, how to use them together in order to create a fully functional web portal.

You must understand that this course will explain everything you need to know in order to create your application and will  give you a tremendous amount of knowledge to continue creating web pages in the future as this will not be the end of your journey. 

Timeline

To create this course I need two months. 

I will start as soon as this campaign goal is reached.

Risks and challenges

The risk is very limited. This course will be created. But as the quality will be the most important factor, it is possible that it could take a bit more than 2 months to create this course.

Other Ways You Can Help


Not interested? Maybe you know someone who might want to support this project. If so, tell them about it.


* full-stack web developer - this is a person who can write any application component. Not only frontend or backend. So he/she can create the whole application by himself/herself with no help. 

* CMS - Content Management System - briefly speaking systems like WordPress (you can create a web page without technical knowledge, but only from modules created by technical staff )

story:
Red Chaski, La Quiaca

Faced with the current limitations to bring connectivity to La Quiaca City, we development a project to build a social network through a community intranet which will grow along with the gradual arrival of the internet.

The social network Chaski will allow the solidary dissemination of educational, technological, and cultural contents as well as the communication among the inhabitants in the city. The users will have the possibility to create and share their own contents, as well as socialize any material they may have obtained from the internet during any temporary connection. Our aim is to create a local means of communication with a strong educational, technological and cultural imprint using the tools available.

The network is being developed with teams specialized in free software.

The city of La Quiaca is located on the northern border of Argentina in the province of Jujuy.  The city borders Bolivia to the north and has a population of 16 thousand people.

Due to issues related to infrastructure, topographic constraints and lack of investment from the large telecommunication companies the city has an extremely limited access to internet.

The supply of internet connection is currently 8mb for all the inhabitants; which means that only a very small part of the population can actually hire a low quality service at a very high price.

The main node of our infrastructure will be placed in the State School of Social Management CEIJA IDEAR- Educational, Cultural, and Sports Association "Abogado Manuel Belgrano". It is in this premise that there will be a server with all the contents shared by the users as well as the main aerial from which the intranet will be generated using radio-frequency equipment located in different spots in the city.

 

Why do we call it Red Chaski?

The word "chaski" in Quechua (Original pre-columbian Lenguage of La Quiaca) refers to the concept of mail. During the Tahuantinsuyo (Inca empire), Chaskis were the people in charge of delivering messages and parcels for and from the Inca. Since their childhood, chaskis were trained in physical skills and taught about cultural issues and science. These young men had the task to travel on foot along the impressive roads of the Empire. Their long races included various stops on their way, where other young men would take over the task in order to speed up the communication and delivery process. Apart from delivering messages and parcels, chaskis received information and ancestral concepts, passed on from generation to generation, which could be preserved from the Spaniard conquest. 

 

Who are we?

Atalaya Sur is a project whose mission is to enable the most neglected sectors of our country to achieve technological appropriation. In this way, Atalaya Sur stands as a fundamental tool for social inclusion, access, and production of knowledge.

Nowadays, information and communication technologies (ICT) are developing rapidly, widening the digital divide which somehow deepens the pre-existing structural inequities in our society. That is why Atalaya Sur mainly focuses our efforts carrying out three different lines of work: 1) Claiming the right to connectivity for the people who are currently excluded or have a very limited access to  internet connection 2) Democratizing the production of content and voices on the Internet 3) Displaying technological orientations in robotics and programming workshops improving both labor and education conditions. 


What have we done so far?

Our experience in Villa 20

In order to be able to provide free and solidary connectivity to every person in Villa 20, we worked together to build a Community WI-FI network in a participative and collaborative environment.

At different points in the process, many actors participated in the project: the UTN ( National Technological University); the Ministry of Science, Technology and Productive Innovation; civil organizations; teachers and students from different universities; and lots of young people and neighbours from Villa 20  who showed a  very strong and committed participation.

 

  1. We carried out a pre-feasibility study to build a concrete strategy.
  2. We achieved the connection of the community center thanks to a technical solution which combines optical fiber and radio-frequency.
  3. We carried out a community Wi-Fi experimental project which benefited a first group of 10 families.
  4. Basing on our previous experience, we developed a public and free WI-FI network which supplied connectivity in the area to all the inhabitants of the area.
  5. We implemented a virtual platform to encourage the participation from the locals creating a public space of exchange and flow of information, opinions and cultural contents.

The General Assembly of the United Nations (UN) has declared Internet access as a highly protected human right. The UN requires all the countries members of the organization to provide an accessible and affordable internet service for all inhabitants. In addition, the UN regards internet accessibility for all the inhabitants as a priority. According to UN, Internet "not only allows individuals to exercise their right to freedom of opinion and speech, but also is part of their human rights promoting the access of the society as a whole."

 

Our work during 2015

 
 

Learn more about Atalaya Sur

The experience in Villa 20
 
3D printer made by teenagers in Villa 20
 

Prezi of Villa 20 experience

 

 

Red Chaski, La Quiaca

Frente a las limitaciones en el acceso a la conectividad existentes en la Ciudad de La Quiaca, elaboramos una propuesta para el armado de una red social mediante una intranet comunitaria, que se irá ampliando con la llegada progresiva de internet.

La Red Social Chaski permitirá la difusión solidaria de contenidos educativos, tecnológicos, culturales y la comunicación de los habitantes de la Ciudad. Los usuarios podrán generar y compartir contenidos propios, y a la vez socializar materiales a los que hayan podido acceder desde internet durante conexiones circunstanciales. El objetivo es generar mediante las herramientas disponibles un medio de comunicación local con una fuerte impronta educativa, tecnológica y cultural

La ciudad de La Quiaca, provincia de Jujuy, está ubicada en el extremo norte de la Argentina. Se encuentra sobre la frontera con Bolivia y cuenta con una población de 16 mil habitantes.

Por razones vinculadas a la infraestructura, dificultades topográficas y la falta de inversión de las grandes empresas de telecomunicaciones, la ciudad cuenta con un acceso extremadamente limitado a internet. La provisión para la totalidad de los habitantes es de 8 megas, lo que significa que solo un sector muy reducido de la población puede contratar un servicio de muy baja calidad y a muy alto costo.

La Red se está desarrollando junto con equipos especializados en software libre.

El nodo principal de nuestra infraestructura estará en la escuela pública de gestión social, CEIJA IDEAR de la Asociación Educativa, Cultural y Deportiva Abogado Manuel Belgrano. Allí se alojará un servidor con todos los contenidos que los usuarios compartan, así como la antena principal desde la que se generará la intranet mediante equipos de radiofrecuencia ubicados en diversos puntos de la ciudad.

 

¿Por qué Red Chaski?

La palabra “chaski” en quechua refiere al concepto de correo. Durante el Tahuantinsuyo, los chaskis eran la persona encargada de entregar mensajes y encomiendas al servicio del Inca. Entrenados desde pequeños en destreza física y educados en todos los saberes científicos y culturales, estos jóvenes recorrían los imponentes caminos del Imperio a pie. Sus largas carreras contaban con postas, donde eran relevados por otro joven para acelerar el proceso de comunicación. Además de transmitir mensajes y entregar paquetes, los chaskis eran receptores de información y conocimientos ancestrales, legados de generación en generación y preservados frente a la conquista española.

 

¿Quiénes somos?

Atalaya Sur es un proyecto que tiene por misión la apropiación de la tecnología por parte de los sectores históricamente más postergados de nuestro país. Así Atalaya Sur se propone como una herramienta fundamental para la inclusión social, el acceso y la producción de conocimiento.

En la actualidad, las tecnologías de la comunicación y la información (TICs) avanzan a un ritmo vertiginoso, ensanchando la brecha digital que refuerza desigualdades estructurales ya existentes en nuestra sociedad. Por eso Atalaya Sur concentra sus esfuerzos en tres líneas de trabajo: luchar por el derecho a conectividad de las poblaciones que actualmente no acceden a internet o lo hacen en forma restringida, democratizar la producción de contenidos y discursos en la WEB y desplegar vocaciones tecnológicas a través de talleres de robótica y programación, mejorando así las condiciones de educación y empleo.

 

Antecedentes:

La experiencia de Villa 20

La primera experiencia de Atalaya Sur se llevó a cabo en la Villa 20, en el barrio de Lugano. Se trata de uno de los asentamientos más grandes de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, con 30 manzanas en las cuales habitan más de 30.000 personas. La población de la Villa 20 está compuesta por familias en situación de gran vulnerabilidad económica y social.

Con el objetivo de facilitar la conectividad de los hogares de forma gratuita y solidaria trabajamos en el armado de una Red WIFI comunitaria mediante un proceso participativo y colaborativo.

En diversas etapas se fueron sumando distintos actores, como la Universidad Tecnológica Nacional (UTN), el Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación Productiva, organizaciones de la sociedad civil, docentes y estudiantes de distintas universidades y un fuerte protagonismo de jóvenes y vecinos del barrio.

  1. Realizamos un estudio de prefactibilidad para el diseño de la estrategia.
  2. Gracias a una solución técnica que combina fibra óptica y radiofrecuencia logramos la conexión del centro comunitario.
  3. Llevamos a cabo un proyecto piloto de Red de WIFI comunitaria que alcanzó a un primer conjunto de 10 familias.
  4. Sobre la base de esa experiencia, desarrollamos una Red de WIFI pública y gratuita permitiendo la conectividad de toda la villa.
  5. Implementamos una plataforma virtual para promover la participación de los vecinos y vecinas, generando un espacio público de circulación de información, opiniones y contenidos culturales.

La Asamblea General de la Organización de las Naciones Unidas (ONU) ha declarado el acceso a Internet como derecho humano altamente protegido. La ONU exige a los países miembros facilitar un servicio accesible y asequible para todos y estima como una prioridad asegurar a la ciudadanía el acceso a Internet. Para la ONU, Internet “no sólo permite a los individuos ejercer su derecho de opinión y expresión, sino que también forma parte de sus derechos humanos y promueve el acceso de la sociedad en su conjunto”

Trabajo realizado durante 2015

 

Conoce mas sobre Atalaya Sur

La experiencia de WiFi comunitario en Villa 20
 
Impresora 3D realizada en Villa 20 por jóvenes del barrio 
 

Prezi de la experiencia en Villa 20

The UN requires all the countries members of the organization to provide an accessible and affordable internet service for all inhabitants. In addition, the UN regards internet accessibility for all the inhabitants as a priority. According to UN, Internet "not only allows individuals to exercise their right to freedom of opinion and speech, but also is part of their human rights promoting the access of the society as a whole."

 
Our work during 2015

 
 
Learn more about Atalaya Sur

The experience in Villa 20
 


3D printer made by teenagers in Villa 20
 
Prezi of Villa 20 experience
 


 

Red Chaski, La Quiaca
Frente a las limitaciones en el acceso a la conectividad existentes en la Ciudad de La Quiaca, elaboramos una propuesta para el armado de una red social mediante una intranet comunitaria, que se irá ampliando con la llegada progresiva de internet.
La Red Social Chaski permitirá la difusión solidaria de contenidos educativos, tecnológicos, culturales y la comunicación de los habitantes de la Ciudad. Los usuarios podrán generar y compartir contenidos propios, y a la vez socializar materiales a los que hayan podido acceder desde internet durante conexiones circunstanciales. El objetivo es generar mediante las herramientas disponibles un medio de comunicación local con una fuerte impronta educativa, tecnológica y cultural
La ciudad de La Quiaca, provincia de Jujuy, está ubicada en el extremo norte de la Argentina. Se encuentra sobre la frontera con Bolivia y cuenta con una población de 16 mil habitantes.
Por razones vinculadas a la infraestructura, dificultades topográficas y la falta de inversión de las grandes empresas de telecomunicaciones, la ciudad cuenta con un acceso extremadamente limitado a internet. La provisión para la totalidad de los habitantes es de 8 megas, lo que significa que solo un sector muy reducido de la población puede contratar un servicio de muy baja calidad y a muy alto costo.
La Red se está desarrollando junto con equipos especializados en software libre.
El nodo principal de nuestra infraestructura estará en la escuela pública de gestión social, CEIJA IDEAR de la Asociación Educativa, Cultural y Deportiva Abogado Manuel Belgrano. Allí se alojará un servidor con todos los contenidos que los usuarios compartan, así como la antena principal desde la que se generará la intranet mediante equipos de radiofrecuencia ubicados en diversos puntos de la ciudad.
 
¿Por qué Red Chaski?

La palabra “chaski” en quechua refiere al concepto de correo. Durante el Tahuantinsuyo, los chaskis eran la persona encargada de entregar mensajes y encomiendas al servicio del Inca. Entrenados desde pequeños en destreza física y educados en todos los saberes científicos y culturales, estos jóvenes recorrían los imponentes caminos del Imperio a pie. Sus largas carreras contaban con postas, donde eran relevados por otro joven para acelerar el proceso de comunicación. Además de transmitir mensajes y entregar paquetes, los chaskis eran receptores de información y conocimientos ancestrales, legados de generación en generación y preservados frente a la conquista española.
 
¿Quiénes somos?


Atalaya Sur es un proyecto que tiene por misión la apropiación de la tecnología por parte de los sectores históricamente más postergados de nuestro país. Así Atalaya Sur se propone como una herramienta fundamental para la inclusión social, el acceso y la producción de conocimiento.
En la actualidad, las tecnologías de la comunicación y la información (TICs) avanzan a un ritmo vertiginoso, ensanchando la brecha digital que refuerza desigualdades estructurales ya existentes en nuestra sociedad. Por eso Atalaya Sur concentra sus esfuerzos en tres líneas de trabajo: luchar por el derecho a conectividad de las poblaciones que actualmente no acceden a internet o lo hacen en forma restringida, democratizar la producción de contenidos y discursos en la WEB y desplegar vocaciones tecnológicas a través de talleres de robótica y programación, mejorando así las condiciones de educación y empleo.
 
Antecedentes:

La experiencia de Villa 20
La primera experiencia de Atalaya Sur se llevó a cabo en la Villa 20, en el barrio de Lugano. Se trata de uno de los asentamientos más grandes de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, con 30 manzanas en las cuales habitan más de 30.000 personas. La población de la Villa 20 está compuesta por familias en situación de gran vulnerabilidad económica y social.
Con el objetivo de facilitar la conectividad de los hogares de forma gratuita y solidaria trabajamos en el armado de una Red WIFI comunitaria mediante un proceso participativo y colaborativo.
En diversas etapas se fueron sumando distintos actores, como la Universidad Tecnológica Nacional (UTN), el Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación Productiva, organizaciones de la sociedad civil, docentes y estudiantes de distintas universidades y un fuerte protagonismo de jóvenes y vecinos del barrio.

Realizamos un estudio de prefactibilidad para el diseño de la estrategia.
Gracias a una solución técnica que combina fibra óptica y radiofrecuencia logramos la conexión del centro comunitario.
Llevamos a cabo un proyecto piloto de Red de WIFI comunitaria que alcanzó a un primer conjunto de 10 familias.
Sobre la base de esa experiencia, desarrollamos una Red de WIFI pública y gratuita permitiendo la conectividad de toda la villa.
Implementamos una plataforma virtual para promover la participación de los vecinos y vecinas, generando un espacio público de circulación de información, opiniones y contenidos culturales.


La Asamblea General de la Organización de las Naciones Unidas (ONU) ha declarado el acceso a Internet como derecho humano altamente protegido. La ONU exige a los países miembros facilitar un servicio accesible y asequible para todos y estima como una prioridad asegurar a la ciudadanía el acceso a Internet. Para la ONU, Internet “no sólo permite a los individuos ejercer su derecho de opinión y expresión, sino que también forma parte de sus derechos humanos y promueve el acceso de la sociedad en su conjunto”

Trabajo realizado durante 2015

 Conoce mas sobre Atalaya SurLa experiencia de WiFi comunitario en Villa 20 

Impresora 3D realizada en Villa 20 por jóvenes del barrio 
 
Prezi de la experiencia en Villa 20

story:
A balloon that won't float away or pop?

We've got one. It's THIS BALLOON,

a tactile learning children's book (ages 2-5) without electronics and with a simple premise: believe...and magic happens.  

The book begins with a deflated balloon. The reader (children and adults) are asked to inflate the balloon by blowing into it.  (the book is 8.75 x 8.75, so the images below show the book opened). 

So, I know people like to look through a book before they buy it...and here's a link for you to do so! 

So...blow on the balloon...and then turn the page...  

After turning the page, the child sees this: 

What happens if the balloon is pushed too far? Will it float off the page? After turning the page, both pages are filled with this: 

Whoops! Don't worry; THIS balloon won't float away.

What happens if you rub the balloon and say the word "blue"? 

In This Balloon, simple, wonderful things happen that bring a calming, delightful sense of play, ideal for bedtime reading. Readers get to do LOTS of things with the balloons on the page:

  • Blow on balloons
  • Touch balloons
  • Identify and name colors
  • Count
  • Shake the book (gently) 
  • Rub the pages
  • Laugh to make things happen
  • Tilt the book to shift balloons to the other side

This Balloon takes the concept of interactive book and gives it a lift. Children will also be introduced to Oscar, a friendly fellow with a smart-looking green vest and purple tie, who would not only like to play with the balloons, but also has a fun, flying surprise for readers. 

With the child's help, Oscar gets a balloon and goes on a hot-air balloon ride. Oscar even falls asleep, dangling on a crescent moon....and then it's bedtime. But no need to worry. This Balloon will still be there in the morning, tomorrow afternoon, or at bedtime again!  

I created This Balloon several years ago, working with a drawing program. My computer crashed and the original work was LOST!  But these renders were recently salvaged and I've been waiting for the right time to release this project into the world. 

It's my hope that This Balloon will make bedtime reading a calm, engaging time of wonder and imagination, inspiring sweet sleep and dreams for little ones everywhere.   

I'm the author of Tinx Just Stinks & Charlie Doesn't, which was funded on another crowdfunding platform in 45 minutes last year. I've worked with my printer before, and I'm committed to my backers having a great experience and product. This Balloon is planned to be 8.75 x 8.75.

Risks & Challenges

I've worked with my printer before but I've never had a book printed during a pandemic! However, they assure me that things are moving along with other clients. 
I have one Kickstarter project for enamel pins that has had numerous production issues, but I am confident with my printer (they did a lovely job on my first book). I've delivered books before, so I'm excited to see this one created and on its way to little ones.

Ways You Can Help

I'm new to Indiegogo, so your pledge would be amazing! If you like This Balloon, please share it with someone you think would love to read it to their little one!
