story:
Overview

Imagine a world without the motor car, imagine a world without the aeroplane , imagine a world without an internet search engine and also imagine a world without social media. Innovation is a major factor affecting human survival and advancement and my goal for creating this book was to create awareness about this subject and make the reader understand the concept of innovation in detail.

About me

My Name is Tolulope Taiwo  I am an Entrepreneur, Writer and Architect I am very passionate about topics relating to creativity and innovation and I live in Lagos Nigeria with my family

About the book

Innovation is the driving force behind the progress of the human race. A lot of Ideas conceived by no more than ordinary people have been highly instrumental in shaping the reality and society which we live in today. Innovative ideas are also the foundation upon which the worlds most successful economies are built. The United States of America for example is responsible for being the birth ground of the worlds most ground breaking inventions like the Lightbulb , The Airplane, Google and facebook to name a few. In order to build Africa to its full potential it is only wise for all citizens to adopt an innovative mindset so we can understand that we all have the capability of utilizing our creative ability to solve problems by taking advantage of our ideas. In order to develop an innovative mindset there is no better place to start than to acquire valuable knowledge about various ideas that have spawned ground-breaking inventions across multiple industries. This book serves as an informative and definitive reference guide that provides valuable information about the relevance and functionality , history and development and impact on society of 100 innovative ideas that have helped to define the world which we live in today. in order to define the future one must understand the past and in the world of today there are hardly any new ideas but a combination of pre-existing ones.The book was made for people looking to understand the world of innovation in order to unleash their innovative ability.

About my mission

My goal is that every student in high school (secondary school as we call it here) should own a copy of this book and its quite difficult to get publishing deals here so I have to handle publishing by myself if I want to see my dream come to life and this is very capital intensive but the good news is that if we work together we can make my dream a reality. If you pledge some money towards this cause you bring me one step closer to achieving my goal of forging more innovative minds and leaders of enterprise in my country and continent. the proceeds from this book will be reinvested in building an online platform where creativity, entrepreneurship and leadership can be taught to highschool students across Africa by instructors and mentors sourced from first world countries 

About the budget

The funds are going to be utilized in covering all publishing expenses like paying for my international ISBN registration so the book can be accessible beyond my country and also in funding the printing costs, it costs about $3.50 to produce a unit of the book here and my printer recommends that I print a minimum of 5000 units of the book to guarantee cost effectiveness. I will also incur multiple costs in the promotion of the book to create awareness about the initiative among secondary schools and finally the cost of duties and taxes in setting up a publishing company of my own to facilitate the effective distribution of the book into the market. Upon various calculations and adjustments I was able to arrive at the $25000 figure as the minimum amount i need to get the plan off the ground.

 You can also help without paying a cent!

If you don’t have a nickel but like the idea, use the share button located on the top of the page, it's easy and it helps me a lot!

You can spread the word about my campaign to your friends and family.

You can share my campaign on social media and your blog.

If you know celebrities who would like to help me promote the book with a quote, that’d be highly appreciated

story:
The OVCA model saves parents 20-30% or more!

 

After nearly three years of research and development, we have concluded that there is absolutely no economic reason for the high costs and mediocre quality.  America's parents, children and teachers deserve much better.

 

YES, the child care industry is extremely profitable because these type of investors will settle for nothing less. 

 

     

     

    OVCA has seized upon the opportunity to -

    • reduce costs for parents by up to 30% because working parents need a break
    • increase teacher pay and benefits by up to 20% to reward and give them the dignity they deserve
    • reduce class sizes up to 20% to give children the personal attention they need to have a positive impact on their lives

    How Do We Do It?

    Nearly everyone at one point in their life has either heard or used the phrase “it takes a village to raise a child”.  Using this as a foundation, we adapted the success of charter schools with the familiarity of membership organizations.  We adopted nationally recognized accreditation  standards and best practices to provide high quality education for the children.   To this we added back-office operational and purchasing efficiencies, and… a couple of other things that we cannot mention publicly (trade secrets).

    The end result is an OVCA model that can reduce costs, can increase pay, can provide high quality education for children – and can also maintain a very respectable profit margin.  An OVCA Educational Village is a special place where parents, teachers, staff, management, business and community members form a unique working relationship with one another as Village Members - this is truly a community effort because it takes a village.  The management and shareholders of OVCA are also village members and a small part of our contribution is to simply accept less profits than is typical in the industry.  We are guided by our core belief to place People and Principles before Profits. 

     

    What We Have

    We have successfully opened the first of what we hope to become a nationwide system of Our Village Children's Academy centers.  We call our center's Educational Villages to recognize that it does in fact take a village to raise a child.  

    • We have happy and grateful parents, children and teachers that appreciate the impact that OVCA is having in their lives.
       
    • We have a Rapid Replication business model that is ready to deploy throughout the country to provide much needed help to parents, children and teachers.  Our model demonstrates that private business can potentially solve the country's child care and educational crisis - something governments have been unable to do.
       

    What We Need

    We need your help with Financial Support and Word-of-Mouth support.

    Funding

    Our founding team has already committed over $350,000 of our own money to launch the first OVCA facility - we've put our money where our mouth is.  We want you to join us as a Village Elder to help us establish OVCA Educational Villages throughout the country.  We are seeking to raise $75,000 in the next 30 days as a demonstration of broad-based national community support.   Funding will be used approximately as follows:

    • 15% for educational consultants to improve our early childhood education curriculum and the educational experience for children
    • 15% to increase public relations, marketing and community awareness
    • 25% to conduct  due diligence research nationwide to identify locations for the first 6 OVCA Educational Villages for 2019
    • 35% to improve the flagship first facility as a national showcase facility
    • 10% for Indiegogo and credit card fees and perks

    Word-of-Mouth

    We need your help to get the word out to parents and teachers throughout the country that the cavalry has arrived and OVCA is committed to a major reform of child care and early education.  A reform committed to reducing the cost for parents and improving the pay, benefits and training for teachers.  Please share out Indiegogo Link with your social networks, Parents, grandparents, teachers and child care providers and employers we invite you to join us in making a difference. 

    What You Get

    Sure, we have some great perks, but these are just a physical token of our appreciation.  But, here is the best part

    How can I get more involved?  Just email us at Info@OVCAinc.com

    How can I get an OVCA Educational Village near me?  OVCA is not a franchise, however, we do partner with local individuals and community members to establish OVCA Educational Villages - this is part of the Rapid Replication program.  Our goal is to reduce parent costs, improve quality education for children and raise teacher pay and training throughout the country.  To do this we need people in local communities to help us.  If you or someone you know wants to help us establish an OVCA Educational Village in your community email us at pdoucette@OVCAinc.com

     

    The Risks

    We know that we have very ambitious goals.  A child care early education disruption like this had never been attempted.  The rapid replication and scaling of a bricks-n-mortar business has also never been attempted to our knowledge.   But since no one else is trying to make a difference we are going to do our best.  Even if we are not able to open hundreds of OVCA centers, our view of the worst case scenario is:

    • Each center opened is properly capitalized and will make a positive difference in the lives of the people it serves and the local community
       
    • We will increase public awareness of the problems facing child care and early childhood education and have a platform for advocating for real reform
       

    The Founders

    Our Founders are all successful mid-career professionals from the fields of early childhood education, law, IT, sales, financial services, human resources, real estate, ministry and marketing.   We are all very passionate about OVCA and expanding this unique business model nationally.   

    Anyone can scale an e-commerce business but only OVCA can scale a bricks-n-mortar business.  Our team has developed a Rapid Replication strategy that can provide the OVCA advantage to children, parents and teachers throughout the country

story:
We need YOU - OUR DEAREST BACKERS to bring our product to life!!!

We – EDUKA team – have spent many days and sleepless nights creating this project - Cheerio and it’s finally time to show it off to the world. We are doing anything to make sure that the quality is as high as possible.

If you believe that Cheerio can change the way you learn English and improve your English skills, help us to reach our goal!!!

Apple Store and Google Play are already offering so many English learning apps in different types for wide range of users. But most of them are a little too generic, and do not focus on specific skills that users really need that can sometimes feel irrelevant, unexciting and unattractive to continue using. Cheerio is thus created as an answer to all these problems.

By using the role-playing learning method, Cheerio presents to users with a stimulating and engaging way to learn English, while holds their attention and keep them coming back. Cheerio focuses on improving users’ English communicative skills in a workplace environment.

Cheerio was created for people who are looking to learn English, but in a more contextual sense than straight up grammar, or vocabulary. The app also works for people who just want to sit back, enjoy some hilarious storytelling in comic form, which sprinkles in with simple exercises that also train their English skills. Specifically, Cheerio will work best for users who have been or are going to work in an office environment.

 

The app has been testified with dozens of staff within our country and they have expressed their love and high expectation for the final version of Cheerio.

Office Adventure – Endless Experiences

 

And it’s not the end of your adventure, your career path is always promising. With Cheerio, you will learn English from elementary level to intermediate then advanced. During this office adventure, you will master reading, vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, listening and communication skills.

 

You will come up with a wide range of question types throughout the story such as multiple choices, fill in the blank, word arrangement etc. Every time you give correct answer, you will get surprising rewards. Additionally, there will be a leader board for you to compare your level of success with your friends.

 

 

EDUKA has been provided various educational applications utilizing the Communicative Language Teaching method - CLT.

We released EXPRESSA app - an “Expressionary” (a dictionary-style app for expressions) in English designed to aid communication in everyday situation with nearly 7.000 expressions, which accompanies with the E-Book WAYS OF EXPRESSION - EXPRESSA is the digital version of the book Ways of expression in English.

 

Your support will help us to further improve graphic, audio, content quality and we can write more episodes for the characters’ further career paths. When complete, Cheerio will be super-exciting and entertaining for users, all while building learners’ skills and confidence.

As with every product launch, there is always a small chance for delay and other issues along the way. But, we will put 100% of our efforts into delivering you a high-quality product and deliver it on time. We keep communication channels open at all time. During the campaign and after the campaign, we’ll keep you up-to-date about everything happening with Cheerio and EDUKA via newsletters.

We are doing anything to make sure that the quality is as high as possible.If you believe that Cheerio can change the way you learn English and improve your English skills, help us to reach our goal!!!Apple Store and Google Play are already offering so many English learning apps in different types for wide range of users. But most of them are a little too generic, and do not focus on specific skills that users really need that can sometimes feel irrelevant, unexciting and unattractive to continue using. Cheerio is thus created as an answer to all these problems.By using the role-playing learning method, Cheerio presents to users with a stimulating and engaging way to learn English, while holds their attention and keep them coming back. story:
Despite this era of programming and electronics, current technology is sometimes hard to understand for non-techie kids and educators. This campaign is intended to lower the entry-barriers to technology for every parent or educator who is unfamiliar with programming in real life.

Firstmakers is an electronic board that comes with easy programming software which simplifies prototyping, so that you or even your children can build automated projects.

Within the electronic board you will find seven different sensors (temperature, light, sound, humidity, a button and a potentiometer) and four different actuators (a buzzer and four LED's of different colors). 

Besides we have other packs to complete the FirstMakers electronic board and develop more complex project prototipes.

(Spanish Video)

With Firstmakers you start from scratch: no soldering required, no previous programming knowledge, and yet enormous potential to build automated projects in real life.

With this technology, parents and educators alike are able to provide their children with a friendly tool to learn programming and have fun at the same time, as you can either program with building blocks or use the Arduino programming software. 

The kit comes with instructions on how to build different projects on our website.

These are pictures from our early prototypes and final products. 

Firstmakers is already a stable product. We have working prototypes and +150 units delivered to both schools and parents. Now we need your help to fund more kits and go for mass production of an upgraded version of the current kit, which comes with battery case and bluetooth technology.

You will be funding a techie training program for kids and teachers from disadvantaged schools. Plus, we will build 100 new kits and finish our new prototype, that comes with battery case and bluetooth technology, which allows you to get rid of the cables and automate your creations even more. 

Indeed, you will be preparing children for a technological and programming world where they can actually fit in. Plus, you will receive one or more of these:

 

According to the U. S. Department of Commerce, STEM occupations are growing at 17%, while others are growing at 9.8%. And yet, the percentage of students pursuing STEM degrees is declining. Something similar is happening in Europe, as reported by the European Commission. In Latin America, there is an increasing technology gap that separates us from more developed countries. Sometimes programming is not even within the educational curriculum. 

Here is why children should learn how to code and build projects collaboratively: 

We need to better foster the love for programming and electronics in our kids, and that starts from home and from the schools. What a better way to learn these skills than by playing with low-entry barrier kits?

             

We have lowered our risks associated with hardware production, as we have proven confidence with our supplier companies and know exactly how much time they need to produce our kits. However, there is always a probability of an unforeseen event while producing hardware, specially in a new version. 

As for software, even though we have a functional product sold in more than 15 schools in Chile and many other happy kids an parents, we are still working on new tests with complex coding to challenge our system. Our team is working hard to meet the goal of a 100% tested software with which to tinker by December 2016. 

Like us on Indiegogo, Facebook and Instagram. It's easy!

story:
Be Your Own Boss

Being your own boss is an aspiration for many of us. The prospect of potentially higher financial rewards, independence and building a legacy is a highly attractive prospect for millions of would-be entrepreneurs. Yet fears of failure and the risk of an irregular income mean many people keep their aspirations as a pipe dream.


Crowdrun A Real Business

With the advent of crowdfunding and crowdsourcing, it is possible to bring effective online collaborative business learning en masse via the internet. 

Imagine people from United States, Canada, Europe, Japan, Australia and rest of the world collaborate together via a business social networking portal to run a physical cafe in Singapore / United States*. By crowdrunning a cafe for 12 months, aspiring entrepreneurs can learn the inner workings of a business startup and ultimately start their own business!

What is crowdrun a business? Similar to crowdfunding, we encourage a big group of like-minded individuals from all over the world to contribute or work towards a single goal. The business networking portal allow you to access real sales data, make business decisions that affect real people, create real products and services, networking for business opportunities, etc. To make entrepreneurial learning fun and efficient, we have integrated a reality-based lemonade-stand-style mini game, business blogs, forums, questions and answers, video streaming, voting, mini reality competition*, etc.


Open up new frontiers with your contributions

Your contribution to the crowdrun project will revolutionize how aspiring entrepreneurs acquire their business skills and knowledge. Be the first to embark this amazing entrepreneurial adventure collaboratively with hundreds of like-minded individuals. 

The very first crowdrun project is to crowdrun a physical cafe. Funds will be used to setup and run a cafe including costs such as shop rental, manpower, raw materials, utilities, etc. Be recognized as the pioneer of this brand new initiative! 


The Cafe

From brewing coffee to managing the finances, you will have access to all the business information as we partake this entrepreneurial journey together. We will be examining the business feasibility of various food trends such as nitrogen-infused coffee, fried ice-cream rolls and more. 

The first crowdrun cafe will be located in Singapore. Once we reached our initial goal, we will reveal our stretch goal to crowdrun another cafe in United States or Europe as well. You will be simultaneously running two cafes in two different countries with twice the fun and double the learning experience! Stay tuned and help us hit our initial goal. 

Ultimately, you will have all the business resources you need to run your very own cafe profitably and be your boss!


Collaborative Business Learning Online with gamifications

We want to make entrepreneurial learning as real and fun as possible. Different from normal business course, there is no course lecturer, instead every week, we will select a business topic and everyone can contribute their resources and make online discussions related to the topic. As part of running an active business, you can vote on key business decisions, participate in marketing campaigns and all the various business activities. As the project move forward, we will build up a wealth of business resources and toolkits that are very useful when you to start your very own cafe. 

Together, we will work on sourcing the best raw materials, building supply chain and work with other vendors. We will be creating videos on food recipes, review on commercial equipments, test menu items, etc. To create a vibrant and fun community, there will be mini games and competitions. In addition, we will routinely invite business experts to mentor the community and share their experiences. 

You will receive a certificate of participation when you acquire at least 75% Daily Login during 12 month period. 


The Business Networking Portal

The business networking portal is the hub where all our backers interact. It has all the key functions of a social network such as activity streams, blogs, forums, questions and answers, voting, wikis and many more.  All the business information including sales and financial data will be shared to you without reserve. You are encouraged to contribute business resources, marketing ideas, product reviews, your previous food experiences, etc. The portal allows you to interact easily with fellow aspiring entrepreneurs to source for potential business opportunities and partnership. All subscriptions give you 12 months access to the business portal. 


The Mini Game

We incorporated a mini business simulation game that we affectionately called Cafe Reality Tycoon. Cafe Reality Tycoon is a mash-up between apple II-era lemonade stand and fantasy football. The game is for you to forecast the number of sales of each product for the next day. Your forecast sales will compare with real actual sales from the cafe. The net income of a cafe item will be calculated from the total revenue and total expenses. To achieve the highest net income per cafe item, you have to forecast a value nearest to the actual sale value. You get a bonus of 100% of net income per cafe item if your forecast is between -5 and +5 of the actual sales. There will be 10 to 20 cafe items in the game. You can use trump cards to double your total net income for the day. 

Your scores will pit against other players. Be a Cafe Reality Tycoon!


Marketing

Did you have fun with our million dollar look contest? You can find out more at https://fb.me/crowdruncafe We will experiment more fun and bizarre marketing campaigns over the course of our crowdrun project. Feel free to contribute your marketing ideas or vote for the ideas to be implemented. We will be looking into how small businesses can collaborate with other brands for joint marketing as well.  


Social Enterprise Model

After the crowdrun project ends, all the relevant online business resources will be transferred to the not-for-profit cafebiz cooperative. The cafebiz cooperative aims to help members to pool their resources to get volume discounts from suppliers, increase marketing power, etc. Members without active cafe business can still benefit from the cooperative through networking opportunities, updated business resources, discounts on courses, etc. If we reached our initial crowdfunding goal, we will reveal our stretch goal to form a single for-profit social enterprise. 


Be Your Own Boss In 12 Months Time!

As a graduated pioneer, you will acquire enough business knowledge to start your very own cafe business! 
Here are some of the ways you can be your own boss:


1. Setup your own cafe, your own brand.

With 12 months of entrepreneurial learning and tons of business resources, you are more equipped to start your very own cafe. You can also join our cafebiz co-op to get extended assistance.


2. Franchise our cafe business

As a graduated pioneer, you have priority in buying franchises at discounted price.


3. Assisted Venture Partnership

Not enough startup capital? We will be assisting our pioneers to form Venture Partnership. Venture partnership consists a group of up to 50 graduated pioneers to start a cafe business together. Your business risks and startup costs are shared with 50 aspiring entrepreneurs. Prior to launching the venture partnership, there may be an initial round of crowdfunding. With crowdfunding, your initial startup capital will be further lowered.


4. Form your own Venture Partnership

There are a lot of interaction, networking and collaborative opportunities during the 12-month crowdrun project. We are sure that you can find like-minded individuals to be part your business venture.


Risks and Challenges

We have opt for fixed funding instead of flexible funding to ensure we have enough funds to setup and run a cafe for 12 months. Our business networking portal is ready to go and we have software expertise and experience to manage and maintain the portal once the crowdrun project is in full operation. All access accounts of our backers will be activated within 2 months after funding ends. You can also visit our active business portal showcase at http://crowdfundabiz.com where you can have a little fun predicting whether various active crowdfunding projects from kickstarter / indiegogo meets or exceed their funding goal.

For 12 months, you will have full access to all the various social business networking tools and business resources. Whether the crowdrun project succeeds or fails at the end of 12 months, you are still the big winner. Every successful or failed businesses will have mini successes and mini failures along the way. You will experience this exciting journey with all of us to celebrate our mini successes and scrutinized our mini failures.  It is cheaper to learn from our collaborative failure than to fail on your own. We allow you to fail cheaply. Learn from our mistakes, ride on our success, improve on our ideas, partner with other like-minded individuals, all of the above are what crowdrun collaborative offers you for 12 months. 

Risks taking cannot be taught, however if we can face these difficulties together, risks will be diversified and the valuable experience can be put to good use when you ultimately start their own business and be your own boss. 


_____________
*Available on stretch goals after initial goal is achieved.

ANNEX: Perks in Details

story:
What is the Y-TOP: Young Template of Peace?

The Y-TOP is an non-profit international young movement including over 17 countries: Italy, Israel, Denmark, Ireland, England, Sweden, The Netherlands, Wales, Turkey, Czech Republic, Belgium, China, Lebanon, Germany, USA, Canada, Ecuador. Established internationally since 1995, first in small scale and growing gradually, the Y-TOP meets several times a year for international gatherings, each time in a different country as volunteering friends from all nations and backgrounds, of all ages, genders and of different cultural beliefs. We gather in a safe and trustful ecology in which we create, learn and explore with great depth, seeking new pathways into the future.  This year we will be meeting in Portugal in summer 2017 to explore the topic of Natural Human Communication and to volunteer together. Thanks to your contribution the Y-TOP will be ready and will be able to support the Camp, the volunteers and the future development of our growing movement.

Since 2012 we have successfully been awarded with the EU fundings from Erasmus Plus programme for some of our ongoing projects (“Skills for Living” Denmark 2012; “Slinky” Wales  2015; “Now The Doing” Netherlands  2015; “Human Rainforest” Ireland 2016; and many important training gatherings in between).

What do we plan?

Our next step, without EU support, will be towards a territory we care a lot about... In fact, in such a crucial moment of history, where technology is evolving as fast as psychology, WE HAVE TO TALK ABOUT COMMUNICATION! ..and not just simple speaking abilities, nor social medias or marketing skills, but true Natural Human Communication. By uncovering this, we will be able to connect more and more with one another, to understand each other, maintaining values and aims, fostering qualities and meanings with awareness - and last but-not-least, to stay in touch with ourselves.

Why do we ask for support?

With Portugal being a new country for the Y-TOP we will have lots of challenges. Our summer camp, the volunteers and the youth will need plenty of resources, preparation and management. Arranging displacements, activities and adventures, and also exploring the right places to volunteer to help local communities - something we always do for the countries we visit.

To do this we need your help, and we actually like to think that we all need each other's help.

Whatever you kindly help us raise won't cover the cost of the camp in its entirety, but that's not a problem! Within the Y-TOP everyone are engaging in fundraising locally within our native countries, in order to promote our values for what money can do, as well as to increase our teamwork skills and to better understand how finance gives us greater access to options we believe in. In the likely case we will reach and exceed our goal we have so many important projects to further, just waiting for us (and now You!) to grow them and give them life. For instance; The Y-TOPtionary (an evolving dictionary for designing new words of the future), formal and informal educational programs (both stationary and nomads), a  Y-TOP music album (enabling us to share our message through original music) and many other movies, writings, arts, workshops, as well as social, artistic and innovation initiatives to build.

The Perks

First, please know that we are truly grateful and full of appreciation for your help. Second, we also prepared some great gifts to show you how important this is for us!

Y-TOP inner peace bracelet

This is a symbol that every y-top participant knows very well. It represents the Inner Peace. It's colors are yellow, green and blue and they are the central colors of the spectrum: yellow stands  for connection & value.  green for growth & creativity,  blue for standards & cleanliness.

Y-TOP quality postcards/Y-TOP brooches

We will send a postcard to you or to a friend of yours, with a quote or a sentence about what we learn in our camps. You can also choose to receive a Y-TOP brooch with our logo, or the symbol of our last camp the Human Rainforest, or a picture of a meaningfull Y-TOP moment.

Y-TOP T-shirts

A shirt with personal writings from the camp participants.

Human Rainforest T-shirts

A shirt with a symbol from our last summer camp "Human rain forest" in Ireland

Meet a "Y-TOPper"

LET'S TALK ABOUT COOMUNICATION! A person or more from the Y-TOP are to meet you in your country to explore some of our projects such as Natural Human Communication or the Human Rainforest, or other topics that may inspire you. Would you like to speak about the Future? DO you feel like taking action in the world? Would you like to have a Solar System Trail in your cpuntry, such as those in Ireland and in Israel? Well then, meet a Y-TOPper!

Above: the Y-TOP is ready to meet you. Below: the welcome sign of the Killarney Solar System Trail established thanks to the collaboration between the Y-TOP and Spacetime Instruments.

Y-TOP song recording

In addition to projects and gathering, lots of art, photography, dance, theatre and music get created within the Y-TOP environment. Long process of fine-tuning, improvising, composing, performing and developing have led to quite an archive of original Y-TOP songs and videos. One of them is just waiting for you.

A picture by Mimo Khair

Mimo Khair is a famous photografer featured in many exhibitions and television programs worldwide. She lives in China but she always travel to be in as many Y-TOP camps and gathering she can attend. For this campaign she has offered some of her most beautiful photo shoots as gifts for Your support! Choose one from the following and we will send an original and professional print straight to your address.

Mimo Khair's website: www.mimokhairphotography.com/

1. "Conversations in the third person~ Myanmar"

2. "In my head I keep going back~ Myanmar"

3. "New Horizons~ Myanmar"

4. "One floor closer to paradise~ Myanmar"

5. "Playground in the sky~ Karakol~ Xinjiang"

6. "Catching early rays~ Myanmar"

Open Mind Passion

Sort of a Y-TOP Ted Talk, an originally designed Passion Play on a very interesting and important topic is waiting for your engagement in our mission. Throughout the last 2 years many ideas evolved into projects, involving individual Y-TOPpers as well as versatile teams of merged nationalities. Choose your favourite Open Mind Passion. Intercultural relationships, personal development, video-making, technological integration and education, 3rd world volunteeerings, multiple intelligences, social ecologies, paintings, new languages, robotics, astronomy, cooking, creative writings, innovative gardening, time travel, bird-watching, self-defense, zero waste, renewable energies, and much more.. the list is an ongoing expansion. Stay tuned for more info.

 

If you wish to get involved...

Thanks for your cooperation and your interest. We're doing all that's in our power to create and inspire a better tomorrow for a safer and more sound World. And if you're here it means you're doing as much! The Y-TOP has many volunteers across the globe, currently in 17 different countries (and growing)… for any info, wish or will, please feel free to contact us via our WEBSITE: www.ytop.org
story_txt: What is the Y-TOP: Young Template of Peace?The Y-TOP is an non-profit international young movement including over 17 countries: Italy, Israel, Denmark, Ireland, England, Sweden, The Netherlands, Wales, Turkey, Czech Republic, Belgium, China, Lebanon, Germany, USA, Canada, Ecuador. Established internationally since 1995, first in small scale and growing gradually, the Y-TOP meets several times a year for international gatherings, each time in a different country as volunteering friends from all nations and backgrounds, of all ages, genders and of different cultural beliefs. We gather in a safe and trustful ecology in which we create, learn and explore with great depth, seeking new pathways into the future.  This year we will be meeting in Portugal in summer 2017 to explore the topic of Natural Human Communication and to volunteer together. Thanks to your contribution the Y-TOP will be ready and will be able to support the Camp, the volunteers and the future development of our growing movement.Since 2012 we have successfully been awarded with the EU fundings from Erasmus Plus programme for some of our ongoing projects (“Skills for Living” Denmark 2012; “Slinky” Wales  2015; “Now The Doing” Netherlands  2015; “Human Rainforest” Ireland 2016; and many important training gatherings in between).What do we plan?Our next step, without EU support, will be towards a territory we care a lot about... In fact, in such a crucial moment of history, where technology is evolving as fast as psychology, WE HAVE TO TALK ABOUT COMMUNICATION! ..and not just simple speaking abilities, nor social medias or marketing skills, but true Natural Human Communication. By uncovering this, we will be able to connect more and more with one another, to understand each other, maintaining values and aims, fostering qualities and meanings with awareness - and last but-not-least, to stay in touch with ourselves.Why do we ask for support?With Portugal being a new country for the Y-TOP we will have lots of challenges. Our summer camp, the volunteers and the youth will need plenty of resources, preparation and management. Arranging displacements, activities and adventures, and also exploring the right places to volunteer to help local communities - something we always do for the countries we visit.To do this we need your help, and we actually like to think that we all need each other's help.Whatever you kindly help us raise won't cover the cost of the camp in its entirety, but that's not a problem! Within the Y-TOP everyone are engaging in fundraising locally within our native countries, in order to promote our values for what money can do, as well as to increase our teamwork skills and to better understand how finance gives us greater access to options we believe in. In the likely case we will reach and exceed our goal we have so many important projects to further, just waiting for us (and now You!) to grow them and give them life. For instance; The Y-TOPtionary (an evolving dictionary for designing new words of the future), formal and informal educational programs (both stationary and nomads), a  Y-TOP music album (enabling us to share our message through original music) and many other movies, writings, arts, workshops, as well as social, artistic and innovation initiatives to build.The PerksFirst, please know that we are truly grateful and full of appreciation for your help. Second, we also prepared some great gifts to show you how important this is for us!Y-TOP inner peace braceletThis is a symbol that every y-top participant knows very well. It represents the Inner Peace. It's colors are yellow, green and blue and they are the central colors of the spectrum: yellow stands  for connection & value.  green for growth & creativity,  blue for standards & cleanliness.Y-TOP quality postcards/Y-TOP broochesWe will send a postcard to you or to a friend of yours, with a quote or a sentence about what we learn in our camps. You can also choose to receive a Y-TOP brooch with our logo, or the symbol of our last camp the Human Rainforest, or a picture of a meaningfull Y-TOP moment.Y-TOP T-shirtsA shirt with personal writings from the camp participants.Human Rainforest T-shirtsA shirt with a symbol from our last summer camp "Human rain forest" in IrelandMeet a "Y-TOPper"LET'S TALK ABOUT COOMUNICATION! A person or more from the Y-TOP are to meet you in your country to explore some of our projects such as Natural Human Communication or the Human Rainforest, or other topics that may inspire you. Would you like to speak about the Future? DO you feel like taking action in the world? Would you like to have a Solar System Trail in your cpuntry, such as those in Ireland and in Israel? Well then, meet a Y-TOPper!Above: the Y-TOP is ready to meet you. Below: the welcome sign of the Killarney Solar System Trail established thanks to the collaboration between the Y-TOP and Spacetime Instruments.Y-TOP song recordingIn addition to projects and gathering, lots of art, photography, dance, theatre and music get created within the Y-TOP environment. Long process of fine-tuning, improvising, composing, performing and developing have led to quite an archive of original Y-TOP songs and videos. One of them is just waiting for you.A picture by Mimo KhairMimo Khair is a famous photografer featured in many exhibitions and television programs worldwide. She lives in China but she always travel to be in as many Y-TOP camps and gathering she can attend. story:
Do You Love Math?

Boy I sure didn't when I was in grade school, or high school... or college! I don't know what came first... that I stunk at math or that I hated it, but you could definitely say... it was one club I wasn't getting into!

And this definitely hurt me in college and in life. I look back at all the opportunities that passed me by -- especially in areas of life that I love to be involved with now!

In my 30's, I always used to say, "If I had just tried harder, or had a better teacher... I would be so much better off now."

Well, I don't want to hear any teenager or college student ever say that if I can help it. So I'm starting my own KEVolution in math education...


Quick Summary for Smart But Busy People

What: Math Is Alive! The Book is "50 Mind-Blowing Ways to Make Math Friendly, Fun & Powerful." It's story-based, curiosity-driven math learning for teens and their teachers. And this first book is just the start. After it's published and in your hands, I plan to build a platform of interactive education around these first 50 stories -- and then the next 250 stories! Also, I need your help to GIVE AWAY 100,000 copies of the E-book to families, schools, and communities in need around the world. That's why I'm raising $50,000 to create an excellent book, a durable platform, and an enduring brand.

Who: Written by Kevin Cook (that’s me), a technology investor who was tortured by algebra as a kid and had to teach himself probability & statistics in his 30s. Ever since I "solved" the probability puzzle of Pascal and Fermat from the 1650s on my own, I've wanted to write a math book for teens. And when I saw the comedy film project Supertroopers 2 raise over $4 million here on IndieGoGo, I knew this was the way to get Math Is Alive! published and into the hands of potentially millions of kids by going directly to passionate math and kid-lovers like you and getting your awesome support and involvement for my Big Idea.

Why: I recently re-discovered that being totally immersed in science and math education was my calling, my MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose). I know that my story-based learning approach will help so many kids because it not only worked for me, it's what neuroscientists are discovering about the brain every day. The knowledge we've gained this century alone about the 3-pound universe in our skulls should be revolutionizing the way we help kids -- and adults -- learn math and science! Scroll down to the "Who's the book for?" section to see a bunch of the chapter titles of the 1st edition of Math Is Alive!

When: With your help, I’ll get Math Is Alive! published this autumn and we’ll launch a "KEVolution in EDUcation" based on brain science and the principles of Learning Organizations that cultivate positive transformations for individuals and teams. I don't know how long it will take me to give away 100,000 books to families and schools in need, but I do know that we will start creating the foundation to do so right away. Grab your spot in the limelight with me by locking in a chance to Make Cool Math Videos With Me for only $29!

How: My consulting practice Cavernous Educational Innovations will become a business platform for experiential learning that supports the Math Is Alive! Mission-Vision-Purpose and creates invaluable transformative opportunities for kids and adults around the world. It's where I take everything I know about neuroscience, probability, and human behavior and roll them into dynamic presentations that unleash insight and inspiration (see my one-of-a-kind Probability 101, Brain Science Power Hack, and KEVTalk perks). Until my new website is ready, there’s a lot of story and background on Cavernous below.

For You: I created a lot of really special perks to not only say "Thank You!" for your support, but to get you involved on lots of different levels. Please take a look at all my great perks and see which ones speak to you. My KEVTalk topics are fantastic opportunities to hear me speak to your group on unique, intelligent and exciting passions of mine that will open up your mind and inspire your people. The price tag is really a steal too, if I do say so myself-- especially since those are the all-in prices for your group, whether you have 5 people or 500!

Plus, there's a Secret Perk for only $13 linked somewhere below... see if you can find it! 


The Full Story... For Insatiably Curious People

The Shocking Truth About Math Education: We are failing kids, and the future

Did you know that only 26% of high school seniors are considered proficient in basic math skills when they graduate?

And for minority groups, the numbers are even worse: only 12% of Hispanic and just 7% of Black students tested proficient or better.

These shocking stats aren't from a study done 20 years ago before computers, the Internet, and high-tech teaching tools were available in modern classrooms. This is from the 2013 National Assessment of Educational Progress. And the 2015 data showed things got worse! The problem that has been with us for many decades is still here.



What is that problem? It's actually a 2-part obstacle...

Obstacle #1: First, the human brain is NOT naturally inclined to love equations and converse with mathematical relationships, like the language we learned to speak at 2 years old.

Obstacle #2: Second, curriculum methods and text books have NOT been addressing the first obstacle with enough creativity and recognition of personal learning styles. Instead, our ways of teaching math force-feed the same facts and "practice" problems to different kids and then continuously "test" them to see if anything stuck.

The result is millions of kids from 8 to 18 who are confused and feel like failures. They blame themselves for not getting it, not liking it, and never wanting to do any math again! And just imagine how many of these kids don't feel fit for college. It's the same old story where we are still leaving too many kids singing that old refrain about math...

"What do I need to know this for? When -- and how -- will I ever use this?"

It's not that we don't have good and committed teachers. There are thousands of qualified and caring math teachers out there. But their hands are tied by an educational system which treats all kids the same and offers little in the way of vital resources, tools, and time to help the 74% of kids who don't "naturally" get math.

Our Choice is As Simple as A or B

A) As a powerful, example-setting nation on the global stage, we can continue to sit back and ignore how individual brains learn, believing that math proficiency is about "survival of the fittest." If we do that, more and more kids will miss opportunities in a global, high-tech jobs market.

I was lucky enough to make it through a confusing and competitive jobs market because I stumbled upon what worked for me in learning math at 35 years old (my crazy story is coming up). Most kids won't be so lucky. It will be too late for them.

OR...


Because I choose Solution B, I'm launching a new education mission...

Math Is Alive! The Book, The School, The Revolution



Math is Alive! The Book

"50 Mind-Blowing Ways to Make Math Friendly, Fun & Powerful!"


Story-based, curiosity-driven education worked for me and it has also been proven in the 5 decades of work by Dr. Roger Schank, an artificial intelligence theorist, cognitive psychologist, learning scientist, educational reformer, and entrepreneur. His personal evolution as a researcher, professor, and then education reformer is a fascinating story in itself of discovery and commitment on the frontiers of what we know about intelligence and how minds learn.

I'll let these quotes from him sum up his philosophy...

"Learning occurs when someone wants to learn, not when someone wants to teach. I was a professor most of my life. In 2000, after 32 years (at Stanford, Yale and Northwestern), I decided to quit."

Schank has spent the last 16 years creating revolutionary forms of education for kids, universities, and corporations, all based on meaningful stories, experiences and learning by doing.


In Math Is Alive! I designed each of the 50 sections to have a unique story and action-task that connects a real math concept to every-day life, or to something utterly fascinating.


"Who's the book for?"


It's for teens, their teachers, and anyone else between the ages of 20 and 120 who is CURIOUS about the numerical formulas and connections amidst everything they encounter every day.

Here are 25 of the chapter titles, weaving together stories, games, puzzles, and thought experiments that will blow your beautiful, mathematical mind!

  1. The Probability of Winning a Multi-Million Dollar Lottery
  2. Flow: How You Can Use It to Change Your Life
  3. The Chances You Will Succeed in Your Own Business
  4. Code Life: Software Brains in Your Fave Devices, Games, & Apps
  5. How the iPhone Shrank the Universe
  6. The Explosion That Blew Your Mind
  7. Buffett's Billions: Why Being Super Rich Has a Really Simple Formula 
  8. Why the World Probably Isn't Coming to an End Any Time Soon
  9. How to Become a Stock Market Wizard
  10. Crazy People Who Get Hope from Powerball Tickets
  11. Why Your Worries About Today Mess Up Tomorrow
  12. Your Dog's Incredible Nose
  13. Why Junk Food, Video Games, and Facebook Win Over Goal-Setting, Achievement, and Happiness
  14. What Time Was it 1 Billion Years Ago?
  15. Your Cat's Nine Lives
  16. Could Ebola or Zika Spread to Pandemic Proportions?
  17. Tragic News and the Law of Averages
  18. Your Secret Weapon Against Life's Problems
  19. How Soon Will Overpopulation Become a Problem?
  20. Do I Say Odds or Chances?
  21. Your Chances of Disease and Changing Your Odds
  22. My Theory About Tens of Millions Getting Spent to Make Really Bad Movies
  23. The Precise Formula Casinos Use to Take Your Money
  24. The Probability You Are Here, Reading This
  25. The Formula for Living to 120 (or Being Super Healthy at Any Age)

Did that whet your curiosity appetite? Good! And here's 12 more...

How Wall Street Ignorance Broke the Economy

Does it Matter How Many Stars Are in the Universe?

What Do We Know For Sure About Climate Change?

Can I Really Create My Own Option Contract?

Why Lottery Winners End Up Broke Again

Game of Bones

5 Secrets of Wall Street

What Does a Black Swan Have to Do With the Stock Market?

Why Weather Forecasters Are So Awfully Accurate

The DaVinci Mode: How Curiosity Made a Great Life

1.4 Billion: What Lightning Strikes and Lottery Winners Have in Common

Artificial Intelligence: Can Machines Really Think?



You probably noticed I have more than a few chapters on the Lottery, Powerball, and the mathematics of games of chance. That's for two reasons:

First, learning this probability math can be fun and simple. And once kids see how simple and fun, it instantly boosts their confidence and their curiosity to learn more involved math! That's how I went from simple dice math to understanding options volatility, statistics, and the order & randomness of complex systems.

Second, I have a burning desire to show as many kids as possible the mechanics of these fruitless games that most states do little to help their citizens benefit from. The odds are horrible and the "benefits" mostly go to the corporations that run the games, instead of increasing any general education funds in several near-bankrupt states (they only make up the short-fall from elsewhere).

Bottom Line: I want to teach teens that their odds are massively tilted in their favor with the 3 E's of Excellence... Education, Effort and Entrepreneurship. In essence, I want them to hear me say loud and clear... 


Bet On Yourself!



Now check out this 4-minute version of my intro video to learn more details about the MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose) of the Math Is Alive! KEVolution...


It's Time for Bold Action

As you can see, I'm not "teaching" math as much as exploring it, celebrating it, and gossiping about it! I don't build a knowledge base, going step-by-step. I build a bonfire of fascination and curiosity.

Because math learning for most kids won't happen just because we ask them to follow the steps. It happens when you light a fire of curiosity, and at that early stage of crackling "brain fire" kindling, it doesn't matter what order they go in.

Their interest and passion will drive them to solve a mystery they are intensely curious about, like me when I wanted to understand how the Renaissance gambler Antoine Gombaud -- aka, the Chevalier de Mere -- figured out that some of his dice games had an odd pattern that surprised him.

Curiosity-driven was how I got pulled into loving all kinds of math. And it's how I made a life for myself...

Because diving into different math made lots of cool, real life stuff happen for me, like creating a new career in my 30s, buying my first house with an option contract, getting me promotions and new jobs -- like becoming an institutional currency trader handling $100 million in transactions per day! -- and even making me money in the endlessly fascinating stock market.

I say that learning math didn't just make me successful, it made me happier and never bored with so many mysteries to engage my mind from human evolution and the origins of our intelligence and behavior to big questions about religion, liberty, justice, poverty, wealth, and life's purpose.

As you can see, I actually make my living from math now. I'm no "quant" by any stretch but I am crazy about learning different "maths" because of what I discovered I can do with them. My first loves are actually science and psychology, and if I had the chance to go back to college, I would study biology, evolution, and neuroscience -- and surround myself with really good tutors for the math requirements.

But now I play with financial numbers and formulas all day to help other people make money. And the math I learn there bleeds over into all kinds of other areas I love in science, psychology, sociology, and technology!

What's my profession? I am a stock market strategist and portfolio manager. Every day I research companies and advise investors on which stocks to buy and which to sell.

My favorite areas of interest involve the companies creating the future in Technology, Software, Biotechnology, Big Data Visualization, Cognitive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, 3-D Printing, Autonomous Cars, and the Internet of Things.


And I just read the most incredible book Bold: How to Go BIG, Create WEALTH, and IMPACT the World by Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler. It's about how all these "Exponential Technologies," as they call them, are changing the world so fast that over 50% of global jobs will be completely transformed or eliminated in the next decade. This is why we need to "turn teens on" to their individual math power!


Peter Diamandis, often called "the first space entrepreneur," is the creator of the X PRIZE for space exploration and a founding member of the International Space University and Singularity University. And he's friends with brilliant billionaires like Jeff Bezos of Amazon, Richard Branson of Virgin, Larry Page of Google, and Elon Musk of Tesla -- all who have their own space enterprises, as you likely know. In Bold, these visionary "disruptors" and exponential thinkers share what drives them to change the world.

Steven Kotler, a thought leader in human potential and ultimate performance, is cofounder/director of research for the Flow Genome Project. His previous work, The Rise of Superman, draws on over 15 years of research, including first-hand reporting with dozens of top action and adventure athletes like epic surfer Laird Hamilton, extreme snowboarder Travis Rice, motocross nut Travis Pastrana, and rock climbing phenom Dean Potter. In it, Steven decodes the science of flow, an optimal state of consciousness where we feel our best and perform our best.



In their first book together, Abundance, Diamandis and Kotler document how progress in artificial intelligence, robotics, infinite computing, ubiquitous broadband networks, digital manufacturing, nanomaterials, synthetic biology, and many other exponentially growing technologies will enable us to make greater gains in the next two decades than we have in the previous two hundred years.

This was their manifesto to counter ideas about limited resources and the persistence of poverty. Diamandis and Kotler reasoned that we will soon have the ability to meet and exceed the basic needs of every man, woman, and child on the planet. And they asserted that abundance for all is within our grasp.


This was a powerful book for me because it speaks directly to an epiphany I had when I was in my mid-20s and reading too much Karl Marx and Jeremy Rifkin, thinking that technology and pollution were driving the world to a place where none of us would want to live. In 1992, I woke up from my "Luddite" nightmare -- by reading a couple hundred more books about science, innovation, and the naturally creative and ingenuous human brain -- and I created a "school" called CAVERNOUS Educational Innovations.

My core focus was on developing a Socratic seminar for college students titled "Boom or Doom: Exploring the Utopian Collision Course" where we reviewed dozens of books on both sides of the Technology vs. Environment debate. Probably no one was using the word "disruption" in 1992, but it was precisely the driving theme of human innovation and chaos I knew I had to accept and adapt to. So I put down the Rifkin books and started learning more science and math that gave me knowledge and inspiration, not just ideology and hopelessness.


More on my "1992 brain transplant" coming up... because my dream of 25 years ago is finally getting its chance to come alive and help teens and college kids around the world. But suffice to say right now, 25 years later we still have serious global problems to address with poverty and pollution.

And the way out is not to take a hard stance on something like "global warming" and climate change but to make sure more citizens know the math and science of it so they can evaluate complex data trends. 25 years ago, no one ever heard of Elon Musk and his visionary mission to create sustainable energy for the world with Tesla. His brand of entrepreneurship, along with Bezos, Branson, and Page, will change the world faster with innovative ideas than all the pessimists combined.



My mission is to inspire more kids to want to become scientists, engineers, designers -- and other types of world changers like artists, teachers, filmmakers, and musicians -- to work on these problems!

Ready to Join My Revolution?

If you already "get" Math Is Alive! and want to be a part of the Revolution, grab a perk or three and let's go!



But, if you still want to know more about the MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose) behind this unique and powerful education initiative, there's plenty of background below.

Enjoy the story!

I conceived of Math Is Alive! in 2014 and I found Bold  this year right when I needed it to convince me that now was the time to complete and launch my own rocket for math and science learning.

Believe it or not, I found the Bold  book "accidentally" when I was seeking inspiration and I did a Google search for "bold" missions, visions, and purpose!

How Serendipitous is That?

Diamandis actually used crowdfunding to put the Arkyd Telescope in space orbit for schools, scientists, and entrepreneurs around the world to have access to the galaxy!


So how did I go from math flunky to aspiring math wizard? It's a great story and it's also the inspiration for this project...


When I decided to teach myself essential math skills in my mid-30's, I discovered a great antidote to staring at equations that used to make my eyes glaze over -- if not go into allergic convulsions.

I found out that I loved the true life stories of math and science discovery, from Pythagoras to Pascal, and the genius of Galileo, Darwin, and Einstein.

I became entranced by the history, philosophy, and mystery-solving abilities of ground-breaking math and science -- and its creators -- much like people who are fascinated by the story of Steve Jobs and how he created Apple.
I realized that I was able to learn and even love math once I had a story I could sink my language-driven brain into! I needed the context and meaning for how someone changed history, or maybe just their own life, with a simple formula.

And then I was even fortunate to meet some of those people, like stock market options "wizard" Blair Hull, the card-counting blackjack player whose winnings paid his way through college in the 1970s, before the MIT teams profiled in the film "21" starring Kevin Spacey.


And after learning all I could about key subjects like probability and statistics -- and seeing the massive drought of such knowledge among people even in my chosen profession of finance -- I decided to write a book of fresh stories to help teenagers learn to love math and science the way I did.

A Launch Platform for Revolutionary Math Education!


If you haven't already, take a look at the great perks I'm offering to invite YOU to become an awesome part of the Math Is Alive! Revolution and help thousands, and possibly millions, of kids discover what math could do for them.

This project will be a new dawn in the math and science education of kids around the globe because this first book will be the LAUNCH PLATFORM for The Revolution where I will invite creative teachers, designers, and developers from dozens of countries and cultures to build interactive education, learning tools and apps around each story!

And one of my intermediate-term goals (1-3 years) after the publication of Math Is Alive! is to GIVE AWAY 100,000 COPIES to SCHOOLS & FAMILIES IN NEED AROUND THE GLOBE! I don't know how long that will take because I've never done anything like it. So your help will be so instrumental in getting my book, in whatever form, into the hands of teachers and students in Third World, remote, and impoverished areas.

Let's Do This!



That's It!


That's the MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose) of Math Is Alive!


I hope you're on board! And I hope you found a way to participate with one, or a few, of my great perks that speaks to you.



If you want to know more about what I'm up to, I've included more below about Cavernous and details of the exciting education projects that are inextricably intertwined with Math Is Alive! You can read about them here until my website is ready.


Oh, and the Secret Perk for only $13 is still hiding below somewhere!

The Math Is Alive! Book has the potential to inspire thousands of kids and their teachers. And to help make sure it achieves its MVP status, I'm launching a consulting and speaking practice that will "work for math." In other words...


CAVERNOUS Education

& "Deep Team Culture"

Will Help Pay the Way!


To complete, publish, market, and distribute Math Is Alive! I will need to raise at least $25,000. And to help "pay the way" I will be rolling out several proprietary and experiential education events under the banner of CAVERNOUS Educational Innovations.



CAVERNOUS... designed to deliver Transformative Learning for Organizations & Individuals.


Why CAVERNOUS? The name is based on three elements:

(1) C-A-V-E is the acronym Commitment-Action-Vision-Excellence that I designed in 1992 to symbolize the new values I wanted to pursue in the chaotic, crisis-filled world as it is, not some utopian Neverland of ideals and theories.  

(2) Plato's Allegory of the Cave was always powerful symbolism for me of the veil between illusion and truth, the gap between unconscious cultural custom and conscious knowledge quests. To me, wisdom is job #1.

(3) Knowledge quests are often like a series of unexplored caves where the learner is driven by curiosity but inevitably gets confused, disoriented, and lost. The only way out of a labyrinth is to go through the mysteries, solve them, and discover vital truth you didn't even anticipate.

While I have been teaching my Probability 101 trading courses for over a decade, now I want to introduce my experiential seminars in organizational psychology and performance under the transformative learning process I call Deep Team Culture.

What is the common thread between math education, trading, and organizational teams?


In a word, neuroscience. In 3 or 4 words, probability-based scenario thinking.

Our knowledge of the human brain and how we learn and perform, especially under conditions of uncertainty, risk, and individual or group behavioral challenges, is the key to transformative learning. Once I dove into the literature on the brain from great teachers like Joseph LeDoux, Antonio Damasio, Candace Pert, Richard Restak, and Daniel Amen I started to make all kinds of connections to explain our beautiful, powerful, complex, and sometimes irrational, behavior -- especially as it affected our Learning, Creativity, and Growth (LCG).

While we tend to think of ourselves as having "one mind," our brains are actually much more complex, with several often-competing forces and drivers. Candace Pert, who discovered the brain's opiate receptor in 1973, taught us that our brains are swimming with over 100 hormones that regulate emotions, perception, and behavior. When you combine this neuro-chemistry with layers of structures and functions built up over tens of millions of years of evolution, you can easily see that what we really have is a "multi-mind."

Neuroscientists have learned so much about the science of our behavior in the past 30 years that the frontiers of education should be exploding with new ways of teaching. Yet we are barely scratching the surface.

Maybe Dan Ariely -- a social scientist who studies people "from the outside" and catalogs behavioral tendencies that the neuroscientists want to discover the causes of -- is right that no matter how flooded in information and knowledge we are, some irrational thoughts and actions still tend to dominate our behavior...


We think we are more consistently rational than we really are. This is the crux of Ariely's work. He learned a lot from the trailblazers in this field, Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky, as did I when I discovered that smart commodity pit traders at the CME intuitively understood what the neuro and social scientists were just figuring out...

Trading and investing are very solitary challenges where the trader's mind is the sole field of engagement with outside forces of uncertainty and risk. I call trading one of the purest, most direct forms of "applied probability" because if the trader is unaware of his or her decision-making biases and emotions -- and lets these dominate over sound principles of probability and risk management -- then he or she will experience much frustration and loss of capital. In most cases, help is needed to get through the jungle. And there is an entire social science field built around these ideas called Behavioral Economics, created by researchers like Kahneman and Tversky.

Organizational team performance is all about managing common goals by aligning beliefs and values in areas that produce rapid or long-term results: creativity, problem-solving, probability-based project management and the multiplicity of "idea-into-product" challenges, from conception and development to production and delivery. I was reading Rosabeth Moss Kanter, Tom Peters, and Peter Senge in these fields 20-some years ago and I haven't stopped finding new thinkers advancing the ways we design and deliver transformative innovation, change-management, and leadership.


But I didn't learn everything I know about these exciting areas from books. I actually worked for a Fortune 500 financial behemoth for 14 years, in four different roles, through sweeping technological and industry change. I experienced first-hand how change-management and innovation were either successfully, or miserably, communicated to staff and thereby executed through staff.

Then I've spent the last 8 years at two dynamic financial institutions each brimming with projects and challenges, both technological and human. But sometimes I look back and think "Everything I know about teamwork and leadership I learned from football." I had some great coaches who understood how to build kids and teams to bring out their best.

Deep Team Culture is not a mandate or rubric. It's a leadership function of knowing your people well, understanding how teams work best, and creating space and time for them to ignite the highest visions for their work, as individuals and as teammates.

The cultural core of powerful learning organizations comes from the leader. He or she is like the wise farmer who obeys the laws of nature and nurture, and continuously builds and feeds good organizational soil that helps people thrive in an on-going cycle of Learn-Create-Grow (LCG).


My Deep Team Culture approach is designed to get to the "ecological" core of success and innovation for every unique organizational team, whether they are experienced with agile, sprint, scrum, and other rapid development practices, or just starting out. The mechanics of project and team success are centered around specific first principles and ground rules that create a rich soil for rapid innovation and execution to grow and thrive.

If you or your organization are interested in experiencing the Deep Team Culture approach to innovation and agile project execution, the Math Is Alive! crowdfund offers a terrific way for you to get unique access to its ideas and practices.

Just check out the perks where you can be among the first to get your hands on a Deep Team Culture publication or participate in a Deep Team Culture training event and support the launch of Math Is Alive! at the same time!

Still not wildly crazy about the Math Is Alive! Revolution? Then read this wild & crazy story of my "radical" youth...


From Drop-Out to Fired-Up!

I have created lots of simple, fun, and rewarding ways to join The Math Is Alive! Revolution that will bring this project to life and make YOU a part of something really special and world-changing.

But, you might still be wondering HOW a former math-flunky is qualified to write a math book and to teach new ways of learning math. THAT'S the key -- my transformation from "deathly afraid of math" to "fired-up to learn, create, and make money with math" was an explosion of creativity and power for me.

Now, I HAVE TO share that success with as many kids as possible.

Let me share a little more about my story so you can see why my heart and mind are so "all in" this mission.

After dropping out of college because I was "too cool for school," I mostly found work where math skills weren't an issue. I was a bartender, a roofer, a waiter, and I even tried to start my own coffee shop... which turned out to be a disaster because -- you guessed it -- I couldn't manage money or set goals to save my life.

I was a romantic adventurer in my early 20's, charting my own course of meaning and thinking that what I believed in and stood for was more important than the money in my bank account. I discovered a bigger world of beliefs and meaning, than I had previously imagined existed, on the shelves of libraries and book stores.

And I was worried about the poor quality of "TV entertainment" and how addicted kids and adults could become to its shallow forms of learning and culture when there were so many important things to learn and problems to solve. I read a lot of Neil Postman then, who had been studying the destructive effects of TV on education and culture for many years.


As a lightening rod of my new-found social consciousness, one cause I became really obsessed with was "saving the planet." Did you see the film Into the Wild? I was a lot like that kid in 1990. I read dozens of books on the greenhouse effect, industrial pollution, poverty, and the wide gaps between the super-rich 1% and the hopelessly poor 80-90%.

My politics and economic philosophy were definitely slanted left thanks to Karl Marx and all his living followers who convinced me we were destroying the earth and humanity. 

And just like that kid, I went off the deep end thinking I could live in the wild as a bold statement about humanity's one-way destruction path. I packed a bag (mostly with books) and boldly (and naively) "left civilization," hitchhiking to Northern California, hoping to find a commune to join where I could live off the land, and off the grid.


I didn't know about Christopher McCandless and his life journeys until the 2007 film by Sean Penn, based on the 1996 book by John Krakauer. And strangely, we made our bold statements only months apart in 1990, I in April and he in May after graduating Emory University.

But Christopher McCandless lived his dream all the way through, tragically. And I, less courageously, lived to tell. One of the things that saved me was a book. Actually several books. I tell some of those stories, through my math education journeys in ecology and economics, in the Math is Alive! Book.

But I'll share one book right now...

Filters Against Folly by Garrett Hardin. The book's sub-title says it all...
How to Survive Despite Economists, Ecologists, and the Merely Eloquent

That book helped me learn "how to think" about the world's problems with realistic math that could actually solve problems.

At the time, reading hundreds of other books on evolution, the brain, and the unstoppable ingenuity of humans, it also dawned on me that we couldn't stop technological progress because it was at the core of being human. To be human meant to be a thinker, doer, tinkerer, creator. We were going to constantly keep inventing new problems and their solutions until the end of time.

In this self-education process in my mid and late-20's, I fell in love with two different paths in life where "a bit" of math was required. One was science.  I was insatiably curious about the origins of the universe, the evolution of life and the human brain, and the ecology of a beautiful planet where pollution and poverty were becoming big problems -- and those areas obviously required being able to appreciate math!

The other path was that I started working in an industry where math is an every-day tool: the stock market. I read about these guys and gals called the "market wizards" who were controlling their own destinies as traders in global financial markets and making lots of money doing it.

These traders lived for freedom, creative challenge, and wealth and I wanted to be just like them. That meant I had to learn a little bit more math. Because if I wanted to have any good impact on the world, I needed money.


And to be a successful capitalist, you had to know your way around numbers because there were plenty of people out there who would try to take your money with their better grasp (and manipulation) of numbers.

Here was another important book I read in the early 1990s as I woke up from my gloom about the future. New World, New Mind was written by Paul Ehrlich, who was rethinking his own doomsaying about over-population, and Robert Ornstein the groundbreaking researcher in the psychology of consciousness.

They helped further inspire a science-focused basis for any ideas I had about changing the world, especially with their focus on our multi-million year old savanna brain architecture making decisions in the face of lightning-fast electronic stimulation and a 24/7 streaming barrage of news, tragedy, and political issues from around the globe...


Learning to Count = Making Your Dreams Count

The good news is that I became successful in my trading career because I applied my mind to the task and learned the math I needed to. But I didn't do it because anyone told me I had to, or because my mind was focused on wealth (but that helped).

I did so because I found out how fascinating some areas of math were to me.

It was like I was solving a mystery every day that actually made me feel smart, accomplished, and going places. And a lot of it was just plain fun.

Now I want to help millions of kids all across the globe to find their curiosity and passion for math ideas and tools. I'm not talking about making kids fall in love with numbers and fancy equations.

I'm talking about creating a spark where they didn't know one existed and using that inspiration to be fascinated by life's mysteries, to build a great education and career -- or start their own business -- and basically to achieve any goal they desire.

Math can be a tool, an adventure, or a bridge. I want to help kids find out what it could be for them!



Secret Perk: MathChat Hangout!

As a psychology and philosophy student in college (and largely self-taught in those areas after I left college), I always wanted to teach and inspire young minds to explore the world and become all they were capable of.

In fact, I have been planning and dreaming for the past 25 years of ways I could become a highly-motivational and inspirational teacher for high school students. I've done it for adults in financial markets for 20 years and now it's time to do it for teens everywhere who just need a helping hand and a passionate boost.

And I finally found a way to start...

How You Can Help Launch the "Math Is Alive!" Revolution in Just 3 Steps!

Step #1: Look at the Perks and the multiple ways I designed for you to help launch the Math Is Alive! Revolution. I am raising $50,000 to publish the 1st edition of the "Math Is Alive!" Book and to start teaching The School course to thousands of kids.

One of my gigantic goals is to give away 100,000 free copies of the 1st edition to families in need. And I will be arranging special discounts for The School to those families as well. As you can tell, this campaign is just the start. Once we're rolling, I will be winning corporate sponsorships for the Math Is Alive! Revolution.

Step #2: Pick a Perk that speaks most to you! I want you to feel like a part of the Math Is Alive! Revolution and to know that your contribution will be the spark to make a difference for potentially millions of kids.

Step #3: Cheer Me On as I finish writing the book and get ready to launch the Revolution. Shouting out to your social networks and linking to our Facebook page will be wonderfully appreciated because for me to complete phase one of this mission, the $25,000 mark is the minimum needed as I put The Revolution on a firm foundation to create and publish The Book and teach The School course.

What's the money for?

I had a website being built, but the project was derailed (hired wrong person) and I had to launch anyway without one. That money is gone and I know I need a professional website to give the book maximum reach and impact, like getting media interviews and hosting my articles on math education and Deep Team Culture, my consulting work which will help pay the way. Here are my top costs right now...

1) Professional Website and Database Support Functions
2) Book Publication Strategy (design, layout, printing, etc.)
3) Video Production for Dozens of Online Math Lessons
4) PR/Media Campaign and Speaking Tour
5) Marketing and Social Media Campaign
6) Co-Working Space
7) Freelance Assistance/Interns
8) Business and Legal Advice/Services
9) Book Distribution Logistics

The Impact
