I built a successful career in finance without a college degree and I didn't start until I was 29. What I lacked in math skills I made up for in dreams and tenacity and curiosity. I simply love to learn and discover new ideas about our brains and how we learn. Imagine what we can accomplish as I launch this dream to teach kids around the world about their own curiosity and tenacity for math and science...

  • Millions of kids discovering their own uses and passion for math and science!
  • More of those kids going to college and succeeding in pursuit of their goals!
  • And some of those kids going on to inspire others as teachers themselves!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a financial contribution right now? No problem.

  • Can you help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign on Facebook and all the other cool sharing networks where people listen to you?
  • And be sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools which make it easy!

Thank you for taking the time to learn about the Math Is Alive! Revolution.

Sincerely,

Kevin B. Cook
story_txt:
Do You Love Math?
Boy I sure didn't when I was in grade school, or high school... or college! I don't know what came first... that I stunk at math or that I hated it, but you could definitely say... it was one club I wasn't getting into!And this definitely hurt me in college and in life. I look back at all the opportunities that passed me by -- especially in areas of life that I love to be involved with now!In my 30's, I always used to say, "If I had just tried harder, or had a better teacher... I would be so much better off now."Well, I don't want to hear any teenager or college student ever say that if I can help it. So I'm starting my own KEVolution in math education...


Quick Summary for Smart But Busy People

What: Math Is Alive! The Book is "50 Mind-Blowing Ways to Make Math Friendly, Fun & Powerful." It's story-based, curiosity-driven math learning for teens and
their teachers. And this first book is just the start. After it's published and in your hands, I plan to build a platform of interactive education around
these first 50 stories -- and then the next 250 stories! Also, I need your help to GIVE AWAY
100,000 copies of the E-book to families, schools, and communities in need around the world. That's why I'm raising $50,000 to create an excellent book, a durable platform, and an enduring brand.
Who: Written by Kevin Cook (that’s me), a technology investor
who was tortured by algebra as a kid and had to teach himself probability & statistics in his 30s. Ever since I "solved" the probability puzzle of Pascal and Fermat from the 1650s on my own, I've wanted to write a math book for teens. And when I saw
the comedy film project Supertroopers 2 raise over $4 million here on IndieGoGo, I
knew this was the way to get Math Is Alive! published and into the hands of
potentially millions of kids by going directly to passionate math and kid-lovers like you and getting
your awesome support and involvement for my Big Idea.
Why: I recently re-discovered that being totally immersed in science and
math education was my calling, my MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose). I know that my story-based
learning approach will help so many kids because it not only worked for me, it's what neuroscientists are discovering about the brain every day. The knowledge we've gained this century alone about the 3-pound universe in our skulls should be revolutionizing the way we help kids -- and adults -- learn math and science! Scroll down to the "Who's the book for?" section to see a bunch of the chapter titles of the 1st edition of Math Is Alive!
When: With your help, I’ll get Math Is Alive! published this autumn
and we’ll launch a "KEVolution in EDUcation" based on brain science and the principles of Learning Organizations that cultivate positive transformations for
individuals and teams. I don't know how long it will take me to give away 100,000 books to families and schools in need, but I do know that we will start creating the foundation to do so right away. Grab your spot in the limelight with me by locking in a chance to Make Cool Math Videos With Me for only $29!
How: My consulting practice Cavernous Educational
Innovations will become a business platform for experiential learning that supports the
Math Is Alive! Mission-Vision-Purpose and creates invaluable transformative opportunities for kids
and adults around the world. It's where I take everything I know about neuroscience, probability, and human behavior and roll them into dynamic presentations that unleash insight and inspiration (see my one-of-a-kind Probability 101, Brain Science Power Hack, and KEVTalk perks). Until my new website is ready, there’s a lot of story
and background on Cavernous below.For You: I created a lot of really special perks to not only say "Thank You!" for your support, but to get you involved on lots of different levels. Please take a look at all my great perks and see which ones speak to you. My KEVTalk topics are fantastic opportunities to hear me speak to your group on unique, intelligent and exciting passions of mine that will open up your mind and inspire your people. The price tag is really a steal too, if I do say so myself-- especially since those are the all-in prices for your group, whether you have 5 people or 500!Plus, there's a Secret Perk for only $13 linked somewhere below... see if you can find it! 



The Full Story... For Insatiably Curious People



The Shocking Truth About Math Education: We are failing kids, and the future

Did you know that only 26% of high school seniors are considered proficient in basic math skills when they graduate?


And for minority groups, the numbers are even worse: only 12% of Hispanic and just 7% of Black students tested proficient or better.



These shocking stats aren't from a study done 20 years ago before computers, the Internet, and high-tech teaching tools were available in modern classrooms. This is from the 2013 National Assessment of Educational Progress. And the 2015 data showed things got worse! The problem that has been with us for many decades is still here.




What is that problem? It's actually a 2-part obstacle...

Obstacle #1: First, the human brain is NOT naturally inclined to love equations and converse with mathematical relationships, like the language we learned to speak at 2 years old.



Obstacle #2: Second, curriculum methods and text books have NOT been addressing the first obstacle with enough creativity and recognition of personal learning styles. Instead, our ways of teaching math force-feed the same facts and "practice" problems to different kids and then continuously "test" them to see if anything stuck.


The result is millions of kids from 8 to 18 who are confused and feel like failures. They blame themselves for not getting it, not liking it, and never wanting to do any math again! And just imagine how many of these kids don't feel fit for college. It's the same old story where we are still leaving too many kids singing that old refrain about math..."What do I need to know this for? When -- and how -- will I ever use this?"



It's not that we don't have good and committed teachers. There are thousands of qualified and caring math teachers out there. But their hands are tied by an educational system which treats all kids the same and offers little in the way of vital resources, tools, and time to help the 74% of kids who don't "naturally" get math.


Our Choice is As Simple as A or B

A) As a powerful, example-setting nation on the global stage, we can continue to sit back and ignore how individual brains learn, believing that math proficiency is about "survival of the fittest." If we do that, more and more kids will miss opportunities in a global, high-tech jobs market.



I was lucky enough to make it through a confusing and competitive jobs market because I stumbled upon what worked for me in learning math at 35 years old (my crazy story is coming up). Most kids won't be so lucky. It will be too late for them.



OR...









Because I choose Solution B, I'm launching a new education mission...








Math Is Alive! The Book, The School, The Revolution



Math is Alive! The Book
"50 Mind-Blowing Ways to Make Math Friendly, Fun & Powerful!"
Story-based, curiosity-driven education worked for me and it has also been proven in the 5 decades of work by Dr.
 Roger Schank, an artificial intelligence theorist, cognitive 
psychologist, learning scientist, educational reformer, and 
entrepreneur. His personal evolution as a researcher, professor, and
 then education reformer is a fascinating story in itself of discovery 
and commitment on the frontiers of what we know about intelligence and 
how minds learn.I'll let these quotes from him sum up his philosophy...
"Learning
 occurs when someone wants to learn, not when someone wants to teach. I 
was a professor most of my life. In 2000, after 32 years (at Stanford, 
Yale and Northwestern), I decided to quit."
Schank has spent 
the last 16 years creating revolutionary forms of education for kids, 
universities, and corporations, all based on meaningful stories, 
experiences and learning by doing. 


In Math Is Alive!
 I designed each of the 50 sections to have a unique story and 
action-task that connects a real math concept to every-day life, or to 
something utterly fascinating.
"Who's the book for?"

It's for teens, their teachers, and anyone else between the ages of 20 and 120 who is CURIOUS about the numerical formulas and connections amidst everything they encounter every day.

Here are 25 of the chapter titles, weaving together stories, games, puzzles, and thought experiments that will blow your beautiful, mathematical mind!


The Probability of Winning a Multi-Million Dollar Lottery
Flow: How You Can Use It to Change Your Life
The Chances You Will Succeed in Your Own Business
Code Life: Software Brains in Your Fave Devices, Games, & Apps 
How the iPhone Shrank the Universe
The Explosion That Blew Your Mind
Buffett's Billions: Why Being Super Rich Has a Really Simple Formula 


Why the World Probably Isn't Coming to an End Any Time Soon
How to Become a Stock Market Wizard
Crazy People Who Get Hope from Powerball Tickets

Why Your Worries About Today Mess Up Tomorrow

Your Dog's Incredible Nose
Why Junk Food, Video Games, and Facebook Win Over Goal-Setting, Achievement, and Happiness
What Time Was it 1 Billion Years Ago?
Your Cat's Nine Lives
Could Ebola or Zika Spread to Pandemic Proportions?
Tragic News and the Law of Averages
Your Secret Weapon Against Life's Problems
How Soon Will Overpopulation Become a Problem?
Do I Say Odds or Chances?
Your Chances of Disease and Changing Your Odds
My Theory About Tens of Millions Getting Spent to Make Really Bad Movies
The Precise Formula Casinos Use to Take Your Money
The Probability You Are Here, Reading This
The Formula for Living to 120 (or Being Super Healthy at Any Age)



Did that whet your curiosity appetite? Good! And here's 12 more...
How Wall Street Ignorance Broke the Economy
Does it Matter How Many Stars Are in the Universe?

What Do We Know For Sure About Climate Change?
Can I Really Create My Own Option Contract?
Why Lottery Winners End Up Broke Again


Game of Bones
5 Secrets of Wall Street
What Does a Black Swan Have to Do With the Stock Market?


Why Weather Forecasters Are So Awfully Accurate
The DaVinci Mode: How Curiosity Made a Great Life
1.4 Billion: What Lightning Strikes and Lottery Winners Have in Common

Artificial Intelligence: Can Machines Really Think? 



You probably noticed I have more than a few chapters on the Lottery, Powerball, and the mathematics of games of chance. That's for two reasons:
First, learning this probability math can be fun and simple. And once kids see how simple and fun, it instantly boosts their confidence and their curiosity to learn more involved math! That's how I went from simple dice math to understanding options volatility, statistics, and the order & randomness of complex systems.
Second, I have a burning desire to show as many kids as possible the mechanics of these fruitless games that most states do little to help their citizens benefit from. The odds are horrible and the "benefits" mostly go to the corporations that run the games, instead of increasing any general education funds in several near-bankrupt states (they only make up the short-fall from elsewhere).
Bottom Line: I want to teach teens that their odds are massively tilted in their favor with the 3 E's of Excellence... Education, Effort and Entrepreneurship. In essence, I want them to hear me say loud and clear... 

Bet On Yourself!



Now check out this 4-minute version of my intro video to learn more details about the MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose) of the Math Is Alive! KEVolution...



It's Time for Bold Action


As you can see, I'm not "teaching" math as much as exploring it, celebrating it, and gossiping about it! I don't build a knowledge base, going step-by-step. I build a bonfire of fascination and curiosity. Because math learning for most kids won't happen just because we ask 
them to follow the steps. It happens when you light a fire of curiosity,
 and at that early stage of crackling "brain fire" kindling, it doesn't matter what 
order they go in.Their interest and passion will drive them to solve a 
mystery they are intensely curious about, like me when I wanted to understand how the Renaissance gambler Antoine Gombaud -- aka, the Chevalier de Mere -- figured out that some of his dice games had an odd pattern that surprised him. 

Curiosity-driven was how I got pulled into loving all kinds of math. And it's how I made a life for myself...Because diving into different math made lots of cool, real life stuff happen for me, like creating a new career in my 30s, buying my first house with an option contract, getting me promotions and new jobs -- like becoming an institutional currency trader handling $100 million in transactions per day! -- and even making me money in the endlessly fascinating stock market.I say that learning math didn't just make me successful, it made me happier and never bored with so many mysteries to engage my mind from human evolution and the origins of our intelligence and behavior to big questions about religion, liberty, justice, poverty, wealth, and life's purpose.

As you can see, I actually make my living from math now. I'm no "quant" by any stretch but I am crazy about learning different "maths" because of what I discovered I can do with them.
 My first loves are actually science and psychology, and if I had the 
chance to go back to college, I would study biology, evolution, and 
neuroscience -- and surround myself with really good tutors for the math
 requirements.

But now I play 
with financial numbers and formulas all day to help other people make 
money. And the math I learn there bleeds over into all kinds of other 
areas I love in science, psychology, sociology, and technology!

What's my profession? I am a stock market strategist and portfolio manager. Every day I research companies and advise investors on which stocks to buy and which to sell.
My favorite areas of 
interest involve the companies creating the future in Technology, 
Software, Biotechnology, Big Data Visualization, Cognitive Analytics, 
Artificial Intelligence, 3-D Printing, Autonomous Cars, and the Internet
 of Things.
And I just read the most incredible book Bold: How to Go BIG, Create WEALTH, and IMPACT the World by Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler. It's about how all these "Exponential Technologies," as they call them, are changing the world so fast that over 50% of global jobs will be completely transformed or eliminated in the next decade. This is why we need to "turn teens on" to their individual math power!




Peter Diamandis, often called "the first space entrepreneur," is the creator of the X PRIZE for space exploration and a founding member of the International Space University and Singularity University. And he's friends with brilliant billionaires like Jeff Bezos of Amazon, Richard Branson of Virgin, Larry Page of Google, and Elon Musk of Tesla -- all who have their own space enterprises, as you likely know. In Bold, these visionary "disruptors" and exponential thinkers share what drives them to change the world.
Steven Kotler, a thought leader in human potential and ultimate performance, is cofounder/director of research for the Flow Genome Project. His previous work, The Rise of Superman, draws on over 15 years of research, including first-hand reporting with dozens of top action and adventure athletes like epic surfer Laird Hamilton, extreme snowboarder Travis Rice, motocross nut Travis Pastrana, and rock climbing phenom Dean Potter. In it, Steven decodes the science of flow, an optimal state of consciousness where we feel our best and perform our best. 




In their first book together, Abundance, Diamandis and Kotler document how progress in artificial intelligence, robotics, infinite computing, ubiquitous broadband networks, digital manufacturing, nanomaterials, synthetic biology, and many other exponentially growing technologies will enable us to make greater gains in the next two decades than we have in the previous two hundred years.This was their manifesto to counter ideas about limited resources and the persistence of poverty. Diamandis and Kotler reasoned that we will soon have the ability to meet and exceed the basic needs of every man, woman, and child on the planet. And they asserted that abundance for all is within our grasp.

This was a powerful book for me because it speaks directly to an epiphany I had when I was in my mid-20s and reading too much Karl Marx and Jeremy Rifkin, thinking that technology and pollution were driving the world to a place where none of us would want to live. In 1992, I woke up from my "Luddite" nightmare -- by reading a couple hundred more books about science, innovation, and the naturally creative and ingenuous human brain -- and I created a "school" called CAVERNOUS Educational Innovations.My core focus was on developing a Socratic seminar for college students titled "Boom or Doom: Exploring the Utopian Collision Course" where we reviewed dozens of books on both sides of the Technology vs. Environment debate. Probably
 no one was using the word "disruption" in 1992, but it was precisely 
the driving theme of human innovation and chaos I knew I had to accept 
and adapt to. So I put down the Rifkin books and started learning 
more science and math that gave me knowledge and inspiration, not just 
ideology and hopelessness.



More on my "1992 brain transplant" coming up... because my dream of 25 years ago is finally getting its chance to come alive and help teens and college kids around the world. But suffice to say right now, 25 years later we still have serious global problems to address with poverty and pollution.And the way out is not to take a hard stance on something like "global warming" and climate change but to make sure more citizens know the math and science of it so they can evaluate complex data trends. 25 years ago, no one ever heard of Elon Musk and his visionary mission to create sustainable energy for the world with Tesla. His brand of entrepreneurship, along with Bezos, Branson, and Page, will change the world faster with innovative ideas than all the pessimists combined.
My mission is to inspire more kids to want to become scientists, engineers, designers -- and other types of world changers like artists, teachers, filmmakers, and musicians -- to work on these problems!

Ready to Join My Revolution?

If you already "get" Math Is Alive! and want to be a part of the Revolution, grab a perk or three and let's go!



But, if you still want to know more about the MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose) behind this unique and powerful education initiative, there's plenty of background below.
Enjoy the story!
I conceived of Math Is Alive! in 2014 and I found Bold  this year right when I needed it to convince me that now was the time to complete and launch my own rocket for math and science learning.
Believe it or not, I found the Bold  book "accidentally" when I was seeking inspiration and I did a Google search for "bold" missions, visions, and purpose!
How Serendipitous is That?
Diamandis actually used crowdfunding to put the Arkyd Telescope in space orbit for schools, scientists, and entrepreneurs around the world to have access to the galaxy!


So how did I go from math flunky to aspiring math wizard? It's a great story and it's also the inspiration for this project...


When I decided to teach myself essential math skills in my mid-30's, I discovered a great antidote to staring at equations that used to make my eyes glaze over -- if not go into allergic convulsions.I found out that I loved the true life stories of math and science discovery, from Pythagoras to Pascal, and the genius of Galileo, Darwin, and Einstein.I became entranced by the history, philosophy, and mystery-solving abilities of ground-breaking math and science -- and its creators -- much like people who are fascinated by the story of Steve Jobs and how he created Apple.

I realized that I was able to learn and even love math once I had a story I could sink my language-driven brain into! I needed the context and meaning for how someone changed history, or maybe just their own life, with a simple formula. 

And then I was even fortunate to meet some of those people, like stock market options "wizard" Blair Hull, the card-counting blackjack player whose winnings paid his way through college in the 1970s, before the MIT teams profiled in the film "21" starring Kevin Spacey.
And after learning all I could about key subjects like probability and statistics -- and seeing the massive drought of such knowledge among people even in my chosen profession of finance -- I decided to write a book of fresh stories to help teenagers learn to love math and science the way I did.


A Launch Platform for Revolutionary Math Education!

If you haven't already, take a look at the great perks I'm offering to invite YOU to become an awesome part of the Math Is Alive! Revolution and help thousands, and possibly millions, of kids discover what math could do for them.This project will be a new dawn in the math and science education of kids around the globe because this first book will be the LAUNCH PLATFORM for The Revolution where I will invite creative teachers, designers, and developers from dozens of countries and cultures to build interactive education, learning tools and apps around each story!And one of my intermediate-term goals (1-3 years) after the publication of Math Is Alive! is to GIVE AWAY 100,000 COPIES to SCHOOLS & FAMILIES IN NEED AROUND THE GLOBE! I don't know how long that will take because I've never done anything like it. So your help will be so instrumental in getting my book, in whatever form, into the hands of teachers and students in Third World, remote, and impoverished areas. Let's Do This!


That's It!

That's the MVP (Mission-Vision-Purpose) of Math Is Alive!

I hope you're on board! And I hope you found a way to participate with one, or a few, of my great perks that speaks to you.





If you want to know more about what I'm up to, I've included more below about Cavernous and details of the exciting education projects that are inextricably intertwined with Math Is Alive! You can read about them here until my website is ready.

Oh, and the Secret Perk for only $13 is still hiding below somewhere!

The Math Is Alive! Book has the potential to inspire thousands of kids and their teachers. And to help make sure it achieves its MVP status, I'm launching a consulting and speaking practice that will "work for math." In other words...

CAVERNOUS Education
& "Deep Team Culture"
Will Help Pay the Way!

To complete, publish, market, and distribute Math Is Alive! I will need to raise at least $25,000. And to help "pay the way" I will be rolling out several proprietary and experiential education events under the banner of CAVERNOUS Educational Innovations.
CAVERNOUS... designed to deliver Transformative Learning for Organizations & Individuals. 

Why CAVERNOUS? The name is based on three elements:(1) C-A-V-E is the acronym Commitment-Action-Vision-Excellence that I designed in 1992 to symbolize the new values I wanted to pursue in the chaotic, crisis-filled world as it is, not some utopian Neverland of ideals and theories.  (2) Plato's Allegory of the Cave was always powerful symbolism for me of the veil between illusion and truth, the gap between unconscious cultural custom and conscious knowledge quests. To me, wisdom is job #1.(3) Knowledge quests are often like a series of unexplored caves where the learner is driven by curiosity but inevitably gets confused, disoriented, and lost. The only way out of a labyrinth is to go through the mysteries, solve them, and discover vital truth you didn't even anticipate.While I have been teaching my Probability 101 trading courses for over a decade, now I want to introduce my experiential seminars in organizational psychology and performance under the transformative learning process I call Deep Team Culture.What is the common thread between math education, trading, and organizational teams?

In a word, neuroscience. In 3 or 4 words, probability-based scenario thinking.Our knowledge of the human brain and how we learn and perform, especially under conditions of uncertainty, risk, and individual or group behavioral challenges, is the key to transformative learning. Once I dove into the literature on the brain from great teachers like Joseph LeDoux, Antonio Damasio, Candace Pert, Richard Restak, and Daniel Amen I started to make all kinds of connections to explain our beautiful, powerful, complex, and sometimes irrational, behavior -- especially as it affected our Learning, Creativity, and Growth (LCG).While we tend to think of ourselves as having "one mind," our brains are actually much more complex, with several often-competing forces and drivers. Candace Pert, who discovered the brain's opiate receptor in 1973, taught us that our brains are swimming with over 100 hormones that regulate emotions, perception, and behavior. When you combine this neuro-chemistry with layers of structures and functions built up over tens of millions of years of evolution, you can easily see that what we really have is a "multi-mind."Neuroscientists have learned so much about the science of our behavior in the past 30 years that the frontiers of education should be exploding with new ways of teaching. Yet we are barely scratching the surface.Maybe Dan Ariely -- a social scientist who studies people "from the outside" and catalogs behavioral tendencies that the neuroscientists want to discover the causes of -- is right that no matter how flooded in information and knowledge we are, some irrational thoughts and actions still tend to dominate our behavior...
We think we are more consistently rational than we really are. This is the crux of Ariely's work. He learned a lot from the trailblazers in this field, Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky, as did I when I discovered that smart commodity pit traders at the CME intuitively understood what the neuro and social scientists were just figuring out...Trading and investing are very solitary challenges where the trader's mind is the sole field of engagement with outside forces of uncertainty and risk. I call trading one of the purest, most direct forms of "applied probability" because if the trader is unaware of his or her decision-making biases and emotions -- and lets these dominate over sound principles of probability and risk management -- then he or she will experience much frustration and loss of capital. In most cases, help is needed to get through the jungle. And there is an entire social science field built around these ideas called Behavioral Economics, created by researchers like Kahneman and Tversky.Organizational team performance is all about managing common goals by aligning beliefs and values in areas that produce rapid or long-term results: creativity, problem-solving, probability-based project management and the multiplicity of "idea-into-product" challenges, from conception and development to production and delivery. I was reading Rosabeth Moss Kanter, Tom Peters, and Peter Senge in these fields 20-some years ago and I haven't stopped finding new thinkers advancing the ways we design and deliver transformative innovation, change-management, and leadership.
But I didn't learn everything I know about these exciting areas from books. I actually worked for a Fortune 500 financial behemoth for 14 years, in four different roles, through sweeping technological and industry change. I experienced first-hand how change-management and innovation were either successfully, or miserably, communicated to staff and thereby executed through staff.


Then I've spent the last 8 years at two dynamic financial institutions each brimming with projects and challenges, both technological and human. But sometimes I look back and think "Everything I know about teamwork and leadership I learned from football." I had some great coaches who understood how to build kids and teams to bring out their best.


Deep Team Culture is not a mandate or rubric. It's a leadership function of knowing your people well, understanding how teams work best, and creating space and time for them to ignite the highest visions for their work, as individuals and as teammates.


The cultural core of powerful learning organizations comes from the leader. He or she is like the wise farmer who obeys the laws of nature and nurture, and continuously builds and feeds good organizational soil that helps people thrive in an on-going cycle of Learn-Create-Grow (LCG).



My Deep Team Culture approach is designed to get to the "ecological" core of success and innovation for every unique organizational team, whether they are experienced with agile, sprint, scrum, and other rapid development practices, or just starting out. The mechanics of project and team success are centered around specific first principles and ground rules that create a rich soil for rapid innovation and execution to grow and thrive. If you or your organization are interested in experiencing the Deep Team Culture approach to innovation and agile project execution, the Math Is Alive! crowdfund offers a terrific way for you to get unique access to its ideas and practices.Just check out the perks where you can be among the first to get your hands on a Deep Team Culture publication or participate in a Deep Team Culture training event and support the launch of Math Is Alive! at the same time!
Still not wildly crazy about the Math Is Alive! Revolution? Then read this wild & crazy story of my "radical" youth...


From Drop-Out to Fired-Up!I have created lots of simple, fun, and rewarding ways to join The Math Is Alive! Revolution that will bring this project to life and make YOU a part of something really special and world-changing.But, you might still be wondering HOW a former math-flunky is qualified to write a math book and to teach new ways of learning math. THAT'S the key -- my transformation from "deathly afraid of math" to "fired-up to learn, create, and make money with math" was an explosion of creativity and power for me.

Now, I HAVE TO share that success with as many kids as possible.

Let me share a little more about my story so you can see why my heart and mind are so "all in" this mission.

After dropping out of college because I was "too cool for school," I mostly found work where math skills weren't an issue. I was a bartender, a roofer, a waiter, and I even tried to start my own coffee shop... which turned out to be a disaster because -- you guessed it -- I couldn't manage money or set goals to save my life.

I was a romantic adventurer in my early 20's, charting my own course of meaning and thinking that what I believed in and stood for was more important than the money in my bank account. I discovered a bigger world of beliefs and meaning, than I had previously imagined existed, on the shelves of libraries and book stores.And I was worried about the poor quality of "TV entertainment" and how addicted kids and adults could become to its shallow forms of learning and culture when there were so many important things to learn and problems to solve. I read a lot of Neil Postman then, who had been studying the destructive effects of TV on education and culture for many years.


As a lightening rod of my new-found social consciousness, one cause I became really obsessed with was "saving the planet." Did you see the film Into the Wild? I was a lot like that kid in 1990. I read dozens of books on the greenhouse effect, industrial pollution, poverty, and the wide gaps between the super-rich 1% and the hopelessly poor 80-90%.My politics and economic philosophy were definitely slanted left thanks to Karl Marx and all his living followers who convinced me we were destroying the earth and humanity. 


And just like that kid, I went off the deep end thinking I could live in the wild as a bold statement about humanity's one-way destruction path. I packed a bag (mostly with books) and boldly (and naively) "left civilization," hitchhiking to Northern California, hoping to find a commune to join where I could live off the land, and off the grid.
I didn't know about Christopher McCandless and his life journeys until the 2007 film by Sean Penn, based on the 1996 book by John Krakauer. And strangely, we made our bold statements only months apart in 1990, I in April and he in May after graduating Emory University.But Christopher McCandless lived his dream all the way through, tragically. And I, less courageously, lived to tell. One of the things that saved me was a book. Actually several books. I tell some of those stories, through my math education journeys in ecology and economics, in the Math is Alive! Book.



But I'll share one book right now...


Filters Against Folly by Garrett Hardin. The book's sub-title says it all...
How to Survive Despite Economists, Ecologists, and the Merely Eloquent

That book helped me learn "how to think" about the world's problems with realistic math that could actually solve problems.

At the time, reading hundreds of other books on evolution, the brain, and the unstoppable ingenuity of humans, it also dawned on me that we couldn't stop technological progress because it was at the core of being human. To be human meant to be a thinker, doer, tinkerer, creator. We were going to constantly keep inventing new problems and their solutions until the end of time.

In this self-education process in my mid and late-20's, I fell in love with two different paths in life where "a bit" of math was required. One was science.  I was insatiably curious about the origins of the universe, the evolution of life and the human brain, and the ecology of a beautiful planet where pollution and poverty were becoming big problems -- and those areas obviously required being able to appreciate math!The other path was that I started working in an industry where math is an every-day tool: the stock market. I read about these guys and gals called the "market wizards" who were controlling their own destinies as traders in global financial markets and making lots of money doing it.These traders lived for freedom, creative challenge, and wealth and I wanted to be just like them. That meant I had to learn a little bit more math. Because if I wanted to have any good impact on the world, I needed money.


And to be a successful capitalist, you had to know your way around numbers because there were plenty of people out there who would try to take your money with their better grasp (and manipulation) of numbers.Here was another important book I read in the early 1990s as I woke up from my gloom about the future. New World, New Mind was written by Paul Ehrlich, who was rethinking his own doomsaying about over-population, and Robert Ornstein the groundbreaking researcher in the psychology of consciousness.They helped further inspire a science-focused basis for any ideas I had about changing the world, especially with their focus on our multi-million year old savanna brain architecture making decisions in the face of lightning-fast electronic stimulation and a 24/7 streaming barrage of news, tragedy, and political issues from around the globe...


Learning to Count = Making Your Dreams Count
The good news is that I became successful in my trading career because I applied my mind to the task and learned the math I needed to. But I didn't do it because anyone told me I had to, or because my mind was focused on wealth (but that helped).I did so because I found out how fascinating some areas of math were to me.It was like I was solving a mystery every day that actually made me feel smart, accomplished, and going places. And a lot of it was just plain fun.Now I want to help millions of kids all across the globe to find their curiosity and passion for math ideas and tools. I'm not talking about making kids fall in love with numbers and fancy equations.I'm talking about creating a spark where they didn't know one existed and using that inspiration to be fascinated by life's mysteries, to build a great education and career -- or start their own business -- and basically to achieve any goal they desire.Math can be a tool, an adventure, or a bridge. I want to help kids find out what it could be for them!

Secret Perk: MathChat Hangout!As a psychology and philosophy student in college (and largely self-taught in those areas after I left college), I always wanted to teach and inspire young minds to explore the world and become all they were capable of.In fact, I have been planning and dreaming for the past 25 years of ways I could become a highly-motivational and inspirational teacher for high school students. I've done it for adults in financial markets for 20 years and now it's time to do it for teens everywhere who just need a helping hand and a passionate boost.And I finally found a way to start...


How You Can Help Launch the "Math Is Alive!" Revolution in Just 3 Steps!Step #1: Look at the Perks and the multiple ways I designed for you to help launch the Math Is Alive! Revolution. I am raising $50,000 to publish the 1st edition of the "Math Is Alive!" Book and to start teaching The School course to thousands of kids.One of my gigantic goals is to give away 100,000 free copies of the 1st edition to families in need. And I will be arranging special discounts for The School to those families as well. As you can tell, this campaign is just the start. Once we're rolling, I will be winning corporate sponsorships for the Math Is Alive! Revolution.Step #2: Pick a Perk that speaks most to you! I want you to feel like a part of the Math Is Alive! Revolution and to know that your contribution will be the spark to make a difference for potentially millions of kids.Step #3: Cheer Me On as I finish writing the book and get ready to launch the Revolution. Shouting out to your social networks and linking to our Facebook page will be wonderfully appreciated because for me to complete phase one of this mission, the $25,000 mark is the minimum needed as I put The Revolution on a firm foundation to create and publish The Book and teach The School course.

What's the money for?
I had a website being built, but the project was derailed (hired wrong person) and I had to launch anyway without one. That money is gone and I know I need a professional website to give the book maximum reach and impact, like getting media interviews and hosting my articles on math education and Deep Team Culture, my consulting work which will help pay the way. Here are my top costs right now...

1) Professional Website and Database Support Functions
2) Book Publication Strategy (design, layout, printing, etc.)
3) Video Production for Dozens of Online Math Lessons
4) PR/Media Campaign and Speaking Tour
5) Marketing and Social Media Campaign
6) Co-Working Space
7) Freelance Assistance/Interns
8) Business and Legal Advice/Services
9) Book Distribution Logistics

The Impact

 I built a successful career in finance without a college degree and I didn't start until I was 29. What I lacked in math skills I made up for in dreams and tenacity and curiosity. I simply love to learn and discover new ideas about our brains and how we learn. Imagine what we can accomplish as I launch this dream to teach kids around the world about their own curiosity and tenacity for math and science... 
Millions of kids discovering their own uses and passion for math and science! More of those kids going to college and succeeding in pursuit of their goals! And some of those kids going on to inspire others as teachers themselves! 
  
Other Ways You Can Help

 Can't make a financial contribution right now? No problem. 
Can you help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign on Facebook and all the other cool sharing networks where people listen to you? And be sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools which make it easy! 
 Thank you for taking the time to learn about the Math Is Alive! Revolution.Sincerely,Kevin B. Cook

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Nepal was hit with a devastating earthquake (7.9) magnitude. Over 1000 are dead, and many more suspected to be trapped and injured. The country does not have the resources or infrastructure to respond to the disaster. I want to contribute, but know that disaster relief funds have a history of being mismanaged. I want to collect funding and make sure it goes to organizations that will utilize the funding effectively, appropriately, and transparently. 

Once the RedCross has a fund specifically for Nepal I will direct the funds there, and share information regarding other reputable organizations. 

Image Omar Havana / Getty Images

story:
>>>-----------------------------------------Update!------------------------------------------->>>>

Get our EXCLUSIVE ARTISTIC APPARELS that can only be found here for a limited time!! Look for the "URBAN SPECIAL APPARELS" perks for details.

     

                                           "SAVE THE BEST FOR LAST!!" 


First of all, thank you for considering  us! 

Coming soon Universal Production Studio upcoming curriculum’s to engage students in enhancing their passion for designing, marketing, promoting and advertising.  Universal Production Studio is the Think Tank "THE BRAIN" the research, survey projection, designing, marketing, promoting and commercial advertising  and the operations of   the program. Our aim is to foster and support the future of our young adults.  Universal Production Studio will give them a sense of pride in knowing our environment will inspire them and help build 

positive work behaviors including such things as volunteering for extra work, being courteous, time management skills and to bring them to greater organizational citizenship behaviors. 

A supportive workplace should be more attractive and involving. It is anticipated that workers will be less likely to withdraw when support is high. Previous conceptual and empirical work has demonstrated that the construct of withdrawal is a broad one.



We are developing an exhibit for Universal Production Studio  as of a large-scale museum space installation, center and corporate display.  Our professional historians will research information we need and pull all the elements together to tell an interesting and authoritative story.  The museum’s vibrant exhibits will explore the impact of individuals whose beliefs and values have contributed to the unique legacy of our concept.  This will be combined with our every day professional business operations in conjunction with designing, marketing, promoting and advertising.  

When it comes to our three tier team of  precision innovators working with our students they will astound you through the operations network let's take a look. 

This leads us to immerse into boundless opportunities to the masses! A phenomenal unprecedented achievement for our students.

Whether you are visiting or taking courses in Universal Production studio establishment  you will be able to experience our creative knowledge studio exhibit. Learn how we got our start and where we are going in the future with our design concepts. The creative use of our pictures and videos will capture your vivid imagination and will create a lasting impression.

Become a donor or a volunteer help us build the progression of  this project as it evolves. Take a look at this and I'm sure you will be willing to stay connected to something that drives your passion. You'll see why your  contribution is important  to the development of this fantastic  project.

 

Combined with traditional instruction the use of computers and technology can increase student learning in the traditional curriculum and basic skills area. The integration of computers with traditional instruction produces higher academic achievement in a variety of subject areas than does traditional instruction alone.

Students learn more quickly and with greater retention when learning with the aid of computers and other technology. Students like learning with computers and their attitudes towards learning and school are positively affected by computer use. The use of computers appears most promising for low achieving and at-risk students.  Effective and adequate teacher training is an integral element of     successful learning programs based or assisted by technology.




To build this studio from the ground up we need $350,000.  We recognize this is a significant amount but we are determined to reach our goal. We are excited about building something that is uniquely designed FULLY equipped with high tech digital State-of the-Art equipment and  electronics such as cameras, microphones, audio mixers, monitors, recorders, laptops, computers, CINTIQ pen-on-screen drawing, printers and other technology for the future of our students. 

 We will start by advancing ourselves as technology advances itself in the years to come in knowing and understanding it’s function.  We  are stepping out on faith and we would like your help in completing this wonderful project. Your donations will support, train and connect passionate teachers and engage families and communities to help  young adults with the skills they need to succeed in life!

By contributing you are joining an amazing team of compassionate and inspiring individuals who are making breakthroughs with tremendous outcomes in the communities soon the world. Our project is out of the ordinary, unique and  can reach the masses.  With your help we can conquer great concerns in our communities.  We are helping people to help themselves we want to make what seems impossible possible.


Here at Universal Production Studio we have a concern for our communities.  We want to offer our communities accessibility to all of our technology that's available this will allow all of us the opportunity to grow together.  Research reviews have generally concurred that when combined with traditional instruction, the use of computers  and technology can increase our learning in the traditional curriculum and basic skills area. The integration of computers with traditional instruction produces higher academic achievement in a variety of subject areas than does traditional instruction alone. We all learn more quickly and with greater retention when learning with the aid of computers  and technology. 




Keeping you posted on YouTube with the update's on our progress from the time we launch this fundraiser.  We have a awesome venture we would like to  keep you informed about.  Look for us at Building Universal Production Studio.  We will be hosting all of our progress doing the duration of this 60 day campaign and beyond. 

Topics on: 

THE FIRST WEEK:

. Learn more about Universal Production Studio, Universal Center for Development,  Universal Cabinet Designs and not least, how we play apart in the  communities. 

. What these three entities mean to each other and for the development of your career. 

SECOND WEEK:

. See why your  contributions are important  to the development of this fantastic  project.

. Listen why you should be a donor, volunteer or member.  

THIRD WEEK:

. Listen how you can be apart of the progression of this project as it evolves.

. Learn about our passion for education and being creative with it. 

 FOURTH WEEK:
. Coming up for young adults and kids!!

 Hear about the Power Word  Phrase Competition it's going to be on and popping!   …………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………. 

FIFTH WEEK:

. We are making a special offer to the first five people who refer and make the most contributions to our website Building Universal Production Studio will receive a special gift.  See and hear about the final winners right here. So tell your family, friends, neighbors and co-workers, Tell EVERYBODY ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN WINNERS!  See it right here on YouTube @ Building Universal Production Studio!! 

SIX WEEK:

.  Hear about the ( 9 ) phase campaign, IT'S COMING SOON!

SEVENTH WEEK:

. Hear about the State to State, from College to College, the Big Graphic/ Sketch and Animation Competition !!!  

EIGHTH WEEK:

. Find out about the R &B,  Rap and Hip Hop Music Trend. 


 





What if Universal Production Studio/ Exhibit doesn't meet it's goal?  It would be most devastating but not the end we know this because we are very confident that we will reach our goal knowing  that your expectations are high and ours are indeed even higher.  Seeing and believing in such a worthy cause will lead us not only with this project but many others in the future.  There’s so much to be thankful for, let’s get this accomplished together!!




 The use of computers and technology appears most promising for low achieving and at-risk students.  Effective and adequate teacher training is an integral element of successful learning programs based or assisted by technology. Our goal is to assist people in acquiring marketable skills.  Universal Production Studio will be here to help them accomplish their dreams for survival in a technological society.  


We want to help students to become extremely marketable in moving into their careers of choice.  It is our faith and action that will provide them with the necessities for their creative imaginations that unlock the doors to their passion for designing, marketing, promoting and advertising.


This venture is unlike any other it will offer students the thrill of being a part of a new futuristic invention of artistic expression.  Universal Production Studio will become the iconic face of the music industry along with Hotels, Motels, High Schools and Colleges. Projections exceed our expectations for development for today and the future.  The students will use their creativity, imagination and artistic expression to aide in the development of this project.


              EXTRA, EXTRA READ ALL ABOUT IT! A PROJECT THAT WILL BE                            DONE BY STUDENTS AT UNIVERSAL PRODUCTION STUDIO!! 

Please note that we were able to let our readers know of these designs works of art before the rest of the world. Whether you own one of our very innovative concept works of art or building a collection of these rare art work beauties, you will want at least three.  Those who view your art work designs will realize they are more than a possession – It’s a passion of art!  

The time is here the setting is right to bring our unique trend and balanced combination of Universal Production Studio art work concept. True designs can be defined very differently depending on who you talk to. These cabinet designs do more than change the way your equipment and electronics look each and every part is created to fit the need of both the equipment and owner.

This year we are introducing the first ever art work concept designs we call                 " My Art " as proof we are showcasing our five favorite art work concepts. The reason we can achieve such fantastic results is that we have been able to revise all of our design concepts. Every detail bears the stamp of our trademark brand in innovation, resulting in the first sleek aerodynamic cabinet designs works of art of their kind to employ the first fully design and manufactured prototype.  Projections; our contemporary and decorative art designs, are exceeding 400 with more on the design table to come.   Every crafted design is a masterpiece to suit your decor and personal style.



       Today, I have Steve Jobs to thank for saving my life!

Many years ago in fact, 2004 I saw an advertisement about an Apple product that would read to me.  Due to my disability, I had years of not comprehending what people say or understanding what I read.  I heard about this product and knew this was what I needed. You see, I had a vision of making futuristic cabinets, and knew that this product would definitely save my life.

 I became passionate about my project and my Apple Computer. I bought the Talking Apple Computer and personally taught myself on how to use it. I am a perfectionist for wanting to learn every aspect in getting every detail right.  His product being so innovative, it helped me in all the right ways.  I sacrificed in waiting many years for this opportunity in sticking with it come hell or high water, I  am preparing to launch my project in appreciation for Apple's innovative products.

Having so much respect for my passion that I am willing to admit that I may have been a little bit fanatical, even over-the-top, but thanks to God and  Mr. Steve Jobs, and to all who I will never forget in making this all possible for me!  With your support I will be ready to launch this project next!

I must say my disability has it time of getting in my way but I won't let that get me down. For me, it's been my life in looking for people like you'll in helping me along the way. I am now 57 years old and my birthday is Nov. 3rd.  I started this  venture for my life purpose of being successful to see myself as someone special back in 1978. I do have all of my documents and papers to show I did start then. It is my wish to put all of my documents  on display for all to see here at Universal Production Studio/exhibit. I feel it will inspire others along the way through their journey for success.  So I thank you all for being here for me  in making this possible!  If there is to be success  for me Indiegogo is the key  .




These new cabinet designs extract the essence of futurism and modernism at the same time representing designs that support Apple product lines.  With its new popular innovation from Universal Cabinet Designs. These entrainment centers will change the way we interact with electronics and stereo equipment. “YOU NEED TO EXPERIENCE IT!” The first example of a new concept we call “My Art” It takes full advantage of multi-Touch technology all over it!




We plan to share the good news throughout social media to those individuals willing to support us in our endeavors for this fundraiser and will be acknowledged.  We are looking forward to the opening date of Universal Production Studio. The 21st Century is sure to bring more innovation and new technology thus, Universal Production Studio would like to provide our students and communities with the communication of products and production services that will connect them to what’s coming and what’s important in their lives.  Your donation to support us is greatly appreciated.  All training provided to our students is free!  Your donation today can ensure our students receive the support they will need to grow and become great citizens of our communities.  All donations will be acknowledged.


Tell your family, friends, neighbors, co-workers, random strangers - Tell EVERYBODY ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN!  Tell them we can do this!! Do it for your communities.  Send them the link to indiegogo.com donate or share, post, comment, tweet, repost, like and re-tweet as much as possible!   Please make your pledge today!  Every bit of support counts! 



We can never say enough good things about our supporters.  You are the reason why we exist and we are constantly working  hard to meet the needs for this campaign.  To show your appreciation, in conjunction with this indiegogo.com account share our campaign with your family and friends using the Facebook or Twitter buttons on our homepage!  We are making a special offer to the first five people who refer and make the most contributions to our website building universal production studio will receive a special gift.  Only the top five will know what the gift is your support shall be acknowledged. So hurry offer ends soon!!

With Great Appreciation,

Steven Willis

CEO and Founder

>>>-----------------------------------------Update!------------------------------------------->>>>Get our EXCLUSIVE ARTISTIC APPARELS that can only be found here for a limited time!! Look for the "URBAN SPECIAL APPARELS" perks for details.                                                "SAVE THE BEST FOR LAST!!" 
First of all, thank you for considering  us! Coming soon Universal Production Studio upcoming curriculum’s to engage students in enhancing their passion for designing, marketing, promoting and advertising.  Universal Production Studio is the Think Tank "THE BRAIN" the research, survey projection, designing, marketing, promoting and commercial advertising  and the operations of   the program. Our aim is to foster and support the future of our young adults.  Universal Production Studio will give them a sense of pride in knowing our environment will inspire them and help build positive work behaviors including such things as volunteering for extra work, being courteous, time management skills and to bring them to greater organizational citizenship behaviors. 




A supportive workplace should be more attractive and involving. It is anticipated that workers will be less likely to withdraw when support is high. Previous conceptual and empirical work has demonstrated that the construct of withdrawal is a broad one.





We are developing an exhibit for Universal Production Studio  as of a large-scale museum space installation, center and corporate display.  Our professional historians will research information we need and pull all the elements together to tell an interesting and authoritative story.  The museum’s vibrant exhibits will explore the impact of individuals whose beliefs and values have contributed to the unique legacy of our concept.  This will be combined with our every day professional business operations in conjunction with designing, marketing, promoting and advertising.  
When it comes to our three tier team of  precision innovators working with our students they will astound you through the operations network let's take a look. 


This leads us to immerse into boundless opportunities to the masses! A phenomenal unprecedented achievement for our students.
Whether you are visiting or taking courses in Universal Production studio establishment  you will be able to experience our creative knowledge studio exhibit. Learn how we got our start and where we are going in the future with our design concepts. The creative use of our pictures and videos will capture your vivid imagination and will create a lasting impression.
Become a donor or a volunteer help us build the progression of  this project as it evolves. Take a look at this and I'm sure you will be willing to stay connected to something that drives your passion. You'll see why your  contribution is important  to the development of this fantastic  project.
 


Combined with traditional instruction the use of computers and technology can increase student learning in the traditional curriculum and basic skills area. The integration of computers with traditional instruction produces higher academic achievement in a variety of subject areas than does traditional instruction alone.
Students learn more quickly and with greater retention when learning with the aid of computers and other technology. Students like learning with computers and their attitudes towards learning and school are positively affected by computer use. The use of computers appears most promising for low achieving and at-risk students.  Effective and adequate teacher training is an integral element of     successful learning programs based or assisted by technology.






To build this studio from the ground up we need $350,000.  We recognize this is a significant amount but we are determined to reach our goal. We are excited about building something that is uniquely designed FULLY equipped with high tech digital State-of the-Art equipment and  electronics such as cameras, microphones, audio mixers, monitors, recorders, laptops, computers, CINTIQ pen-on-screen drawing, printers and other technology for the future of our students. 
 We will start by advancing ourselves as technology advances itself in the years to come in knowing and understanding it’s function.  We  are stepping out on faith and we would like your help in completing this wonderful project. Your donations will support, train and connect passionate teachers and engage families and communities to help  young adults with the skills they need to succeed in life!




By contributing you are joining an amazing team of compassionate and inspiring individuals who are making breakthroughs with tremendous outcomes in the communities soon the world. Our project is out of the ordinary, unique and  can reach the masses.  With your help we can conquer great concerns in our communities.  We are helping people to help themselves we want to make what seems impossible possible.






Here at Universal Production Studio we have a concern for our communities.  We want to offer our communities accessibility to all of our technology that's available this will allow all of us the opportunity to grow together.  Research reviews have generally concurred that when combined with traditional instruction, the use of computers  and technology can increase our learning in the traditional curriculum and basic skills area. The integration of computers with traditional instruction produces higher academic achievement in a variety of subject areas than does traditional instruction alone. We all learn more quickly and with greater retention when learning with the aid of computers  and technology. 








Keeping you posted on YouTube with the update's on our progress from the time we launch this fundraiser.  We have a awesome venture we would like to  keep you informed about.  Look for us at Building Universal Production Studio.  We will be hosting all of our progress doing the duration of this 60 day campaign and beyond. 
Topics on: 
THE FIRST WEEK:
. Learn more about Universal Production Studio, Universal Center for Development,  Universal Cabinet Designs and not least, how we play apart in the  communities. 
. What these three entities mean to each other and for the development of your career. 
SECOND WEEK:
. See why your  contributions are important  to the development of this fantastic  project.
. Listen why you should be a donor, volunteer or member.  
THIRD WEEK:
. Listen how you can be apart of the progression of this project as it evolves.
. Learn about our passion for education and being creative with it. 
 FOURTH WEEK:
. Coming up for young adults and kids!! Hear about the Power Word  Phrase Competition it's going to be on and popping!   …………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………. 
FIFTH WEEK:
. We are making a special offer to the first five people who refer and make the most contributions to our website Building Universal Production Studio will receive a special gift.  See and hear about the final winners right here. So tell your family, friends, neighbors and co-workers, Tell EVERYBODY ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN WINNERS!  See it right here on YouTube @ Building Universal Production Studio!! 
SIX WEEK:
.  Hear about the ( 9 ) phase campaign, IT'S COMING SOON!
SEVENTH WEEK:
. Hear about the State to State, from College to College, the Big Graphic/ Sketch and Animation Competition !!!  
EIGHTH WEEK:
. Find out about the R &B,  Rap and Hip Hop Music Trend. 



 









What if Universal Production Studio/ Exhibit doesn't meet it's goal?  It would be most devastating but not the end we know this because we are very confident that we will reach our goal knowing  that your expectations are high and ours are indeed even higher.  Seeing and believing in such a worthy cause will lead us not only with this project but many others in the future.  There’s so much to be thankful for, let’s get this accomplished together!!

This venture is unlike any other it will offer students the thrill of being a part of a new futuristic invention of artistic expression.  Universal Production Studio will become the iconic face of the music industry along with Hotels, Motels, High Schools and Colleges. story:
UPCOMING PRODUCT

 

SUMMARY

COVID wreaked havoc on our world and society needs community now more than ever. For the first time in history, we can truly connect, as an entire Global Network, and build.

We have an urgent opportunity to transform education and unlock the future we want. .

 

WHY WE MUST EXIST

Our Primary Mission is to provide a Space of comfortability, accessibility, and safety  for the modern performing arts member; at any stage. 

Our Secondary Mission is to directly provide equipment, resources, and regionally specific education to all corners of the world, to allow every student that shows an interest in learning to spin, flow, drill, twirl, or whatever their artistic, even if they need some type of support along the way.

 

We offer a cheap, high-quality, and on-demand experience for those not looking to set their creative paths in stone; as well as premium services with a more hands-on, mentorship-like approach for those looking to become professionals in their craft.

The “PAGE”  Network provides: 

  • a smaller learning curve
    (go from 0 - 100 in a month, not a season)
     
  • faster learning speeds and more convenience
    (learn at your own pace; always)
     
  • consistent training opportunities day to day
    (access to the  Livestream Calendar to jump in on daily sessions)
     
  • a positive community to support your growth at any level
    (hundreds of eager educators and instructors waiting to help you)

 

WHAT'S OUR INITIAL COST

To do this, we need a runway coming in from donations, investments, and partnerships as we startup fast along our path! The PAGE Network offers a compellingly fast, easy, safe, and fiscally responsible solution:

  • We rely on a cheap, but easily accessible monthly membership fee and offer an Open Learning Environment. Open learning is proven to help democratize education, by making it more affordable, accessible, and attainable to students, no matter their location or income level. It also helps students explore new industries before investing in an often costly, more formal education.
     
  • Because we are a for-profit company, we are able to scout and hire elite, diverse educators to produce an arts based curriculum focused on various learning styles.
     
  • Our Network Mentorships are instant, cheap, and completely revolutionizes the way you are able to communicate with your mentor. Offering quick access to video chats, consultations, and any advice you'd need; always.
     
  • You never have to learn on your own again, but you still always have the choice. The Network offers a 24/7 Global Chat, allowing you to consistently make sure that you are learning in a safe, healthy, and valuable way.

 

THE SOCIAL MEDIA IMPACT

TIKTOK INCREASE

28 DAY ANALYSIS

Metrics tracked over 28 days from April 23rd to May 20th
(TIKTOK)

  • video views (+127.67% increase)
  • profile views (+256.26% increase)
  • likes (+22.35% increase)
  • comments (+123.56% increase)
  • shares (+93.83% increase)

 

The massive social ROI can help boost an advertising, merchandising, or social media campaign by over 125% on average.

Our Instagram campaign is launching on June 14th, 2021, followed by a Facebook and Twitter campaign launching on July 1st, 2021.

 

THEORIZED IMPACT ON ADHD

Societal Non-Awareness Fix



An overwhelming amount of data showed that “...athletes with ADHD were twice as likely (200%) to compete in team sports…” — we can see an overwhelming amount of Neurodiverse Performers & Partners Onboarding into the PAGE Networking System.

A GREAT READ ON CREATING ACCESSIBLE WORKPLACES

A QUICK READ ON HOW IBM CELEBRATES AUTISM IN THEIR WORKLPLACE

Thinking of neurodiversity as something that may connect one another intrinsically, we see an amazing opportunity to craft one of these virtual neighborhoods to offer that team support 24/7. This statement from Gensler's Research on Rebuilding Community in the Post-Pandemic World perfectly sums up why it's so important now, more than ever, to find a community:

"If we translate this desire for collaboration and person-to-person connection into
types of space, we can see the shape of a hybrid community. Consider the “front porch,” a new feature of the Open Learning neighborhood, where members greet each other in-
person and connect with remote members via virtual dashboards. They hang out and virtually chat with people sitting at home, and feel connected to a sense of purpose and
community that extends well beyond the physical group."

 

The Performing Arts Communities are perfectly setup to offer this Open Learning Neighborhood
(OLN).


The PAGE Network...


• provides a flourishing, positive community.
• teaches social comfortability skills.
• teaches self-love and positivity.
• gives a consistent educational outreach.
• provides a creative opportunity for mentorships.
• offers innovative performance opportunities.
• gives inspiration, motivation, and support.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Right now, the biggest risks at play are personnel consistency and general outreach momentum. Organizationally, a massive networking company based in independent contracts, needs an extremely sturdy, consistent base of Creators. Because we're building an intrinsic system to fit into the lifestyles of those reached out to, we now have an organic web of time, schedules, contracts and onboarding to fuel into our August Employment plans and continue funneling equipment into the community with YOUR contributions.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Joining any of the membership opportunities, sharing on social media, or spreading awareness are all ways to help.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
