story:
WHO SHOULD USE THIS BOOK

Who are we? What do we live for? How should we live?

Currently, our environment is becoming destroyed and losses of the beauty of its nature. Every day, lots of bottles, cans are thrown away outside without recycling. Hence, this book includes all methods to recycle used things.

What will this book be used for? First, it can be used for building habit of recycling in families and organizations. However, what makes this book special is the way to make old relationships seemed to be forgotten reborn.

  • Teaching children know how to create recycled things

It focuses on helping children know how to recycle used things and educate them as well. The awareness of children is affected by you - their parents. Therefore, you should teach them to be respectful to tools, furniture in the house and raise awareness of protecting environment.

Inculcating children with habits of recycling used things at small age is the best way to protect environment. It is a good way for parents to nurture positive thinking in children’s mind.

  • Building recycle culture in schools, offices, companies or organizations

You are a director, a boss who always want to keep the company clean and reduce the amount of money spent on unnecessary things. If so, why don’t you set up recycle culture in order to protect environment in your organization? After each working day, lots of things are put in the dustbin while they can still be used for other purposes in the working place. Staffs can use it to make many recycled things they want such as pen box, flower vase... This book will instruct you to make recycled things like that and people can give these crafts as presents for each other. 

Making old relationships reborn

  • Siblings

For how long have you not seen your sibling? Time makes the distance and relationship be farther and farther between you and him/her. What did two of you often do during your childhood? It is so interesting when you and (s)he gather together in one hour or more to make something like crafts in the past, enjoy the time and feel excited. In this book, you can find many other fantastic recycled things to do with your sibling. So, why not give it a try?

  • Close friends

You can not only use this book to teach their children but also share it with other parents as a good educational method. Especially in gatherings of parents when you meet and talks about their family and jobs, you can share their recycle experience with each other. This book contains various types of recycled things which are quite easy for children to create under their parents’ instruction.

This book will be a chance for you to improve your relationships and a useful guide to recycling things and protect our environment.


WHY DO I WRITE THIS BOOK

When I was a child, I had an interesting dream in which I was a bottle. People bought me from supermarket and brought me to their home. They used me all the time during the day. When I was empty, I was thrown away to roadsides, not even into dustbins. A person came across me and kicked me to the middle of the road. Every day, lots of people passed me with no thinking, no emotion. It seemed to me that they didn’t take any notice of my existence. At night, it rained heavily, I felt so alone, so cold because there was no one around me. Maybe I was born for being filled with liquids and was thrown away like that, I couldn’t suffer for that. I desired to dedicate for human with many usages such as a flower vase, a pen box or other decorations which I would be actually useful.

When I woke up, I thought that all inanimate things in houses had their own souls. I had an idea: What if I helped those inanimate things reborn into different shapes? Immediately, I put thought into actions. From that day, I have made many beautiful, useful and respectful toys, tools or decorations in my house. Now I have two children, I always teach them be respectful for tools in our house. Every weekend, I take used things and teach them know how to recycle, they are excited about. Gradually, my children create a lot of decorations in house from used things. I think that people should be aware of protecting the environment and having habits of using recycled things. I decide to write this book aiming to bring all recycled things to people in my country and other countries in the world so that they can make by themselves and teach their children. If so, our environment will be green, clean and healthy.
BOOK COVER 

Materials


Page design

"REBORN THE TRASH" ON INDIEGOGO

This is where YOU join us! We won't be able to manufacture this book without your support! Producing perfect products comes with a large upfront investment, we've come to Indiegogo to raise the necessary funds to produce the tooling and minimum order quantities for the first Reborn the trash.

We want to thank each and every one of you for checking out our project, for contributing, and spreading the possibilities! Follow Us & Track Our Progress!

For more information contact info@nrober.com

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges and unforeseen obstacles that arise when trying to bring a product to life. There are so many moving parts that must be managed. However with a strong production and logistics system, we can confidently say that we are experienced in this process to mitigate the risks that arise in this process. We will work hard to ensure that we deliver what we promise and to go the extra mile whenever it is possible. Thanks for believing in us!

story:
My Story and Inspiration

I am Abhishek Kaushik, an 18-year-old aspiring entrepreneur currently doing my BTech in Computer Science Engineering from Silicon Institute of Technology, Bhubaneswar. I have always had the urge to do something different and create a positive impact on the society around me, and hence I started my first startup MeteOut when I was in my 11th Standard. MeteOut acted as a scrap-dealer aggregator, in which citizens could sit at home and book scrap dealers to visit your home, I coded the app for it within 60 days by learning Android Development. The app also had a special feature to donate books and other useful items to orphanages. This was indeed where my journey began and till now it has been full of ups & downs.

Back in 2017, I was selected for DexSchool of Leadership & Entrepreneurship, where I along with 49 other best minds of the country worked & learned together under the guidance of Sharad Vivek Sagar, a Forbes-listed 30 under 30 CEO. This experience infilled in me deep love for entrepreneurship.

Coming back from Dex, I along with 5 other friends of mine started an organization called Quizzard which conducted quizzes for the students of Cuttack, Odisha. We conducted our first ever successful event called “Synapse-The Junction of Qriosity”. We started this with an aim to solve the problem of declining opportunities & exposure which the students of Cuttack city aren’t getting.

Within a few months, I got selected for Young India Challenge 9th Edition, Mumbai, where I worked in a team along with other members to solve a UN-listed Sustainable Development Goal. We worked towards finding a solution to providing Quality Education.

 

With an aim to build a startup which solves a problem, I want to give back to the community.Currently, I am helping a close friend of mine in his startup-Woomie, which is a hostel aggregator. Some of my inspirations are Mark Cuban-for his utmost dedication and hard work, Bill Gates-for his dedication to affect the lives of billions of people through Microsoft as well as other philanthropic activities, Steve Jobs-for his extreme passion and attention to detail.  All of these great men have worked hard and brought change around them, and I believe each one of us has the ability to bring a change in the world around us. We just need to ask ourselves -"If not YOU, Who? If not NOW, When?"

About Draper University

I applied for Draper University in January and after essay and Skype round, I got selected for the program with a 20% scholarship. Draper University was founded by venture capitalist Tim Draper.The program is known as Hero Training Summer program, which is of 5 weeks. At Draper University, we will go from an idea to a product ready to pitch to 80+ venture capital investors as we learn from top-tier venture capitalists and entrepreneurs. Past speakers include Elon Musk (Tesla), Aaron Levie (Box), and Tony Hsieh (Zappos). There are about 580+ alumni who have launched their own startups, raised $51.4M+ in total, and have sold their companies for multiple millions and have been featured in Forbes 30 under 30. 

 

A typical day at Draper University:

How I will benefit from the program

This 5-week long program in the heart of Silicon Valley will empower me with the right tools, skills & network to help me strengthen my skills as an entrepreneur and be prepared to face the tough world of startups. However since startups are not about theory & rather more upon practicals(i.e. getting my hands dirty by starting a venture), this program also conducts workshops.

This program offers the necessary and important training along with the right tools and resources to an aspiring entrepreneur to venture upon a high impact entrepreneurial journey. Their course takes a student, right from ideation stage to pitching stage. Their past speakers include some eminent industry experts technologists, founders, innovators, etc.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I would require your help in order to attend this awesome program.

Fees breakdown:

Tuition: $12000
Travel: $1500
Living Expenses: $1000
Scholarship: $2500
Amount to be raised: $ 12000

I am hopeful that with your support, I would be able to reach my goal, however, if I don’t, all the funds would be used to fund my tuition and travel to participate in Draper University.

The Impact

I am on a mission to give back to the society for whatever I have gained from it. Over these few years, I have realized that the society needs more contributors now than ever before. Contribution doesn’t always mean charity or helping distribute food packets among the beggars. Bill Gates created Windows OS which is currently being used by millions of people across the globe. Elon Musk created Tesla which has disrupted the electric car industry and hence leading closer to pollution free world. I want to be one of them, I want to contribute to the society with my startup and YOU can help me in my mission. Whether I am able to or not able to fund my expenses and attend Draper’s University is not a factor which is going to affect my dedication and determination to contribute to the society. The program will help me get the skills and right set of tools to help me in my mission. But you can certainly help a young teenager by supporting him in his mission.

A big thank you for your support

Thanks for coming down this far with me. Well, if you can’t contribute financially at this point of time, but believe in my mission, you can still contribute by helping me get the word out. Afterall-“Nothing influences people, more than a recommendation from a trusted friend”

story:
About TeslaTech

TeslaTech is a publisher of extreme science, alternative energy, health and medicine with a particular emphasis on Tesla Technology. Our latest magazine, ExtraOrdinary Science & Technology  contains articles on a wide range of topics which tend to stick to hard science and experimental research. Our efforts are primarily directed to the independent researchers and inventor as there is a need for them to have a credible platform to publish their findings.

Every August we have a conference in Albuquerque, NM. You don't need a degree to have an idea to change the world. The problem is that if you are not a part of the professional or academic world there isn't a good way to introduce the concept to the world... and while the internet showed promise, it quickly degenerated into a quagmire of fraud, deceit, and meritless claims. Furthermore, the explosion of the InterNet has inadvertently isolated independent researchers in an ocean of white noise data. Our magazine and conference provides a great opportunity for inventors to actually meet real people and make some friends who share eclectic interests. 

Hardware… NOT hot air!  This conference is focused on sifting hardware from hot air! We place a premium on experimental science and prototypes. While there a lot of great demos on  the InterNet, they can be misleading... and visitations can get expensive. However, these conferences provide for a demonstrations before a live audience!  Steve Elswick, our publisher, has been putting together Tesla and ExtraOrdinary Technology conferences for over 30 years as the most cost efficient way of determining the BS factor inherent in many of these inventions. 

Building the Future...  The conference inspires the mind, reinforces friendships, and allows everyone an opportunity to have a great time!  Our 'Teens are FREE!' program is intended to get students involved in critical thinking at a young age. My personal interest in science and technology was inspired by visits to places like the Chicago Museum of Science & Industry. Watching stuff on computers is one thing... but being able to actually handle real equipment brings it to life... and becomes the difference between believing and knowing!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $25000  to provide operating capital which will help us to

  • promote the conference
  • offset direct conference expenses
  • print the magazine in a timely fashion
  • upgrade our facilities/equipment and
  • implement an online membership site which will feature about 2000 conference videos.  

All  gifts and funds received will be designated as operating capital and will be utilized to achieve the goals as laid out above. Every little bit helps.

The Impact

The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter – for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way. __ Nikola Tesla 

This quote by Tesla is our creed! The focus of our efforts here is to lay the foundation for the future. Many of the ideas and concepts that are the hot ideas today were ridiculed just a few short years ago... but kept alive through the perseverance of independent thinkers and garage inventors. Our magazine and conference provide an avenue for these ideas to gain public awareness and ultimately the academic and/or corporate world. Furthermore, our events provide  a venue where inventor,  researchers,  investors, students and others can meet and learn from each other.

Your participation will help expand the scope and awareness of our operation. With every person we reach directly, I believe that our information is passed on to 2 or more. Our problem in the past is that the severe austerity we function under, prevents timely mailing of our program. Your early participation will help us get the program mailed early this year... our target is early February. Past experience indicates that this could double the attendance!

I know there are a million reasons not to come this year. However, I encourage you to cast your misgivings to the wind and take the plunge. No one is getting younger... and while it takes some effort to attend conferences, it is worth the endeavor just to meet old friends... as they may not be around next year. For that matter, I, too, am in a spot where the road ahead is shorter than behind (barring some longevity miracle I run into at the conference)!

Risks & Challenges

Steve has conducted these type of  conferences  for over thirty years... and has been publishing magazines for just as long. During that time he has encountered just about every problem an organizer faces. However, persistence and the high quality of volunteers we attract, has given the wherewithal to survive and the incentive to organize the next. But... this is not enough to dramatically increase the size of our audience and the continued existence of a forum for experimentally based researchers. 

The shiny toys of the past few generations have been computers and programming. To excel in truly aspirational goals such as antigravity and utilization of zero point energy, we must encourage younger people to pursue Tesla-based research. For me, there is nothing to get me interested than handling real hardware!

You, too, can be part of the science of the Future simply by becoming a member, or attending a  conference. Bring a friend... if you have a teen around the house, take them to the conference!After all, teens get  free admission!

Visualize meeting some old friends for a great time... or perhaps visiting with a fellow researcher who has tons of information on your pet project... or even bump into a venture capitalist who is looking for new project to fund! Anything can happen at a Tesla Conference!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are a writer or researcher... you may wish to speak at our conference or get an article published.  Contact TeslaTech.info and we can send you information on our policies. 
  • Pass this information on to those who may be interested... you can use the tools provided to make it easier.
  • Volunteer! We can use advice and assistance in a wide variety of areas!
  • Keep us informed! Clue us in on obscure up and coming devices!

Thank you for your support!

Every time you purchase an item from us, you help us grow. We appreciate your support and never take it for granted. This year your support is particularly important as we are trying to develop an online membership site and update our current site.   If you are in a position to help sponsor some of our activities, please consider it and contact me at (520) 252-0374… or perhaps buy some DVDs!!!

The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter – for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way. __ Nikola Tesla

Visualize meeting some old friends for a great time... or perhaps visiting with a fellow researcher who has tons of information on your pet project... or even bump into a venture capitalist who is looking for new project to fund! Anything can happen at a Tesla Conference!

Other Ways You Can Help


If you are a writer or researcher... you may wish to speak at our conference or get an article published.  Contact TeslaTech.info and we can send you information on our policies. 

Pass this information on to those who may be interested... you can use the tools provided to make it easier.

Volunteer! We can use advice and assistance in a wide variety of areas!

Keep us informed! Clue us in on obscure up and coming devices!

Thank you for your support!Every time you purchase an item from us, you help us grow. We appreciate your support and never take it for granted. This year your support is particularly important as we are trying to develop an online membership site and update our current site.   If you are in a position to help sponsor some of our activities, please consider it and contact me at (520) 252-0374… or perhaps buy some DVDs!!!The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter – for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way. __ Nikola Tesla

story:
Short Summary

Corner Piece is a small ABA Therapy Company.  We were looking for a good set of language cards to buy but we just could't find anything that was cost effective or fit our needs.  After some research we decided to build our own set.  

We decided to see if other companies are looking for the same thing.

We are passionate about working with children and we feel like we can make a huge impact on their lives by supplying durable language cards at an affordable price.

What We Need & What You Get

Why do we need money?

  • Licensing fees, the largest expense is the cost of buying the licenses outright.
  • Printing and laminating the cards.
  • Designing and manufacturing the packaging.
What do you get?
Once our goal is met, we will begin the printing process. Everyone that contributes will get one or multiple sets based on the perk selected. Each language card set comes with a box of 1,002 cards, tabs with categories and a dry erase marker.

The Impact

There are a lot of different language cards on the market but we feel that our design, updated pictures, variety of pictures and cost is what sets ours above the rest.

Our set will come with a over 1000 cards (see sample pictures added).  All the cards are laminated for durability and this also gives the ability to write on the back and erase it, something most other cards are lacking.  

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge at this time is coming up with a package that is cost effective but at the same time professional and durable for use.  We have already decided on a printing company so we just need to finalize the quotes and finalize the turn around time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with your friends, colleagues, clients, and others.  We hope to reach our goal and we feel with your help we can!

story:
My name is Marty, and I do not claim to be a Christian. Regardless, since 2010 I have wanted to read the Bible in its entirety. I believe that as an American, gaining a personal understanding of the book that sits at the foundation of our country is important for thoughtful citizenship in our great country. To date I have not achieved my goal of reading the Bible, which is why I've launched this campaign to create a service that will help me and others like me overcome the obstacles that have stalled my progress.

Short Summary

The Cover-to-Cover service helps you and I achieve our personal goal of reading the entire Bible (or just the Old Testament or New Testament) in a single year. It addresses two main problems with self-guided reading plans:

  • Accountability. Humans stay more committed when they have skin in the game. Cover-to-Cover is a paid service that connects you with other similarly motivated individuals, creating social and financial incentives for you to finish the marathon.
  • Comprehension. If you're planning to read the entire Bible, chances are you also want understand what you're reading. On your own, you can scour the internet and hope you find good answers, but this tactic is hit-or-miss and creates fatigue. Cover-to-Cover provides a qualified, non-denominational guide to handle Q&A live on your year-long journey.

Mark Kwiatkowski will be your full-time guide for the program in 2017. Mark is a candidate in the Master of Theological Studies (MTS) program at Boston University. He brings not only a diversity of personal experiences but, more importantly, objectivity in presenting facts and opposing perspectives about the Bible.

What You Get & What We Need

The program starts on Monday, January 2, 2017, and it's simple.

  • Live, recorded GoToWebinar sessions Monday-Friday, online with your guide and other students.
  • If you miss one, you can catch up by listening to a recorded session, which will be uploaded to a private YouTube channel for all active students.
  • Each 45-minute session contains three segments: Read. Explain. Discuss.
  • Read. The guide will read the day's passages aloud.
  • Explain. The guide provides additional historical and cultural context around the day's passages.
  • Discuss. Ask your questions and get perspectives (not absolute answers) first from your guide and then from other students. A private online forum for students and the guide will be available to continue the conversation outside of scheduled sessions.

Sessions will be recorded and run daily at the following times (in Eastern Time):

  • 5:00pm Old Testament
  • 5:45pm New Testament
  • 9:00pm Old Testament
  • 9:45pm New Testament

If we meet our goal, Indiegogo will collect 8-10% and the remainder will be used to fund the full-time, salaried guide and to pay for operational costs like GoToWebinar. If the funding goal is not met, no funds will be collected. 

The Impact

The Bible is not something to take lightly, regardless of whether you are a Christian. And I believe to engage in intelligent, informed conversations on the subject of Christianity one should have at least read the Bible, cover-to-cover.

Risks & Challenges

Funding aside, there is no serious risk to successful delivery of the program. If you see any risks or concerns that we have not anticipated, please start a conversation on the Comments tab.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're this commitment is not for you, you just might know people in your network who would be interested. Please help by spreading the word (no pun intended)!

NOTE: Cover-to-Cover will run as one of the first JN1:5 operations.

story:
UMean is the “Uber-Fication” of human powered translation.

It is a time-efficient delivery of accurate human-powered translations through a mobile application platform, where reliable translators are outsourced to perform professional translations. Users can translate wherever they are.

All users need to do is to snap a photo of the document or upload either a Word document or an audio file they’d like to translate on the mobile app, and then wait for a translator to accept the translation request in a matter of minutes.

Once a translator accepts your request, his or her profile will appear, along with the reviews and rating given by previous customers.

If the user feels uneasy about using the translator's service, he or she can pass and wait for another translator.

The value proposition of our platform is our on-demand human-powered translation that we promise to deliver in near-real-time. Although we’re living in the 21st century and everything gets computerized and surrounded by robots, the territory of quality translations hasn’t yet been occupied by the technological progress. Translators can be equipped with machine translation tools to make the working process easier, but machines won’t replace people in this area. In the nearest future at least.

UMean believes in a human-powered, personal approach to translation. 

It seeks to provide a user-friendly and streamlined workflow for clients to engage translators faster and complete their translation requests in a fast and affordable manner.

A translation request of 300 words that is done in 5 minutes only costs you £5!

 

Salient Features of UMean

Although UMean is similar to other human-powered translation applications like Flitto and VerbalizeIt in many ways, it has distinguished itself and followed a strategy where it can disrupt other human-powered translation apps in any way possible. Here are few salient features of UMean’s model.

  • UMean promises to match customers who need a translation request to translators in a matter of 5 minutes. If the matching time exceeds 5 minutes, customers would only need to pay 50% of the fee originally quoted.
  • Input files for translations can be in the form of text, image, word document or audio file.
  • Competitive prices on the Standard plan: A word document of 1000 words would only cost 8 pounds to be translated within 2 hours, or 6 pounds to be translated within 12 hours.
  • Using on our algorithm to calculate the fee quote, UMean end-users can instantly see the total quoted translation fee based on word count or audio length & time given
  • Private 1-1 messenger communication with translator
  • A unique messenger chat interface that has a timed countdown, that is presented to both the translator and the customer. This ensures accountability on the translator’s side, so that the translator will be pressured to deliver on time. If the translator fails to deliver within the timed countdown, customer can choose to cancel request or only pay 50% of the fee for the request to be completed.
  • If the translator is able to deliver within the time given, he or she can upload the document to the chat interface, and subsequently end the chat session, where the user will be directed to the invoice page and be prompted to rate the translator out of 5 stars.
  • Payment procedure is handled by UMean itself from within the app.

UMean uses its technology platform to connect those in need of translation with a global community of human translators. We take on the burden of finding ad-hoc human translators in a matter of minutes, consequently allowing individuals and businesses to focus on their own goals, from producing the most effective business presentation in another language to asking for the best local gelato flavor in an Italian town.

All of this is done on our world-class translation platform.

4 Step model about how UMean works

 

Step 1 (Request a translation): The initial step in the business model of UMean is about requesting a translation. Anyone having a smartphone with the UMean app installed can simply request a ride almost instantly with the help of few taps. User has the option to choose from Standard or Pro, and there will be an instant quotation of how much it will cost, based on the word count and the amount of time given to the translator.

 

Step 2 (Matching): As soon as a request is made, a notification is sent to translators who are proficient in the languages requested by the end-user. Translators have the option to accept or hide a request. In order to get paid the full amount however, translators have to accept the request within 5 minutes or only receive a 30% cut in the payout for that request.

 

Step 3 (Chat & Translate): A timed chat-based interface presents both parties with a countdown timer at the top to signal how much time is left for the translator to deliver on time. It also allows the customer to talk to the translator to clarify any jargons present, if any. On the other side, once the translator has delivered the document, the countdown timer will pause at the time that the translation was delivered. The translator will not be able to end the chat session until he or she delivers the document.  

 

Step 4 (Payment & Rating): Customers can rate the quality of the translation once the chat session ends. Payment is automatically charged to the customer’s account when the translator ends the chat session.

Earn Money as a Translator

Translators who want to join UMean to perform translation services have very low barriers to entry.

All you have to do is to take a simple 10 multiple choice timed quiz (similar to the SAT Language tests) for the respective language that you wish to assist in translation, and get at least 8 out of 10 in order to successfully pass the assessment and become an offical UMean translator!

We have various benefits for you as a translator:

  • Get paid 1 pound for every hour you are online. (Must accept at least 1 translation request in that hour)
  • Instant gratification through reassuring payout procedure: Able to cash-out from the account on UMean immediately (unlike Flitto where points come in the form of promotional vouchers)
  • Gets to keep 80% of the amount charged to the customer’s account.
  • Additional source of income / pocket money for students.
  • Flexible working schedules. Can work part-time or simply whenever they like.

story:
ENGLISH VERSION :                   (version française plus bas)

My name is Adrien, but I couldn't count how many times I've been called "the American guy" : here, in Grenoble, France, all of my friends and relatives know about my dream. For years, since I was around 8 years old, I've been strongly attracted to the USA : I was still in primary school when I started learning English, saying I would live there someday. No one in my family had ever lived in an English-speaking country, therefore I was really on my own. However, I never gave up : through the years (more precisely when I started surfing), “I want to live in the US” became “I'm going to go study in California as soon as possible”.


Me surfing on the French Côte Sauvage in 2013

 Holidays at the 2013 US Open of Surfing


Today, I'm 17, and this year is very important because I'll be graduating from high school very soon, which means it's time for me to move ! I kept working hard and learning English to be able to actually make it through the applications : that was way easier to say than to do. You probably know how hard it can be for American students, well, now imagine what it was to do it outside the US, taking the tests and writing the essays in a foreign language ! Anyways, I made it : a month ago or so, I received several letters from Californian universities which said I was accepted. I had never felt so happy !


The Léman Lake when I took the SAT in Geneva.

 Some of the cool letters


Unfortunately, my joy didn't last very long : only the most expensive universities gave me financial aid, and it was so low they remained way too expensive to be considered. As an international student and while managing my backup french applications, it was almost impossible for me to get scholarships, besides, the French State doesn't give me a penny. However, I still have a chance to make it : it's called the California Polytechnic State University San Luis Obispo (known as Cal Poly), whose college of engineering was ranked the US's 7th best undergraduate engineering program by USNews.com. I temporarily accepted Cal Poly's offer of admission, but I won't be able to actually go there without some financial aid : that, is where YOU can come into play !


           When I won my school's carnival as Neil Armstrong with a friend.


A year at the university will cost me and my family around 35.000$, I will most likely have to take a student loan, but in order for it to be reasonable, I would need you to contribute by giving me at least 5.000$ per year, totaling to 20.000$. June the 13th is the day where I'll have to either accept or decline my french offer of admission : if we haven't made it to the goal before then, I will have to stay in France and forget about my dream.

Don't let that happen ! Become a part of this adventure and click the “contribute now” button to send me live my dream at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo !

Find some awesome perks on the right hand side of your screen, please understand that I will do my best to provide these but cannot fully guarantee I will be able to do it. 

 Performing at my town's music night 



VERSION FRANÇAISE :

Je m'appelle Adrien, mais je ne compte plus combien de fois on m'a appelé “l'Américain” : ici, à Grenoble, tous mes amis et mes proches sont au courant de mon rêve. Ça fait des années, depuis que j'ai environ 8 ans, que je suis très attiré par les États-Unis : j'étais encore à l'école primaire quand j'ai commencé à apprendre l'Anglais en disant que j'allais y vivre un jour. Personne dans ma famille n'avait jamais vécu dans un pays anglophone, je me suis donc débrouillé tout seul. Cependant, je n'ai jamais laissé tomber : avec le temps (plus précisément quand j'ai commencé à faire du surf), « Je veux vivre aux États-Unis » est devenu « Je vais aller étudier en Californie le plus vite possible ».


Session surf sur la Côte Sauvage (en France) en 2013

 En vacances à l'US Open de surf en 2013


Aujourd'hui, j'ai 17 ans, et cette année est très importante puisque je suis en terminale, ce qui veut dire qu'il est temps pour moi de partir ! J'ai continué à travailler dur et à apprendre l'Anglais pour arriver à passer les candidatures : c'était plus facile à dire qu'à faire. Si le processus est déjà lourd pour les étudiants Américains, il a été encore plus difficile pour moi : j'ai dû, à plusieurs reprises, passer mes week-ends à Genève pour passer les examens d'admission, mais aussi rédiger de nombreuses dissertations, tout cela en anglais, qui, même si je la maîtrise très bien, n'est quand même pas ma langue maternelle. Quoi qu'il en soit, j'ai réussi : il y a à peu près un mois, j'ai reçu plusieurs lettres d'universités californiennes disant que j'étais accepté. Je n'avais jamais été aussi heureux !


Le lac Léman quand je suis allé passer les tests d'admission à Genève.

 Les lettres d'admission


Malheureusement, ma joie fut de courte durée : seules les universités les plus chères m'avaient octroyé des bourses, et elles étaient bien trop faibles pour rendre ces établissements envisageables. En tant qu'étudiant international et en m'occupant dans le même temps de mes inscriptions « de secours » en France, c'était presque impossible pour moi d'obtenir une bourse privée, de plus, l’État Français ne me donne pas un centime. Mais il me reste une chance d'y arriver, et elle s'appelle l'Université d’État Polytechnique de Californie San Luis Obispo (Cal Poly SLO pour les intimes), dont l'école d'ingénieurs a été classée 7ème meilleur programme de licence d'ingénierie des États-Unis par USNews.com. J'ai temporairement accepté l'offre d'admission de Cal Poly, mais ne serais pas capable de réellement y aller sans un coup de pouce financier : c'est là que VOUS pouvez entrer en jeu !


     Quand j'ai gagné le carnaval du lycée déguisé en Neil Armstrong avec un ami.


Une année à l'université nous coûtera, à moi et ma famille, environ 35 000$, je vais donc très certainement devoir prendre un prêt étudiant, mais pour que ça reste raisonnable, j'aurais besoin de votre contribution à hauteur d'au moins 5 000$ par an, soit un total de 20 000$. Le 14 juin est la date butoir pour donner réponse aux offres d'admission du premier tour sur Admission Post-Bac : je devrai donc prendre ma décision à ce moment, si nous n'avons pas atteint l'objectif d'ici là, je devrais rester en France et oublier mon rêve.

Ne laissez pas ça arriver ! Prenez part à l'aventure en cliquant sur le bouton « contribuer maintenant » et envoyez moi vivre mon rêve à Cal Poly San Luis Obispo !

Vous trouverez de super contreparties sur la droite de l'écran, merci de comprendre que je ferai de mon mieux pour vous les fournir, mais que je ne peux pas complètement garantir leur bonne réception.

 Sur scène à la soirée de l'école de musique

I had never felt so happy !The Léman Lake when I took the SAT in Geneva. Some of the cool letters	Unfortunately, my joy didn't last very long : only the most expensive universities gave me financial aid, and it was so low they remained way too expensive to be considered. As an international student and while managing my backup french applications, it was almost impossible for me to get scholarships, besides, the French State doesn't give me a penny. However, I still have a chance to make it : it's called the California Polytechnic State University San Luis Obispo (known as Cal Poly), whose college of engineering was ranked the US's 7th best undergraduate engineering program by USNews.com. I temporarily accepted Cal Poly's offer of admission, but I won't be able to actually go there without some financial aid : that, is where YOU can come into play !            When I won my school's carnival as Neil Armstrong with a friend.	A year at the university will cost me and my family around 35.000$, I will most likely have to take a student loan, but in order for it to be reasonable, I would need you to contribute by giving me at least 5.000$ per year, totaling to 20.000$. June the 13th is the day where I'll have to either accept or decline my french offer of admission : if we haven't made it to the goal before then, I will have to stay in France and forget about my dream. Don't let that happen ! Become a part of this adventure and click the “contribute now” button to send me live my dream at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo !Find some awesome perks on the right hand side of your screen, please understand that I will do my best to provide these but cannot fully guarantee I will be able to do it.  Performing at my town's music night VERSION FRANÇAISE : 	Je m'appelle Adrien, mais je ne compte plus combien de fois on m'a appelé “l'Américain” : ici, à Grenoble, tous mes amis et mes proches sont au courant de mon rêve. Ça fait des années, depuis que j'ai environ 8 ans, que je suis très attiré par les États-Unis : j'étais encore à l'école primaire quand j'ai commencé à apprendre l'Anglais en disant que j'allais y vivre un jour. Personne dans ma famille n'avait jamais vécu dans un pays anglophone, je me suis donc débrouillé tout seul. Cependant, je n'ai jamais laissé tomber : avec le temps (plus précisément quand j'ai commencé à faire du surf), « Je veux vivre aux États-Unis »  est devenu « Je vais aller étudier en Californie le plus vite possible ».Session surf sur la Côte Sauvage (en France) en 2013 En vacances à l'US Open de surf en 2013	Aujourd'hui, j'ai 17 ans, et cette année est très importante puisque je suis en terminale, ce qui veut dire qu'il est temps pour moi de partir ! J'ai continué à travailler dur et à apprendre l'Anglais pour arriver à passer les candidatures : c'était plus facile à dire qu'à faire. Si le processus est déjà lourd pour les étudiants Américains, il a été encore plus difficile pour moi : j'ai dû, à plusieurs reprises, passer mes week-ends à Genève pour passer les examens d'admission, mais aussi rédiger de nombreuses dissertations, tout cela en anglais, qui, même si je la maîtrise très bien, n'est quand même pas ma langue maternelle. Quoi qu'il en soit, j'ai réussi : il y a à peu près un mois, j'ai reçu plusieurs lettres d'universités californiennes disant que j'étais accepté. Je n'avais jamais été aussi heureux !Le lac Léman quand je suis allé passer les tests d'admission à Genève. Les lettres d'admission	Malheureusement, ma joie fut de courte durée : seules les universités les plus chères m'avaient octroyé des bourses, et elles étaient bien trop faibles pour rendre ces établissements envisageables. En tant qu'étudiant international et en m'occupant dans le même temps de mes inscriptions « de secours » en France, c'était presque impossible pour moi d'obtenir une bourse privée, de plus, l’État Français ne me donne pas un centime. Mais il me reste une chance d'y arriver, et elle s'appelle l'Université d’État Polytechnique de Californie San Luis Obispo (Cal Poly SLO pour les intimes), dont l'école d'ingénieurs a été classée 7ème meilleur programme de licence d'ingénierie des États-Unis par USNews.com. J'ai temporairement accepté l'offre d'admission de Cal Poly, mais ne serais pas capable de réellement y aller sans un coup de pouce financier : c'est là que VOUS pouvez entrer en jeu !     Quand j'ai gagné le carnaval du lycée déguisé en Neil Armstrong avec un ami.	Une année à l'université nous coûtera, à moi et ma famille, environ 35 000$, je vais donc très certainement devoir prendre un prêt étudiant, mais pour que ça reste raisonnable, j'aurais besoin de votre contribution à hauteur d'au moins 5 000$ par an, soit un total de 20 000$. Le 14 juin est la date butoir pour donner réponse aux offres d'admission du premier tour sur Admission Post-Bac : je devrai donc prendre ma décision à ce moment, si nous n'avons pas atteint l'objectif d'ici là, je devrais rester en France et oublier mon rêve. Ne laissez pas ça arriver ! Prenez part à l'aventure en cliquant sur le bouton « contribuer maintenant » et envoyez moi vivre mon rêve à Cal Poly San Luis Obispo !Vous trouverez de super contreparties sur la droite de l'écran, merci de comprendre que je ferai de mon mieux pour vous les fournir, mais que je ne peux pas complètement garantir leur bonne réception. Sur scène à la soirée de l'école de musique

story:
Short Summary

The Freedom Team is a collective of Financial Freedom Fighters who empower families, companies, and communities to break free of debt, build generational wealth and increase their financial intelligence through financial education. In association with the WSB's
National Campaign for Financial Literacy, we have a mission to empower 1 million families with a wealth-building mindset an established financial foundation.

We developed the Financial Freedom Fighter Academy because we believe that our children must be equipped with a proper financial education if want them to excel in the new economy.  Execution without education is a fantasy. Financial literacy is a critical ingredient for financial freedom. The FFFA curriculum is designed to ignite the spirit of pride, community, and wealth-building in our students. We breakdown basic money principles such as "pay yourself first" and the "rule of 72".  We also examine items such as exponential growth, compound interest and so much more.  We will use text such as the "Richest Man in Babylon" and Dennis Kimbro's "Think and Grow Rich: The Black Choice" and much more.  The Financial Freedom Fighter Academy is a virtual, 12-week program that upon completion participants will have a thorough understanding of how to build a financial foundation. They will also be exposed to immediately applicable investment strategies and wealth concepts.  

Currently there is a nearly insurmountable wealth disparity. Knowledge is and always has been the ultimate equalizer. Early exposure is key. Contributions to our campaign will help to increase our ability to serve and empower more students and their families. The FFFA is dedicated to the delivery of financial education. We accept students at any rate they can afford to pledge.  Our monthly is tuition is $60 per month however we understand that cost can be a prohibiting factor. We also know once our Youth are exposed to a wealth-building ideology they will never be the same. Once they complete our program they will see the wisdom in investing in personal development. Also, a small sum such as $60 will never be viewed as an obstacle again. Donations will directly sponsor youth ages 13-20 by subsidizing the tuition for the 12-week wealth academy.  Pretty cool right. We think so too. We want to add prosperity to the culture. Our young people are the culture and they excel at everything they set their hands too. It's up to us to provide them with the knowledge they require to reach their full potential.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $ 10,000.

These funds will be utilized to subsidize tuition, invest in enhanced student experience, and expand our education services.

  • Subsidize Tuition- We eliminated cost as a prohibiting factor. Our tuition is $60 per month ($180 for the complete course). However, we are accepting students at any reasonable rate they pledge. We want affordability to be a non-issue for our students. We believe eliminating this hurdle is essential especially for economically challenged families and/or ambitious youth that sign up with no parental support. As a community we must invest in the development of our young people! We believe that our students should have peace of mind while studying. This is can only be maintained by  community contributions. 
  • Enhanced Student Experience- Our youth are bombarded with information, request, homework, DMs, Hashtags and so much more.  We have to earn their attention and maintain engagement. Our services must be delivered seamlessly and socially. We will enhance our website to include interactive features including a student portal. We will also develop an app that integrates social media platforms our students and their peers are already using. Finally we will hire social influencers to be guest instructors and honorary ambassadors.  
  • Expand Our Education Services- Reaching 500 families is noble but, it is far from enough. We must impact millions of families as soon as possible.  Basic financial literacy and wealth-building mindset are bare necessities in this ever disparate economy. We will use funding to research and develop ways to deliver financial education solutions at the highest level to more families.  
  • Perks- We have had the pleasure of having the support of Black Reign clothing company. The design team at Black Reign created an exclusive line only for FFFA sponsors. They are amazing!

What happens if we don't reach our entire goal?

We will invest everything we have raised into the academy, make as many enhancements as possible, get ready for the next class, and next round of fundraising.  We will not stop failure is not an option.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some won't be able to contribute with money but that does not mean you can't help.

  • Share our campaign on your social media pages.
  • Share the information with guardians or potential participants.
  • Encourage your places of worship, local businesses, and community members to support and share this campaign 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
"Hillywood" to Hollywood... Chasing my dream.


Mijn naam is Frank Maters, ik ben 22 jaar en woon in Hilversum. Het is mijn grote droom om een professioneel film regisseur te worden en ben erg blij dat ik ben toegelaten tot de New York Film Academy voor de studie 'Bachelor of Fine Arts in Filmmaking'. Ik heb de wil, de creativiteit en de kracht om dit te bereiken. Er mist alleen nog een groot onderdeel.. geld.

ENGLISH_
My name is Frank Maters, I am 22 years old and living in Hilversum, NL. It's my dream to become a skilled movie director and am very happy to be accepted at the New York Film Academy in Los Angeles for the study 'Bachelor of Fine Arts in FIlmmaking'. I have the will, the creativity and the power to achieve this. The only big thing I am lacking... money.

Hoe werkt het?

Om de crowdfunding campagne te laten slagen en het zo duidelijk mogelijk te maken heb ik de volgende constructie bedacht. Bedrijven kunnen mij helpen door te doneren met een minimum van 2.500 euro. In ruil hiervoor krijgt u een promotionele bedrijfsvideo gemaakt door mij (Frank). Dit houdt in dat ik een dag langs kom om te filmen en interviews af te nemen en twee montage revisies. Mocht u geïnteresseerd zijn om meer te krijgen (meer opnamedagen, meer montage revisies of een grotere productie waarde) dan is dat altijd mogelijk, ik maak graag een offerte op maat gericht op specifieke wensen. Er zijn drie verschillende levels waarbij de eerste het algemene Indiegogo doel is. Als dit doel wordt gehaald zal het geld worden opgehaald en aan mij worden uitbetaald. Het uiteindelijke doel is om het laatste level te bereiken, wat level 3 is, zodat ik drie jaar kan studeren en mijn Bachelor of Fine Arts in Filmmaking kan gaan halen aan de NYFA in Los Angeles.

·  LEVEL 1  -   50.000 EURO      -  1 JAAR STUDEREN
·  LEVEL 2  -   100.000 EURO   -  2 JAREN STUDEREN
·  LEVEL 3  -   150.000 EURO   -  3 JAREN STUDEREN

ENGLISH_
How does it work?
For the crowdfunding to be successful and perfectly clear I came up with the following construction. Companies can help me by pledging a minimum of 2.500 euros. In exchange I will personally visit your business (for one day) and make a promotional video plus two edit revisions. If you would like more (days, revisions or bigger production value) it is possible to receive a customized proposition. There are three tiers where the first one will be the Indiegogo goal. If this goal is met the money will be collected from you (one of the investors) and transferred to me. The main goal is to reach the final tier, which is tier 3 for the three year long study BFA in Filmmaking at the NYFA in Los Angeles.

·  TIER 1    -  50.000 EUROS    -  1 YEAR   OF COLLEGE
·  TIER 2   - 100.000 EUROS   - 2 YEARS OF COLLEGE
·  TIER 3   - 150.000 EUROS   - 3 YEARS OF COLLEGE


Een uit de hand gelopen aanmeldingsfilm

Mijn eerste korte film genaamd Limbo de film (Limbo the movie) begon als een aanmeldingsfilm voor de Nederlandse filmacademie maar evolueerde in een serieuze gooi naar een korte film door gevestigde namen te casten in de Nederlandse film wereld zoals Manuel Broekman en Kees Boot. Ik heb het gehele budget ook gecrowdfund en contacteerde sponsoren voor de hardware en post-productie zoals Avi-Drome (post-productie bedrijf welke producties maakt zoals The Voice en verschillende Nederlandse speelfilms zoals Simon) en TEAM ENG (facilitair bedrijf welke high-end opname hardware uitleent).

ENGLISH_
An admission film gone crazy
My first short film called Limbo the Movie (Limbo de film) started as an appliance film for the Dutch film academy (Nederlandse Filmacademie) but evolved in a serious short film attempt by casting established names in the dutch film industry for cast and crew like Manuel Broekman and Kees Boot. I crowdfunded the total budget of the movie and contacted sponsors for hardware and post-production facilities like Avi-Drome (post-production company delivering audiovisual productions like The Voice and several dutch features) and TEAM ENG (company delivering high-end video materials for shooting). 

Limbo the Movie

Toen ik door de Nederlandse filmacademie werd afgewezen stopte mij dit niet om door te gaan met de productie van dit korte film project. Nu staat mijn eigen geschreven, geregisseerde en gemonteerde film online op www.limbodefilm.nl.

ENGLISH_
When I was turned down by the dutch film academy it did not stop me from producing my short but kept developing the project. Now my own written, directed and edited short film can be seen here with English subtitles: www.limbodefilm.nl.


De New York Film Academy

In de tijd dat ik Limbo produceerde kreeg ik een e-mail van de NYFA over de mogelijkheid om in Utrecht langs te komen voor acteer opleiding audities. Ik beantwoorde de e-mail met de vraag of het ook mogelijk was om langs te komen voor een kennismakingsgesprek voor de BFA in Filmmaking studie. Dit was mogelijk en ik werd uitgenodigd om langs te komen. Toen ik daar was presenteerde ik voor twee mensen van de school mijn crowdfund video voor Limbo, het script en vertelde over mijzelf. Ongeveer twee weken later ontving ik de mail met het volgende bericht wat misschien wel eens mijn leven zou kunnen veranderen:

"Congratulations on your acceptance to the New York Film Academy! I am pleased to inform you that you have been awarded a Talent Based Scholarship."

ENGLISH_ 
The New York Film Academy 
During the time I was working on Limbo, I received an e-mail from the NYFA presenting their audition opportunity in Utrecht for acting classes. I answered the e-mail with the question if it was possible to come for my audition. Not for acting, but for the study Bachelor of Fine Arts in Filmmaking. I was invited. Once I was there I presented my crowdfunding video for Limbo, it's script and story and spoke about myself. About two weeks later I received the email that would be the start of changing my life: 

"Congratulations on your acceptance to the New York Film Academy! I am pleased to inform you that you have been awarded a Talent Based Scholarship."


De kosten

Geaccepteerd worden is zeker een ding. Echter kosten de vlucht er naar toe en terug (moet helaas ooit een keer), daar leven bij een gastfamilie, eten en drinken, verzekeringen, telefoon kosten en de studie zelf allemaal zo veel geld dat ik nooit alleen ervoor op zou kunnen draaien.

De totale kosten van de opleiding na aftrek van de studiebeurs en de financiële steun die ik van de school zelf krijg bedragen 147.931,56 euro. Dat is berekend door de volgende posten bij elkaar op te tellen:

·  School voor drie jaar
$134.901,00 

·  Vlucht van en naar (AMS Schiphol naar LAX International Airport incl. thuisbezoek)
$2.400,00

·  Gastfamilie
$28.800,00 

·  Eten en drinken
$18.000,00 

·  Zorgverzekering
$1.476,00 

·  Telefoonkosten
$1.800,00 

Studiebeurs en financiële steun die kan worden afgetrokken:

·  Studiebeurs New York Film Academy 
$15.000,00 

·  Extra financiële steun NYFA 
$15.003,00 

Met dit Indiegogo project hoop ik voor mijn studie en de gehele bijbehorende reis te kunnen betalen zodat ik mijn droom kan najagen om een filmregisseur te worden.

ENGLISH_
The costs
Being accepted is surely one thing. The flight to and (at one time) from, living there at a guest parents home, food and drinks, insurance, telephone costs and the study itself all cost money and so much that I would never be able to pay for it.

In total the costs after subtraction of scholarship and financial support are 147.931,56 euros, that's calculated by the following price tags: 

·  School for three years
$134.901,00

·  Flight to and from (AMS Schiphol to LAX International Airport with home visit)
$2.400,00

·  Guest family
$28.800,00

·  Food and drinks
$18.000,00

·  Health insurance
$1.476,00

·  Telephone plan
$1.800,00

Scholarships and financial support which are to be subtracted:

·  Scholarship New York Film Academy
$15.000,00

·  Need Based Tuition Discount NYFA
$15.003,00

With this Indiegogo project I hope to pay for my study and whole journey so I can chase my dream of becoming a film director.


Frankie Goes To Hollywood 

Gaat hij? In elk geval is dat waar ik voor aan het knokken ben! De studie zelf, daar leven, eten, drinken, verzekeringen, vervoer kosten en ga zo maar door zijn alles behalve goedkoop. Met dit crowdfunding project hoop ik dit bedrag bij elkaar te kunnen krijgen om DE droom reis van mijn leven mogelijk te maken.

Zou u mij willen helpen? Dat zou meer dan fantastisch zijn!

ENGLISH_
Frankie Goes To Hollywood
Will he? In any case that's what I am fighting for! The study, living there, food, drinks, insurance, transportation costs and so on are not cheap to say the least. With this crowdfunding project I hope to gather a part of the funds to make this journey possible.

Ready to help me out? That would be great!

New York Film Academy: Los Angeles


Risico's en uitdagingen

Welke grote obstakels of sprongen over grote ravijnen ik ook moet trotseren, ik zal mijn droom najagen om een film regisseur te worden.

Toen ik mijn korte film 'Limbo de film' maakte kwam ik ook verschillende tegenslagen tegen die ik ook heb weten te trotseren. Ik geloof dat dit bewijst dat ik capabel ben om dit soort klappen op te vangen en door te kunnen zetten.

Uw toegezegde donatie zal worden teruggestort wanneer het doel van 50.000 euro niet wordt gehaald. U betaald alleen als ik ook naar Amerika kan gaan!

ENGLISH_ 
Risks and Challenges
No matter what bumps and leaps over big ravines I have to go over, I will always chase my dream to become a movie director.

By making my short film 'Limbo the Movie' I experienced such setbacks and kept on going which I believe proves I have the endurance of completing this journey.

Your pledge will be refunded if the goal of 50.000 Euros is not met. You are not paying if I'm not going!

appliance film for the Dutch film academy (Nederlandse Filmacademie) but
evolved in a serious short film attempt by casting established names in the
dutch film industry for cast and crew like Manuel Broekman and Kees Boot. I
crowdfunded the total budget of the movie and contacted sponsors for hardware
and post-production facilities like Avi-Drome (post-production company
delivering audiovisual productions like The Voice and several dutch features)
and TEAM ENG (company delivering high-end video materials for shooting). 
Limbo
the Movie
Toen ik door de
Nederlandse filmacademie werd afgewezen stopte mij dit niet om door te gaan met
de productie van dit korte film project. Nu staat mijn eigen geschreven,
geregisseerde en gemonteerde film online op www.limbodefilm.nl.

ENGLISH_
When I was turned down by the dutch film academy it did not stop me from producing
my short but kept developing the project. Now my own written, directed and
edited short film can be seen here with English subtitles: www.limbodefilm.nl.
De New York Film
Academy
In de tijd dat ik Limbo produceerde kreeg ik een e-mail van de NYFA over de
mogelijkheid om in Utrecht langs te komen voor acteer opleiding audities. Ik
beantwoorde de e-mail met de vraag of het ook mogelijk was om langs te komen
voor een kennismakingsgesprek voor de BFA in Filmmaking studie. Dit was
mogelijk en ik werd uitgenodigd om langs te komen. Toen ik daar was
presenteerde ik voor twee mensen van de school mijn crowdfund video voor Limbo,
het script en vertelde over mijzelf. Ongeveer twee weken later ontving ik de
mail met het volgende bericht wat misschien wel eens mijn leven zou kunnen
veranderen:

"Congratulations
on your acceptance to the New York Film Academy! I am pleased to inform you
that you have been awarded a Talent Based Scholarship."
ENGLISH_ The New
York Film Academy During the
time I was working on Limbo, I received an e-mail from the NYFA presenting
their audition opportunity in Utrecht for acting classes. I answered the e-mail
with the question if it was possible to come for my audition. Not for acting,
but for the study Bachelor of Fine Arts in Filmmaking. I was invited. Once I
was there I presented my crowdfunding video for Limbo, it's script and story
and spoke about myself. About two weeks later I received the email that would be
the start of changing my life: 
"Congratulations
on your acceptance to the New York Film Academy! I am pleased to inform you
that you have been awarded a Talent Based Scholarship."
De kosten
Geaccepteerd worden is zeker een ding. Echter kosten de vlucht er naar toe en
terug (moet helaas ooit een keer), daar leven bij een gastfamilie, eten en
drinken, verzekeringen, telefoon kosten en de studie zelf allemaal zo veel geld
dat ik nooit alleen ervoor op zou kunnen draaien.

De totale kosten van
de opleiding na aftrek van de studiebeurs en de financiële steun die ik van de
school zelf krijg bedragen 147.931,56 euro. Dat
is berekend door de volgende posten bij elkaar op te tellen:
· 
School voor drie jaar
$134.901,00 
· 
Vlucht van en naar (AMS Schiphol naar
LAX International Airport incl. thuisbezoek)$2.400,00
· 
Gastfamilie
$28.800,00 
· 
Eten en drinken
$18.000,00 
· 
Zorgverzekering
$1.476,00 
· 
Telefoonkosten
$1.800,00 
Studiebeurs
en financiële steun die kan worden afgetrokken:
· 
Studiebeurs New York Film Academy 
$15.000,00 
· 
Extra financiële steun NYFA 
$15.003,00 
Met
dit Indiegogo project hoop ik voor mijn studie en de gehele bijbehorende reis
te kunnen betalen zodat ik mijn droom kan najagen om een filmregisseur te
worden.
ENGLISH_
The costs
Being accepted is surely one thing. The flight to and (at one time) from,
living there at a guest parents home, food and drinks, insurance, telephone
costs and the study itself all cost money and so much that I would never be
able to pay for it.
In total the costs
after subtraction of scholarship and financial support are 147.931,56 euros,
that's calculated by the following price tags: 
· 
School for three years
$134.901,00
· 
Flight to and from (AMS Schiphol to LAX
International Airport with home visit)
$2.400,00
· 
Guest family
$28.800,00
· 
Food and drinks
$18.000,00
· 
Health insurance
$1.476,00
· 
Telephone plan
$1.800,00
Scholarships and
financial support which are to be subtracted:
· 
Scholarship New York Film Academy
$15.000,00
· 
Need Based Tuition Discount NYFA
$15.003,00
With this Indiegogo project I hope to pay for my study and whole journey so I can chase my dream of
becoming a film director.
Frankie Goes To
Hollywood 
Gaat hij? In elk geval is dat waar ik voor aan het knokken ben! De studie zelf,
daar leven, eten, drinken, verzekeringen, vervoer kosten en ga zo maar door
zijn alles behalve goedkoop. Met dit crowdfunding project hoop ik dit bedrag
bij elkaar te kunnen krijgen om DE droom reis van mijn leven mogelijk te maken.

Zou u mij willen helpen? Dat zou meer dan fantastisch zijn!

ENGLISH_Frankie
Goes To HollywoodWill he? In any case that's what I am fighting for! The study, living there, food,
drinks, insurance, transportation costs and so on are not cheap to say the
least. With this crowdfunding project I hope to gather a part of the funds to
make this journey possible.
Ready to help me out? That would be great!

New
York Film Academy: Los Angeles
Risico's en uitdagingen
Welke
grote obstakels of sprongen over grote ravijnen ik ook moet trotseren, ik zal
mijn droom najagen om een film regisseur te worden.
Toen
ik mijn korte film 'Limbo de film' maakte kwam ik ook verschillende tegenslagen
tegen die ik ook heb weten te trotseren. Ik geloof dat dit bewijst dat ik
capabel ben om dit soort klappen op te vangen en door te kunnen zetten.
Uw toegezegde donatie zal worden teruggestort wanneer het doel van 50.000 euro niet wordt gehaald. U betaald alleen als ik ook naar
Amerika kan gaan!ENGLISH_ Risks and Challenges
No matter what bumps and leaps over big ravines I have to go over, I will always chase my dream to become a movie director.
By
making my short film 'Limbo the Movie' I experienced such setbacks and kept on
going which I believe proves I have the endurance of completing this journey.
Your pledge will be refunded if the goal of 50.000 Euros is not met. You are not paying if I'm not going!

story:
Short Summary

Hey! My name is Mel. And I had an idea. 

While the victories for marriage equality and other positive news for LGBTQ folks (and humanity) are great I can't help but get overwhelmed sometimes because almost every day I read about another LGBTQ teen suicide or other tragedy. It is hard not to sink into despair. But then I thought, how could I fight against the despair? And I had an idea.

A Drag Show! I wanted to create something fun; a way to bring the community at large together to celebrate, connect and raise funds for something special. I want to put on a Gender Bending Drag Show with local community members as performers (Drag Queens and Kings and everything in between!). Any net proceeds over the fundraising goal, the proceeds from ticket sales and anything else will be split for two causes. 

The Impact

60% of the net proceeds will go to local programs that support LGBTQ youth (names of which will be shared with contributors once permission is gained from programs). Risks of depression, suicide, homelessness, etc. are real for LGTBQ youth so let's help support them!


Who am I? I am a local human being (I am not a robot, just giving you all some reassurance) that has worked in the trauma field for the past 10 years, advocating for folks experiencing interpersonal violence. I am now on a continued journey in the mental health profession and I am passionate about helping others find their path; their journey. I am joined by my partner in crime and all things silly: John. An amazing actor and an even more amazing partner.

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least 3,000 to cover fees, venue, lighting, props, costumes and makeup, marketing, and perks. If these all end up costing less than 3,000, that will go into the net proceed pot that will be split at the end.

In exchange for contributing, you get some cool perks. Check them out! T-shirts, postcards from characters, signed photos from the Great Queen Kitteez N. Cream (played by local actor and amazing supportive partner John Browning), VIP tickets and more!

But nothing will happen if we don't reach our goal. Funds will be returned and the show...will not go on.

Risks & Challenges

It takes a lot to put on a show. But I have help and I know people with skills in the biz! You know who you are :) So it will be a challenge, but a challenge I know we can meet if we are able to get our fundraising goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may want to contribute in other ways and that is great. Local Artist Lindsey McElroy contributed with her wonderful art for the Drag Managerie (lindseyymc@yahoo.com, Insta: Lindseyyjoan). We also need actors, stage hands, makeup artists, costume magicians, lighting folks, etc. and most of all: We need your help to spread the word about the campaign AND also the show so we can sell those tickets! So please contact me if you would like to help out. Thank you.

story:
The Whyona Institute has been founded in order to collectively fund advertising and marketing in Ireland which counters the  utterly imbalanced output of the Iona Institute. With the referendum on same-sex marriage now just around the corner, the Whyona Institute believes in a balanced counterpoint to every argument. Sadly, we lack the funding of gigantic American corporations as well as ancient Italian churches, and as such request YOUR help to build a social media platform, as well as to fund print and billboard advertising campaigns. 

As well as paying for rebuttal advertising, the Institute will also attempt to inform the public of the true nature of the Iona institute: its membership, its funding, its agenda etc. If you'd like to contribute, please click the link and donate what you can. Anyone donating will be listed on our website as a supporter with thanks. A donation of 10 euro or more will mean your inclusion as a patron of the Whyona Institute, and allow you to write your very own personal biography on our site (if you so choose). Anonymous donations are of course also welcome. 

And if you wouldn't like to contribute financially but would like to hear more, you can keep up to date with the Institute on the following links

Facebook

Twitter

WhyonaInstitute.com (UNDER CONSTRUCTION)


Thanks for reading!

story:
Short Summary

Aashansh is a non-profit organisation with a mission to provide children from underprivileged communities in India with the confidence and knowledge to unlock the door to social mobility, through weekly mentorship sessions and an experiential education programme.

We pair each child with a mentor; a mentor who guides them, supports them and believes in them. Together, mentor and child go on a journey to unearth hidden talents, grow existing ones and build long-lasting friendships, establishing in each child the confidence that they can define their own life.

Ramesh’s dream

Ramesh Joshi, the founder, chairman and director of The Aashansh Foundation was born in Uttaranchal and brought up in Mumbai. When he was first brought to Mumbai, he had the opportunity to study at the army school, one of the best schools in Mumbai. However, after a few years, when he was in the 5th standard, the Army school fees became unaffordable for his family and so he was forced to leave. Fortunately, in addition to school in the morning, Ramesh also attended an NGO’s educational after-school program every afternoon for 10 years, to learn, and sometimes unlearn, what his formal schooling had given him. He went on to attend NGO’s youth social leadership program that motivates young people to lead social change.

But Ramesh, inspired by the hardship he had overcome and the guidance that had been offered to him, desired to go out and make a larger difference. To bring about a greater change…

Ramesh loves children and always struggled to see street children living such a life of hardship. His own experience taught him that education is the only tool that will truly help these children move out of their current situation.

He started Aashansh therefore with the dream to educate as many children as possible, in terms of both emotional and academic support. For him, it is integral that every child has an equal opportunity to fulfill his or her potential.

Ramesh is now working on making his dream become a reality so that underprivileged children can in turn achieve their own dreams, and unlock the door to social mobility.

He has received many awards and recognitions for his work with Aashansh including Ashoka’s youth venture recognition, a vocational award from Rotary club of Mumbai south and recently in 2013 he won Society’s young achiever award.

You can make a difference! Support Us!

Aashansh is currently working with 40 children aged between 6 to 18 in a street community at worli. From our center at century bazar, we teach 250 sessions a year. Combined with 50 mentorship sessions, this comes to nearly 600 hours of interaction with each Aashansh child a year.

Aashansh needs you support to help achieve its mission.

Get Involved

You can be involved with Aashansh in many ways:

Donate

Your contribution will provide us with financial support to run our mentorship and experiential learning program at Aashansh. Although an unrestricted donation helps us makes the most judicious use of your donation, please do let us know if you would like us to direct your donation for a specific purpose.

You can send a cheque in the favor of 'The Aashansh foundation' to Aashansh foundation, highlight films, near blue frog, mathuradas mills compound, N.M. Joshi marg, lower parel, Mumbai, 400013.

For wire transfer kindly get in touch with us on 9820933429.

Volunteer with us

Volunteers are integral part of our mission! Aashansh welcomes you in the mentorship sessions, experiential learning programs and our backed projects with commitment. If you have a specific skill set to contribute to the organisation, we would be happy yo assist you with the same. Write to us at info@aashansh.org to know more about our volunteer opportunities.

Mentor a child

Get in touch with us if you are young, passionate, creative, professional, willing go on a journey with a child from street to unearth hidden potential and build on existing ones and can spend 2 hours of your time in a week to some deserving students at Aashansh to mentor and guide them as best buddy or elder sister. Write to us at info@aashansh.org

story:
In The News

Have you read about the donation of USD700 million given to Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak for his fight against ISIS? If not, google the previous sentence for a raft of news reports and analyses by everyone from independent Malaysian news portals to The Wall Street Journal and The Guardian. In a nutshell and without any judgment, these appear to be the facts:

  • If you are doing something noble and not for your personal benefit, such as fighting ISIS, it is acceptable to receive donations of at least up to USD700 million.
  • Such donations do not have to be declared nor reported to the tax authorities and no account need be given for how the sums donated are spent.
  • This will do away with all red tape of having to register a charitable organisation, form a board of trustees, hold general meetings, apply for tax exemptions, prepare and file accounts, among other things.

Following our leader, I have been inspired to do the same, but I will go one notch lower financially (by limiting my campaign limit to USD7k instead of USD700m) and one notch higher morally (by declaring my intention to use all the funds raised to repair dilapidated rural schools in Sarawak).

How You Can Help 

If I can receive donations of USD7,000 within 60 days (at current exchange rates, that will be around RM28,000 -- a princely sum, since RM28 can buy, to use an easily relateable comparison, a steak dinner with a beer in one of the simple cafes over here), I will spend every cent to buy new doors, windows, toilets, roofing sheets, floorboards, etc, to make some of the worst rural schools halfway habitable

(they're in really bad shape).

Read: http://www.theborneopost.com/2013/11/03/the-shameful-neglect-of-rural-schools/

or just google: dilapidated rural schools sarawak malaysia.

What I Will Do

In return, and in conformation with the donation model set by the Malaysian Prime Minister, I will wage a weekly cyber campaign against ISIS by linking to online articles and other analyses, in an attempt to raise awareness of the nuances of the war against terror. I do believe that many people still see the ISIS threat in over-simplistic terms. To take just one example, the attack on Charlie Hebdo was not simply the assassination of cartoonists who offended the ISIS militants' religious sensibilities, but rather it was a multi-layered propaganda onslaught, to turn Westerners against Muslims, thereby creating an atmosphere of hate which assists their member recruitment drive.

Risks & Challenges

Against the hardship and suffering endured by victims of ISIS terror, all I stand is the risk that the Malaysian authorities will say I am fund raising without complying with bureaucratic regulations.

  • As a advocate/ barrister/ attorney, I will face any charge using the "Prime Minister of Malaysia" defence. If Mr Najib is not required to apply for tax exemption for donations raised towards the noble aim of fighting ISIS, then neither should I.
  • If in the worse case scenario I am required to pay tax or a fine, I undertake to do so from my own personal funds without recourse to the donations raised through the present Indiegogo campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign through Facebook and other social media platforms.
  • Make a trip out to the rural schools in Sarawak to see with your own eyes their dilapidated condition and volunteer your time and physical labor to help in any way you can --after food and shelter, education is the most important thing we can give these children-- you can make a difference.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Following Thanksgiving and the widely recognized shopping events Black Friday and Cyber Monday, November 27, 2018 is "#GivingTuesday", a global day dedicated to giving. This year, please celebrate and support Arch Street Preschool in honor of our achieving STAR 4, the highest standard in the Keystone Stars program! Our STAR 4 designation signifies that Arch Street Preschool meets the highest quality standards in research-based practices to improve outcomes for children. 

Spread the word about our STAR 4 school by liking and sharing our NEW Instagram @ArchStreetPreschool along with the hashtag #GivingTuesday. 

Please also consider making a Tax deductible donation. 

WHAT YOUR GIFT CAN DO:

$10 provides: A professional development training course for a teacher

$20 provides: Winter pajamas for a child for the holidays

$100 provides: A day of play at Arch Street Preschool for a child!
